pre-amended CWUMPO (《修訂前的公司(清盤及雜項條文)條例》) means CWUMPO as in force immediately before the commencement date of the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) (Amendment) Ordinance 2016 (14 of 2016). (Added 14 of 2016 s. 182)

section.name: s49B
section.heading: Notice of commencement of liquidation, etc. and of appointment of liquidator, etc.

subsection.content: Where any proceedings are commenced outside Hong Kong for the liquidation of an authorized insurer or for the purpose of placing an authorized insurer under any other form of insolvency administration, the insurer shall give to the Authority written notice of the commencement of such proceedings, and, where a provisional liquidator or liquidator or a person charged with such other form of insolvency administration is appointed, of such appointment, not later than 3 working days after the event to which the notice relates.

Where a receiver or manager of the property in Hong Kong or elsewhere of an authorized insurer is appointed, the insurer shall give to the Authority written notice of such appointment not later than 3 working days after the appointment.

Where any proceedings are commenced in Hong Kong or elsewhere to enforce a judgment given or order made against an authorized insurer for the payment of money, the insurer shall give to the Authority written notice of the commencement of such proceedings not later than 3 working days after such commencement.

An authorized insurer which fails to comply with any of the provisions of this section commits an offence and is liable to a fine of $200,000 and, in the case of an individual, to imprisonment for 2 years, together with a fine of $2,000 for each day on which the failure to give the relevant notice continues after the expiry of the period prescribed under that provision. (Amended 35 of 1996 s. 24)

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: WorkingDay
def.leadIn: working day (工作日) means a day other than—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a public holiday;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a Saturday; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a gale warning day or black rainstorm warning day as defined by section 71(2) of the Interpretation and General Clauses Ordinance (Cap. 1). (Added 12 of 2015 s. 59)

section.name: s50
section.heading: Requirements to be complied with by Lloyd’s
section.content: During any period when a member of Lloyd’s is carrying on insurance business in Hong Kong, Lloyd’s, a member of Lloyd’s and the members of Lloyd’s taken together shall comply with the relevant requirements contained in this Part.

section.name: s50A
section.heading: Capital requirements
section.content: Sections 10 and 13AA apply to Lloyd’s as if a reference to an applicable company or authorized insurer in those sections were a reference to Lloyd’s.

section.name: s50B
section.heading: Fit and proper management

subsection.content: Lloyd’s shall appoint a person (not being a body corporate) as its authorized representative who shall reside in Hong Kong and be responsible for its overall operation in Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting the generality of subsection (1), the authorized representative shall be responsible for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: accepting service of notices on behalf of Lloyd’s and its members;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: servicing Lloyd’s policy holders in Hong Kong with a view to protecting their interests; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: ensuring compliance by Lloyd’s and its members with the provisions of this Ordinance.

subsection.content: Sections 13A (except section 13A(12)) and 13AB apply to Lloyd’s. (Replaced 12 of 2015 s. 61)
A reference in those sections to an authorized insurer is a reference to Lloyd’s. (Replaced 12 of 2015 s. 61)
A reference in those sections to a controller is a reference to the authorized representative. (Replaced 12 of 2015 s. 61)

Where, subsequent to the appointment of an authorized representative, there is any change in the representative’s particulars as submitted to the Authority under this section, Lloyd’s shall, within one month of such change occurring, notify in writing the Authority. (Amended 12 of 2015 s. 2)
Where Lloyd’s contravenes subsection (7), it commits an offence and is liable, on conviction, to a fine of $200,000 together with a fine of $2,000 for each day on which the offence continues.

section.name: s50BA
section.heading: Appointment of actuary

subsection.content: If Lloyd’s carries on long term business in or from Hong Kong, sections 15AAA, 15AAAB, 15AA, 15AAB, 15AABA, 15AAC, 15B, 15C and 18 apply to Lloyd’s as if Lloyd’s were a non-HK insurer described in section 21B(7).

If Lloyd’s carries on general business in or from Hong Kong, sections 15AAA, 15AAAB, 15AA, 15AAB, 15AABA, 15AAC, 15B, 15C and 18A apply to Lloyd’s as if Lloyd’s were a non-HK insurer described in section 25AA(5).

section.name: s50C
section.heading: Submission requirements

subsection.content: Section 17 applies to Lloyd’s as if a reference to an authorized insurer in that section were a reference to Lloyd’s. (Replaced 20 of 2023 s. 66)

On submitting to the Authority an annual report published by Lloyd’s on its global results under a requirement prescribed by virtue of section 17, Lloyd’s must pay to the Authority a fee equal to the fee paid annually by an authorized insurer under section 13(1). (Amended 12 of 2015 s. 2; 20 of 2023 s. 66)

If it appears to the Authority that Lloyd’s does not intend to effect any contract of insurance in or from Hong Kong after the date on which Lloyd’s submits the annual report mentioned in subsection (9), the Authority may waive the payment of the fee payable in respect of the financial year to which the report relates and any subsequent financial year. (Replaced 20 of 2023 s. 66)
The Authority may revoke the waiver under subsection (10) by a written notice to Lloyd’s, and the revocation takes effect from the date of the notice. (Added 20 of 2023 s. 66)

section.name: s50CA
section.heading: Disclosure requirements
section.content: Section 21A applies to Lloyd’s as if a reference to an authorized insurer in that section were a reference to Lloyd’s.

section.name: s50D
section.heading: Local assets
section.content: Sections 25A, 25B and 25C apply to Lloyd’s as if a reference to an authorized insurer in those sections were a reference to Lloyd’s.
section.sourceNote: (Added 51 of 1999 s. 4. Amended 12 of 2015 ss. 2 & 63; 20 of 2023 s. 68)

section.name: s50E
section.heading: Part X applies to Lloyd’s

subsection.content: Part X applies to Lloyd’s.
A reference in Part X to an insurer or authorized insurer is a reference to a member of Lloyd’s.

section.name: s50F
section.heading: Powers of intervention

subsection.leadIn: The provisions of Part V, except section 40, apply to one or more of the following, as the context may require—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Lloyd’s;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a member of Lloyd’s who carries on insurance business in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the members of Lloyd’s taken together who carry on insurance business in Hong Kong,

subsection.continued: and a reference in those provisions to an authorized insurer is a reference to one or more of Lloyd’s, such member and such group of members. (Amended 12 of 2015 s. 2; 20 of 2023 s. 69)

section.name: s50G
section.heading: Further regulatory powers

subsection.leadIn: The provisions of Part VA, except sections 41P(2)(a), (b) and (c), 41U, 41V and 41W, apply to one or more of the following, as the context requires—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Lloyd’s;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a member of Lloyd’s who carries on insurance business in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the members of Lloyd’s taken together who carry on insurance business in Hong Kong.

subsection.content: A reference in those provisions to an insurer or authorized insurer is a reference to one or more of Lloyd’s, the member and the group of members.
A reference in those provisions to a controller is a reference to the authorized representative appointed under section 50B.

section.name: s50H
section.heading: Part XIII applies to Lloyd’s etc.

subsection.leadIn: The provisions of Part XIII, except section 122, apply to one or more of the following, as the context requires—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Lloyd’s

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a member of Lloyd’s who carries on insurance business in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the members of Lloyd’s taken together who carry on insurance business in Hong Kong.

subsection.content: A reference in those provisions to an insurer or authorized insurer is a reference to one or more of Lloyd’s, the member and the group of members.
A reference in those provisions to a controller is a reference to the authorized representative appointed under section 50B.
Section 122 applies to Lloyd’s and a reference in that section to an authorized insurer is a reference to Lloyd’s.

section.name: s51
section.heading: Exempted persons
section.leadIn: The following persons are exempted from the provisions of this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: any body of persons, corporate or unincorporate, carrying on insurance business in Hong Kong only—

content.leadIn: whose gross premium income does not exceed $500,000 in any financial year:
content.proviso: Provided that if the financial year of any such body is not a period of 12 months, the gross premium income of that body in that financial year is, for the purposes of this paragraph, deemed to be the sum obtained by dividing the amount of its gross premium income by the number of days in that financial year and multiplying the result by 365; and (Amended 20 of 2023 s. 70)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: which consists of persons who are bound together by custom, religion, kinship, nationality or regional or local interest but who are not so bound together or associated for the purpose of the acquisition by them of gain;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a person carrying on in Hong Kong reinsurance business only, other than—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: a body corporate that is incorporated in Hong Kong or is a re-domiciled company;

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a body corporate incorporated outside Hong Kong (other than a re-domiciled company) that has a place of business in Hong Kong or is represented in Hong Kong by an agent;

subparagraph.name: iii

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any registered trade union within the meaning of the Trade Unions Ordinance (Cap. 332) which carries on insurance business limited to the provision for its members of provident benefits or strike benefits;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any registered co-operative society within the meaning of the Co-operative Societies Ordinance (Cap. 33);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the Hong Kong Export Credit Insurance Corporation;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: any authorized institution to the extent only that such institution carries on insurance business of the nature specified in class G or H, or classes 16 and 17, or comprised in groups 1, 7 and 11 in Schedule 1 solely for the purposes of its banking business or deposit-taking business, as the case may be; (Amended 27 of 1986 s. 137; 59 of 1993 s. 13; 49 of 1995 s. 53; 12 of 2015 s. 66)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the Credit Union League of Hong Kong incorporated under Part XI of the Credit Unions Ordinance (Cap. 119); (Amended 68 of 1992 s. 20)

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: a recognized clearing house within the meaning of section 1 of Part 1 of Schedule 1 to the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571) only to the extent that it guarantees the settlement of transactions in securities or futures contracts as defined in that section; (Replaced 5 of 2002 s. 407)

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: a person who is authorized under Part III of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571) to provide automated trading services within the meaning of Schedule 5 to that Ordinance only to the extent that it guarantees the settlement of transactions in securities or futures contracts as defined in section 1 of Part 1 of Schedule 1 to that Ordinance. (Added 5 of 2002 s. 407)

section.name: s53
section.heading: Power of Chief Executive in Council to exempt insurer

subsection.content: The Chief Executive in Council may by order direct that, as respects any insurer specified in the order, such provisions of this Ordinance as may be so specified shall not apply to the insurer or shall apply to the insurer with such modifications or variations as may be so specified.
An order made under this section may be subject to conditions and may be amended or revoked at any time by the Chief Executive in Council.

subsection.def: In this section insurer includes Lloyd’s.

part.name: P8A
part.heading: Secrecy, Disclosure of Information and Examinations by Outside Authorities

section.name: s53A
section.heading: Secrecy

subsection.leadIn: Except in the performance of any function under this Ordinance or for the carrying into effect of the provisions of this Ordinance, every person to whom this subsection applies— (Amended 75 of 1995 s. 7; 12 of 2015 s. 67)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: shall preserve and aid in preserving secrecy with regard to a matter coming to that person’s knowledge either— (Amended 12 of 2015 s. 67)

subparagraph.content: by reason of that person’s appointment under this Ordinance; or

subparagraph.leadIn: in the course of—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: performing a function under this Ordinance, or carrying into effect any provision of this Ordinance; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: assisting another person in performing a function under this Ordinance, or carrying into effect any provision of this Ordinance; (Added 12 of 2015 s. 67)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: shall not communicate any such matter to any person other than the person to whom such matter relates; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: shall not suffer or permit any person to have access to any records in his possession, custody or control or in the possession, custody or control of any other person so appointed or employed.

subsection.name: 1AA
subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) applies to the following person— (Amended 12 of 2015 s. 67)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Authority; (Replaced 12 of 2015 s. 67)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person who is or has been a member, employee, agent, consultant or advisor of the Authority; (Replaced 12 of 2015 s. 67)

paragraph.name: ba
paragraph.content: a person who has been the former authority; (Added 12 of 2015 s. 67)

paragraph.name: bc
paragraph.content: a person who has been a member, employee, agent, consultant or advisor of the former authority; (Added 12 of 2015 s. 67)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a person who is or has been an Advisor appointed under section 35(2)(a); (Amended 12 of 2015 s. 67)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a person who is or has been a Manager appointed under section 35(2)(b); (Amended 12 of 2015 s. 67; 18 of 2020 s. 8)

paragraph.name: da
paragraph.content: a person who is or has been a supervisory manager appointed under section 95ZT(1)(b); and (Added 18 of 2020 s. 8)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a person who is or has been employed by, or who assists or has assisted a person mentioned in paragraph (c), (d) or (da), (Replaced 12 of 2015 s. 67. Amended 17 of 2020 s. 28; 18 of 2020 s. 8)

subsection.continued: and who performs or has performed any function under this Ordinance. (Added 75 of 1995 s. 7. Amended 12 of 2015 s. 67)

subsection.name: 1AAB
subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) also applies to the following persons—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person who is or has been appointed under any provision of this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person who is or has been performing a function under this Ordinance, or carrying into effect any provision of this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a person who assists or has assisted another person in performing a function under this Ordinance, or carrying into effect any provision of this Ordinance. (Added 12 of 2015 s. 67. Amended 17 of 2020 s. 28)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: Subsection (1) shall not apply if the Manager of an authorized insurer, or the supervisory manager of a designated insurance holding company, is required to comply with a notice to furnish returns and information under section 51 of the Inland Revenue Ordinance (Cap. 112). (Added 51 of 1992 s. 14. Amended 12 of 2015 s. 67; 18 of 2020 s. 8)

subsection.leadIn:
No person who receives information, in whatever form, submitted under section 6, 7, 13A, 13AC, 13AE, 13B, 14, 15, 15AAA, 15AAAB, 18, 18A, 19, 32, 32A, 33, 34, 50, 53D, 53E, 53F, 53G, 95I, 95J, 95K, 95L, 95O, 95S, 95X, 95ZF, 95ZG, 95ZH, 95ZI, 95ZJ, 95ZL, 95ZO or 95ZP
or a requirement prescribed by virtue of section 17 may be required to produce to any court any document containing such information or to divulge or communicate to any court any matter or thing coming under the person’s notice in the performance of the person’s functions under this Ordinance, except in the course of— (Amended 44 of 1990 s. 7; 50 of 1992 s. 7; 59 of 1993 s. 14; 12 of 2015 s. 67; 18 of 2020 s. 8; 20 of 2023 s. 71)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a prosecution for any offence;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the determination by the Court of First Instance of an application under section 24; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a winding-up by the Court of First Instance under Part VI, X or XIA. (Amended 25 of 1998 s. 2; 18 of 2020 s. 8; 20 of 2023 s. 71)

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply to the disclosure of information— (Amended 20 of 2023 s. 71)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the form of a summary compiled from similar or related information provided by authorized insurers, licensed insurance intermediaries or designated insurance holding companies if the summary is so compiled as to prevent particulars relating to the business of those insurers, intermediaries or the supervised groups of those companies from being ascertained from the summary; (Replaced 12 of 2015 s. 67. Amended 18 of 2020 s. 8)

paragraph.name: ab
paragraph.content: for seeking advice from, or giving advice by, a counsel or a solicitor, or any other professional advisor acting or proposing to act in a professional capacity, in connection with a matter arising under this Ordinance; (Added 12 of 2015 s. 67)

paragraph.name: bc
paragraph.content: for, or otherwise in connection with, an audit required by section 5F; (Added 12 of 2015 s. 67)

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: in connection with any civil proceedings arising out of this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: ca
cb
paragraph.content: by a person in connection with any judicial or other proceedings to which the person is a party; (Added 12 of 2015 s. 67)

paragraph.name: cc
paragraph.content: in compliance with an order of a court, or in compliance with a law or a requirement made under a law; (Added 12 of 2015 s. 67)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: by the Authority with a view to the institution of, or otherwise for the purposes of, any disciplinary proceedings relating to the performance of his professional duties by a prescribed person; (Replaced 59 of 1993 s. 14)

paragraph.name: da
paragraph.content: by the Authority to a prescribed person for the purpose of enabling or assisting the Authority to discharge its functions under this Ordinance; (Added 59 of 1993 s. 14)

paragraph.name: db
paragraph.leadIn: by a prescribed person where—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the information has been disclosed to that person under paragraph (da); and

subparagraph.name: ii

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: to any of the persons specified in subsection (3AA) if in the opinion of the Authority— (Amended L.N. 106 of 2002; 12 of 2015 ss. 2 & 67)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: it is desirable or expedient that the information should be so disclosed in the interests of existing or potential policy holders or the public interest; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: such disclosure will enable or assist the recipient of the information to perform his functions and it is not contrary to the interests of existing or potential policy holders or the public interest that the information should be so disclosed; (Replaced 75 of 1995 s. 7. Amended 12 of 2015 s. 67)

paragraph.name: ea
paragraph.content: to the Financial Secretary, the Secretary for Justice, the Commissioner of Police, the Commissioner of the Independent Commission Against Corruption and the Tribunal, if the information is obtained by an investigator under sections 41D, 64ZZH and 95ZZG; (Added 12 of 2015 s. 67. Amended 18 of 2020 s. 8)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: by the Authority to an auditor or actuary of an authorized insurer or a licensed insurance broker company, or an auditor appointed under section 95ZF for the supervised group of a designated insurance holding company, if, in the opinion of the Authority, such information is necessary for the auditor or actuary, as the case may be, to discharge the duties of the auditor or actuary under this Ordinance; (Added 75 of 1995 s. 7. Amended 12 of 2015 s. 67; 18 of 2020 s. 8; 20 of 2023 s. 71)

paragraph.name: fa
paragraph.content: by the Authority to the Anti-Money Laundering and Counter-Terrorist Financing Review Tribunal established under section 55 of the Anti-Money Laundering and Counter-Terrorist Financing Ordinance (Cap. 615); (Added 15 of 2011 s. 84. Amended 4 of 2018 s. 40)

paragraph.name: fb
paragraph.content: by the Authority to the Resolution Compensation Tribunal; (Added 23 of 2016 s. 207. Amended 23 of 2016 s. 239)

paragraph.name: fc
paragraph.content: by the Authority to the Resolvability Review Tribunal; (Added 23 of 2016 s. 207. Amended 23 of 2016 s. 239)

paragraph.name: fd
paragraph.content: by the Authority to a resolution authority for the purpose of enabling or assisting the resolution authority to perform its functions under the Financial Institutions (Resolution) Ordinance (Cap. 628); (Added 23 of 2016 s. 207. Amended 23 of 2016 s. 239; E.R. 2 of 2017)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: subject to subsection (3A), by the Authority with the consent of the person from whom the information was obtained or received and if the information relates to a different person, also with the consent of the person to whom the information relates; (Added 75 of 1995 s. 7. Amended 31 of 2000 s. 3)

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: by the Authority if it has been made available to the public by virtue of its being disclosed in any circumstances in which, or for any purpose for which, disclosure is not precluded by this section or section 53B; (Added 75 of 1995 s. 7. Amended 31 of 2000 s. 3; 20 of 2023 s. 71)

paragraph.leadIn: by the Authority if—

subparagraph.content: the information is in the statements and reports submitted by a designated insurance holding company to the Authority under section 95ZH(1); and

in the opinion of the Authority, it is desirable that the information should be so disclosed in the interests of existing or potential policy holders or in the public interest; or (Replaced 20 of 2023 s. 71)

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.leadIn: by the Authority if—

subparagraph.content: the information is submitted to the Authority under a requirement prescribed by virtue of section 17; and
the disclosure is made for statistical purpose for the general understanding of the performance of insurance industry. (Added 20 of 2023 s. 71)

subsection.name: 3AA
subsection.leadIn: The following persons are specified for the purposes of subsection (3)(e)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Chief Executive;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Financial Secretary;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Secretary for Justice;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: an inspector appointed by the Financial Secretary under section 840 or 841 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) to investigate the affairs of a company;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a person holding an authorized statutory office;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a public officer authorized by the Financial Secretary for the purposes of subsection (3)(e). (Added 12 of 2015 s. 67)

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.content: Subsection (3)(g) shall not operate to require the Authority to disclose in or in relation to any civil proceedings any information which the Authority may disclose, or has disclosed, pursuant to that subsection. (Added 75 of 1995 s. 7. Amended 12 of 2015 s. 2)

def.name: AuthorizedStatutoryOffice
def.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (3AA), authorized statutory office (認可法定職位) means— (Amended 12 of 2015 s. 67)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Monetary Authority appointed under section 5A of the Exchange Fund Ordinance (Cap. 66) in the performance of his functions under the Banking Ordinance (Cap. 155) or the Payment Systems and Stored Value Facilities Ordinance (Cap. 584); (Amended 18 of 2015 s. 55; 12 of 2015 s. 67)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Securities and Futures Commission referred to in section 3(1) of the Securities and Futures Ordinance (Cap. 571); (Added 75 of 1995 s. 7. Amended 4 of 1998 s. 3; 5 of 2002 s. 407; 18 of 2006 s. 67)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes Authority established by section 6 of the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes Ordinance (Cap. 485); or (Added 4 of 1998 s. 3. Amended 18 of 2006 s. 67)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the Accounting and Financial Reporting Council continued under section 6 of the Accounting and Financial Reporting Council Ordinance (Cap. 588). (Added 18 of 2006 s. 67. Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

subsection.name: 3C
subsection.content: The Legislative Council may, by resolution, amend subsection (3B) by adding or deleting the authorized statutory offices defined therein. (Added 75 of 1995 s. 7)

subsection.name: 3D
subsection.leadIn: Where information is disclosed in any of the circumstances described in subsection (3), other than subsection (3)(a), (g), (h) and (i), neither— (Amended 31 of 2000 s. 3; 12 of 2015 s. 67)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person to whom that information is disclosed; nor

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any person obtaining or receiving the information, whether directly or indirectly, from the person referred to in paragraph (a),

subsection.continued: shall disclose the information, or any part thereof, to any other person without the consent of the Authority. (Added 75 of 1995 s. 7. Amended 12 of 2015 s. 2)

subsection.name: 3DA
subsection.leadIn: Subsection (3D) does not apply if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the information, or any part of it, has already been made available to the public;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the disclosure is for seeking advice from, or giving advice by, a counsel or a solicitor, or any other professional advisor acting or proposing to act in a professional capacity, in connection with a matter arising under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the disclosure is in connection with any judicial or other proceedings to which the person or the other person referred to in subsection (3D)(a) or (b) is a party; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the disclosure is in compliance with an order of a court, or in compliance with a law or a requirement made under a law. (Added 12 of 2015 s. 67)

subsection.name: 3E
subsection.content: Subject to subsections (2) and (3)(b) and (c), a person who is the Authority, and a person employed or authorized by or assisting the Authority, shall not disclose any information under this section relating to the affairs of any individual policy holder of an insurer. (Added 31 of 2000 s. 3. Amended 12 of 2015 s. 2)

subsection.name: 3F
subsection.content: In disclosing information in any of the circumstances described in subsection (3) or in granting a consent under subsection (3D), the Authority may impose the conditions that it considers appropriate. (Added 12 of 2015 s. 67)

subsection.name: 3G
subsection.leadIn: The Monetary Authority may attach a condition to a disclosure of information made by the Monetary Authority under this section that neither—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person to whom the information is disclosed; nor

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person obtaining or receiving the information, whether directly or indirectly, from the person referred to in paragraph (a),

subsection.continued: may disclose the information, or any part of it, to any other person without the consent of the Monetary Authority. (Added 12 of 2015 s. 67)

subsection.name: 3H
subsection.content: Subsection (3G) does not apply to the disclosure of information made by the Monetary Authority to the Authority. (Added 12 of 2015 s. 67)

subsection.name: 3I
subsection.content: Subsection (1) does not affect the operation of section 13(3) of The Ombudsman Ordinance (Cap. 397) or section 44(8) of the Personal Data (Privacy) Ordinance (Cap. 486). (Added 12 of 2015 s. 67)

subsection.leadIn: Any person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction upon indictment to a fine of $200,000 and, in the case of an individual, to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and, in the case of an individual, to imprisonment for 6 months. (Amended 35 of 1996 s. 26)

subsection.name: 4A
subsection.leadIn: Any person who contravenes subsection (3D) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction upon indictment to a fine of $200,000 and, in the case of an individual, to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and, in the case of an individual, to imprisonment for 6 months. (Added 75 of 1995 s. 7)

subsection.content: In this section, a reference to this Ordinance means this Ordinance as amended from time to time. (Added 12 of 2015 s. 67)

section.name: s53B
section.heading: Disclosure of information

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), and notwithstanding section 53A, the Authority may disclose information to an authority in a place outside Hong Kong where— (Amended 12 of 2015 s. 2)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: that authority performs functions in that place corresponding to the functions of— (Amended 12 of 2015 s. 68)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: the Authority; or (Amended 12 of 2015 s. 2)

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: an authorized statutory office within the meaning of section 53A(3B); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the opinion of the Authority— (Amended 12 of 2015 s. 2)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: that authority is subject to adequate secrecy provisions in that place; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: it is desirable or expedient that the information should be so disclosed in the interests of existing or potential policy holders or the public interest; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: such disclosure will enable or assist the recipient of the information to perform his functions and it is not contrary to the interests of existing or potential policy holders or the public interest that the information should be so disclosed. (Replaced 75 of 1995 s. 8. Amended 12 of 2015 s. 68)

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: Without limiting the generality of subsection (1), the information so disclosed to an authority in a place outside Hong Kong by the Authority may include information on matters relating to the affairs of an insurer— (Amended 12 of 2015 s. 2)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: which is incorporated, or which has its principal place of business, in that place;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: which is incorporated in or outside Hong Kong and which is a subsidiary or associate of an insurer which is incorporated, or which has its principal place of business, in that place; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: which is incorporated in Hong Kong or is a re-domiciled company, and which has, or is proposing to establish, in that place— (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 136)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: an office or agency for the purpose of carrying on any class of insurance business in or from that place; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: a subsidiary or associate which is or would be subject to supervision by that authority. (Added 75 of 1995 s. 8)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.content: Without limiting subsection (1), the information so disclosed to an authority in a place outside Hong Kong by the Authority may include information on matters relating to the affairs of a licensed insurance intermediary. (Added 12 of 2015 s. 68)

subsection.name: 1C
subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2) and despite section 53A, the Authority may disclose information to an authority in a place outside Hong Kong if— (Amended 23 of 2016 s. 240)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that authority performs functions in that place broadly comparable to those of a resolution authority in Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the opinion of the Authority— (Amended 23 of 2016 s. 240)

subparagraph.content: that authority is subject to adequate secrecy provisions in that place; and
the information is necessary to enable or assist that authority to perform functions in that place broadly comparable to those of a resolution authority in Hong Kong. (Added 23 of 2016 s. 208)

subsection.name: 1D
subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2) and despite section 53A, the Authority may disclose information to an authority in a place outside Hong Kong if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: that authority—

subparagraph.content: is an involved supervisor as defined by section 95A(1); or
performs functions in that place broadly comparable to those of a resolution authority in Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: in the opinion of the Authority—

subparagraph.content: that authority is subject to adequate secrecy provisions in that place; and
the disclosure of the information is necessary to enable or assist the Authority to perform its functions under Part XIA. (Added 18 of 2020 s. 9)

subsection.content: The Authority shall not provide any information under this section relating to the affairs of any individual policy holder of an insurer. (Amended 12 of 2015 s. 2)
This section shall apply to Lloyd’s as it applies to insurers.

section.name: s53C
section.heading: Examination by external authorities

subsection.leadIn: Any office or agency of an insurer, carrying on any class of insurance business in or from Hong Kong, shall permit the insurance supervisory authority of a place outside Hong Kong to examine its books, accounts and transactions in Hong Kong if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: that insurer—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: is incorporated, or has its principal place of business, in that place; or

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is incorporated in or outside Hong Kong and is a subsidiary or associate of an insurer incorporated, or which has its principal place of business, in that place; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that insurance supervisory authority has, subject to subsection (2), the approval of the Authority to carry out such an examination.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: A licensed insurance agency must permit an insurance supervisory authority of a place outside Hong Kong to examine its books, accounts and transactions in Hong Kong if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: that agency—

subparagraph.content: is incorporated, or has its principal place of business, in that place; or
is incorporated in or outside Hong Kong and is a subsidiary or associate of an insurance agency incorporated, or which has its principal place of business, in that place; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that insurance supervisory authority has, subject to subsection (2), the approval of the Authority to carry out such an examination. (Added 12 of 2015 s. 69)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.leadIn: A licensed insurance broker company must permit an insurance supervisory authority of a place outside Hong Kong to examine its books, accounts and transactions in Hong Kong if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: that company—

subparagraph.content: is incorporated, or has its principal place of business, in that place; or
is incorporated in or outside Hong Kong and is a subsidiary or associate of an insurance broker company incorporated, or which has its principal place of business, in that place; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that insurance supervisory authority has, subject to subsection (2), the approval of the Authority to carry out such an examination. (Added 12 of 2015 s. 69)

subsection.content: The Authority shall not give an approval referred to in subsections (1)(b), (1A)(b) and (1B)(b) except where in its opinion it is desirable or expedient that the examination concerned should be carried out in the interests of existing or potential policy holders or in the public interest. (Amended 12 of 2015 s. 69)
This section shall apply to Lloyd’s as it applies to insurers.

section.name: s53D
section.heading: Communication by prescribed person with Authority

subsection.leadIn: No duty which a prescribed person may be subject to shall be regarded as contravened by reason of his communicating in good faith to the Authority, whether or not in response to a request made by the Authority, any information or opinion on a matter— (Amended 12 of 2015 s. 2)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: of which he becomes aware in his capacity as a prescribed person (including, in the case of a former auditor, former actuary or former accountant referred to in the definition of prescribed person, a matter of which he became aware when he was an auditor, actuary or accountant, as the case may be, referred to in that definition); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: which is relevant to any function of the Authority under this Ordinance. (Amended 12 of 2015 s. 2)

subsection.leadIn: For the avoidance of doubt, it is hereby declared that a matter referred to in subsection (1) may be a matter which relates to a person other than— (Amended 12 of 2015 s. 70)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an authorized insurer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a former insurer;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a licensed insurance broker company;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a former licensed insurance broker company; (Amended 18 of 2020 s. 10)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a person who was formerly an authorized insurance broker within the meaning of the pre-amended Ordinance; (Added 12 of 2015 s. 70. Amended 18 of 2020 s. 10)

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a designated insurance holding company (or any other member of its supervised group); or (Added 18 of 2020 s. 10)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: a former designated insurance holding company (or any other member of its supervised group). (Added 18 of 2020 s. 10)

section.name: s53E
section.heading: Prescribed person to send report directly to Authority in certain cases relating to authorized insurers

subsection.content: Where a prescribed person (other than an actuary or former actuary), during the discharge of his duties in that capacity in respect of the authorized insurer concerned (including a former insurer), becomes aware of any matter (including, in the case of a former auditor or former accountant referred to in the definition of prescribed person, a matter of which he became aware when he was an auditor or accountant, as the case may be, referred to in that definition) which in his opinion adversely affects the financial condition of the insurer to a material extent, the prescribed person shall, as soon as practicable thereafter, send to the Authority a report in writing of the matter. (Amended 12 of 2015 s. 71)

subsection.leadIn: Where a prescribed person (other than an auditor, former auditor, accountant or former accountant), during the discharge of the person’s duties in that capacity in respect of the authorized insurer concerned (including a former insurer), becomes aware of any situation (including, in the case of a former actuary referred to in the definition of prescribed person, a situation of which the person became aware when the person was an actuary referred to in that definition) which in the person’s opinion— (Amended 12 of 2015 s. 71; 20 of 2023 s. 72)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: creates a material risk that a fund or sub-fund maintained by the insurer under section 21B may be insufficient to meet the liabilities attributable to that fund or sub-fund; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has resulted or may result in the insurer failing to satisfy an obligation in respect of its long term business to which it is or was subject by virtue of this Ordinance,

subsection.continued: the person must, as soon as practicable after becoming so aware, send to the Authority a report in writing of the situation.

subsection.leadIn: Where a prescribed person, during the discharge of the person’s duties in that capacity in respect of the authorized insurer concerned (including a former insurer), becomes aware of evidence (including, in the case of a former auditor, former actuary or former accountant referred to in the definition of prescribed person, evidence of which the person became aware when the person was an auditor, actuary or accountant, as the case may be, referred to in that definition)— (Amended 12 of 2015 s. 71; 20 of 2023 s. 72)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: of a failure by the insurer to comply with any conditions imposed under section 8(1)(a) or 8A(1)(a); (Amended 17 of 2020 s. 18)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that there exists a ground on which the Authority would be prohibited by section 8(3)(a), (b), (d) or (f) from authorizing the insurer if the insurer were to make application in that behalf;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: of a failure by the insurer to comply with section 21B, 22, 23, 25AA, 25AAB or 25AAE; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: of any default of the insurer in complying with any requirement under section 27, 28, 29, 30, 31, 32, 32A, 33, 34 or 35(1),

subsection.continued: the person must, as soon as practicable after becoming so aware, send to the Authority a report in writing of the failure, ground or default.

section.sourceNote: (Added 59 of 1993 s. 15. Amended 12 of 2015 s. 2; 20 of 2023 s. 72)

section.name: s53F
section.heading: Prescribed person to send report directly to Authority in certain cases relating to licensed insurance broker companies, etc.

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a prescribed person who is an auditor of a specified broker becomes aware of evidence of a failure by the specified broker to comply with the specified rules when the person discharges duties in the capacity as an auditor of the specified broker; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a prescribed person who is a former auditor of a specified broker becomes aware of evidence of a failure by the specified broker to comply with the specified rules when the person discharged duties in the capacity as a former auditor of the specified broker.

subsection.content: The prescribed person must, as soon as practicable after becoming aware of the evidence, send to the Authority a report in writing of the failure.
In subsection (1)(b), a reference to evidence includes evidence of which the prescribed person became aware when the person was an auditor of the specified broker.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: specified broker (指明經紀) means—(a)a licensed insurance broker company;(b)a former licensed insurance broker company; or(c)a person who was formerly an authorized insurance broker within the meaning of the pre-amended Ordinance;

specified rules (指明規則)—(a)in relation to a licensed insurance broker company or a former licensed insurance broker company, means rules made under section 129 that set out the requirements—(i)in relation to the capital and net assets of a licensed insurance broker company;(ii)in relation to the professional indemnity insurance taken out by a licensed insurance broker company;(iii)in relation to the keeping of separate client accounts by a licensed insurance broker company; and(iv)in relation to the keeping of proper books and accounts by a licensed insurance broker company;(b)in relation to a person who was formerly an authorized insurance broker within the meaning of the pre-amended Ordinance, means the minimum requirements specified by the former authority under the pre-amended Ordinance—(i)in relation to the capital and net assets of an authorized insurance broker;(ii)in relation to the professional indemnity insurance taken out by an authorized insurance broker;(iii)in relation to the keeping of separate client accounts by an authorized insurance broker; and(iv)in relation to the keeping of proper books and accounts by an authorized insurance broker.

section.name: s53G
section.heading: Prescribed person to send report directly to Authority in certain cases relating to designated insurance holding companies

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if a prescribed person, when discharging the person’s duties in that capacity in relation to the supervised group of a specified company, becomes aware of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a matter that, in the person’s opinion, adversely affects the financial condition of the group to a material extent; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: evidence of a failure by the company to comply with a specified requirement.

subsection.content: The prescribed person must, as soon as practicable after becoming aware of the matter or evidence, send to the Authority a written report of the matter or failure.

In subsection (1), a reference to a matter or evidence includes a matter or evidence of which the prescribed person became aware when the person was a prescribed person in relation to the supervised group of the specified company.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: prescribed person (訂明人士) means a person who falls within paragraph (d) or (e) of the definition of prescribed person in section 2(1);
specified company (指明公司) means—(a)a designated insurance holding company; or(b)a former designated insurance holding company;

specified requirement (指明規定), in relation to a specified company, means—(a)section 95H(1);(b)section 95ZI(3) or (5);(c)section 95ZJ(1); or(d)a requirement imposed by the Authority under section 95ZO, 95ZP, 95ZQ or 95ZR on the company.

part.name: P9A
part.heading: Certain Contracts of Insurance to be Void

section.name: s64A
section.heading: Interpretation (Part IXA)

subsection.leadIn: In this Part—
subsection.def: guardian (監護人) means a guardian appointed under or acting by virtue of the Guardianship of Minors Ordinance (Cap. 13);
parent (父母), in relation to a minor, means father or mother.

subsection.content: For the purpose of this Part, a parent of a minor, or a guardian of a ward under 18 years of age, shall be deemed to have an interest in the life of the minor or the ward, as the case may be.

section.name: s64B
section.heading: No contract of insurance to be made without interest

subsection.leadIn: No contract of insurance shall be entered into on the life of any person or on any other event—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the person for whose use or benefit or on whose account the contract is to be entered into has no interest; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: by way of gaming or wagering.

subsection.content: A contract of insurance entered into in contravention of subsection (1) is void by reason of that contravention.

section.name: s64C
section.heading: No contract of insurance on lives without inserting the persons’ names, etc.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsections (3) and (4), no contract of insurance shall be entered into on the life of any person or other event without inserting in the contract the name of the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: interested in the life or event; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for whose use or benefit or on whose account the contract is entered into.

subsection.content: A contract of insurance entered into in contravention of subsection (1) is void by reason of that contravention.

Subsections (1) and (2) shall not invalidate a contract of insurance for the benefit of unnamed persons from time to time falling within a specified class or description if the class or description is stated in the contract with sufficient particularity to make it possible to establish the identity of all persons who at any given time are entitled to benefit under the contract.

Subsection (3) applies to contracts of insurance effected before the commencement of the Insurance Companies (Amendment) Ordinance 1985 (8 of 1985) as well as to contracts of insurance effected thereafter.

section.name: s64D
section.heading: Recoverable amount
section.content: Where the insured under a contract of insurance has an interest in a life or event, no greater sum shall be recovered from the insurer under the contract than the amount of value of the interest of the insured in that life or event.

section.name: s64E
section.heading: Not to extend to ships, etc.
section.content: It is hereby declared that the provisions of this Part shall not extend, or be construed to extend, to contracts of insurance bona fide made by any person on ships, goods or merchandise.

section.name: s64F
section.heading: Interpretation of Part X
section.leadIn: In this Part—
section.def: agency agreement (代理協議) means an agreement entered into between an authorized insurer and a licensed insurance agency or licensed individual insurance agent under which the licensed insurance agency or licensed individual insurance agent is appointed to carry on regulated activities as an agent of the insurer;
business record (業務紀錄), in relation to a licensed insurance intermediary, means a record or document relating to a regulated activity carried on by the intermediary;

controller (控權人)—(a)in relation to a sole proprietorship—(i)means an individual who ultimately owns or controls the carrying on of regulated activities by the sole proprietorship; or(ii)if the sole proprietor is acting on behalf of another person, means the other person;(b)in relation to a partnership, means an individual who—(i)is entitled to or controls, directly or indirectly, not less than a 15% share of the capital or profits of the partnership;(ii)is, directly or indirectly, entitled to exercise or control the exercise of not less than 15% of the voting rights in the partnership; or(iii)exercises ultimate control over the management of the partnership; or(c)in relation to a company, means a person who—(i)owns or controls, directly or indirectly, including through a trust or bearer share holding, not less than 15% of the issued share capital of the company;(ii)is, directly or indirectly, entitled to exercise or control the exercise of not less than 15% of the voting rights at general meetings of the company; or(iii)exercises ultimate control over the management of the company;
inspector (查察員) means a person appointed as an inspector under section 64ZZF(6);
investigator (調查員) means a person directed or appointed by the Authority under section 64ZZH(1) to investigate any matter;

licence (牌照)—(a)in relation to a licensed insurance agency—means an insurance agency licence granted under section 64U or renewed under section 64ZV;(b)in relation to a licensed individual insurance agent—means an individual insurance agent licence granted under section 64W or renewed under section 64ZV;(c)in relation to a licensed technical representative (agent)—means a technical representative (agent) licence granted under section 64Y or renewed under section 64ZV;(d)in relation to a licensed insurance broker company—means an insurance broker company licence granted under section 64ZA or renewed under section 64ZV; or(e)in relation to a licensed technical representative (broker)—means a technical representative (broker) licence granted under section 64ZC or renewed under section 64ZV;
licensee (持牌人), in relation to a licence, means the holder of the licence.

section.name: s64G
section.heading: Restrictions on carrying on regulated activities

subsection.leadIn: A person must not carry on a regulated activity—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the course of the person’s business or employment; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for reward.

subsection.leadIn: A person must not hold out that the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is carrying on a regulated activity in the course of the person’s business or employment; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is carrying on a regulated activity for reward.

subsection.leadIn: This section does not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: prohibit a licensed insurance agency from—

subparagraph.content: carrying on regulated activities as an agent of an authorized insurer by which the licensed insurance agency is appointed; or
holding out that the licensed insurance agency carries on regulated activities as such an agent;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: prohibit a licensed individual insurance agent from—

subparagraph.content: carrying on regulated activities as an agent of an authorized insurer by which the licensed individual insurance agent is appointed; or
holding out that the licensed individual insurance agent carries on regulated activities as such an agent;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: prohibit a licensed technical representative (agent) from—

subparagraph.content: carrying on regulated activities as an agent of a licensed insurance agency by which the licensed technical representative (agent) is appointed; or
holding out that the licensed technical representative (agent) carries on regulated activities as such an agent;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: prohibit a licensed insurance broker company from—

subparagraph.content: carrying on regulated activities specified in section 1(a) of Part 1 of Schedule 1A as an agent of a policy holder or potential policy holder;
holding out that the licensed insurance broker company carries on regulated activities specified in section 1(a) of Part 1 of Schedule 1A as such an agent;
carrying on regulated activities specified in section 1(b), (c) and (d) of Part 1 of Schedule 1A; or
holding out that the licensed insurance broker company carries on regulated activities specified in section 1(b), (c) and (d) of Part 1 of Schedule 1A; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: prohibit a licensed technical representative (broker) from—

subparagraph.content: carrying on regulated activities as an agent of a licensed insurance broker company by which the licensed technical representative (broker) is appointed; or
holding out that the licensed technical representative (broker) carries on regulated activities as such an agent.

subsection.leadIn: A person who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $20,000 for each day during which the offence continues; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months and, in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $2,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

subsection.content: This section is subject to section 123.

section.name: s64H
section.heading: Application of section 64G in relation to marketing insurance services outside Hong Kong

subsection.leadIn: If a person actively markets to the public, from a place outside Hong Kong, insurance services that the person provides, the person is to be regarded as holding out that the person is carrying on a regulated activity for the purposes of section 64G(2).

subsection.content: Subsection (1) applies regardless of whether the insurance services are marketed by the person or someone on behalf of the person.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: insurance services (保險服務) means services that would constitute a regulated activity if the services were provided in Hong Kong.

section.name: s64I
section.heading: Restrictions in relation to number of authorized insurers of each licensed insurance agency, etc.

subsection.content: A person must not, at any time, be appointed as a licensed insurance agency or licensed individual insurance agent in carrying on a regulated activity for more than the maximum number of authorized insurers that are prescribed by rules made under section 129.
A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 6.

If an authorized insurer knows that a person is appointed as a licensed insurance agency or licensed individual insurance agent in carrying on regulated activities for the prescribed maximum number or more of authorized insurers, that insurer must not appoint that person to carry on a regulated activity as an agent of the insurer.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized insurer which contravenes subsection (3) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6.

section.name: s64J
section.heading: Restrictions in relation to personnel of licensed insurance agencies

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to a person who is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a proprietor or a partner of a licensed insurance agency; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a director or an employee of a licensed insurance agency who manages or controls any matter relating to a regulated activity of the agency.

subsection.leadIn: The person must not also be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a proprietor or a partner of another licensed insurance agency;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a licensed individual insurance agent;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a licensed technical representative (agent) of another licensed insurance agency;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a licensed technical representative (broker);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: a director or an employee of another licensed insurance agency who manages or controls any matter relating to a regulated activity of that other agency; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a director or an employee of a licensed insurance broker company who manages or controls any matter relating to a regulated activity of that company.

subsection.content: A person who contravenes subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s64K
section.heading: Restrictions in relation to personnel of licensed insurance broker companies

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to a person who—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is a director or an employee of a licensed insurance broker company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: manages or controls any matter relating to a regulated activity of the company.

subsection.leadIn: The person must not also be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a proprietor or a partner of a licensed insurance agency;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a licensed individual insurance agent;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a licensed technical representative (agent); or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a director or an employee of a licensed insurance agency who manages or controls any matter relating to a regulated activity of the agency.

subsection.content: A person who contravenes subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s64L
section.heading: Restrictions in relation to licensed technical representatives (agent)

subsection.content: A person who is a licensed technical representative (agent) of a licensed insurance agency must not also be a licensed technical representative (agent) of another licensed insurance agency.

A person who is a licensed technical representative (agent) must not carry on regulated activities in a line of business unless the licensed insurance agency by which the person is appointed is also licensed to carry on regulated activities in that line of business.

section.name: s64M
section.heading: Restrictions in relation to licensed technical representatives (broker)
section.content: A person who is a licensed technical representative (broker) must not carry on regulated activities in a line of business unless the licensed insurance broker company by which the person is appointed is also licensed to carry on regulated activities in that line of business.

section.name: s64N
section.heading: Contracts of insurance made through persons other than licensed insurance intermediaries, etc.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized insurer must not enter into a contract of insurance through another person in Hong Kong unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: that person is—

subparagraph.content: a licensed insurance agency or a licensed individual insurance agent appointed by the insurer; or
a licensed insurance broker company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that person’s duties only involve clerical or administrative duties.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized insurer must not accept a referral of insurance business from another person in Hong Kong unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: that person is—

subparagraph.content: a licensed insurance agency or a licensed individual insurance agent appointed by the insurer; or

subparagraph.leadIn: a licensed insurance broker company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that person’s duties only involve clerical or administrative duties.

subsection.leadIn: If an authorized insurer enters into a contract of insurance in contravention of subsection (1), the contract, at the option of the policy holder—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is enforceable against the insurer by the policy holder despite the contravention; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is void because of the contravention.

subsection.content: A policy holder who under subsection (3)(b) opts to void a contract of insurance before the expiry of the contract is entitled to recover any consideration paid by the policy holder under the contract.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized insurer which contravenes subsection (1) or (2) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s64O
section.heading: Register of licensed insurance intermediaries

subsection.leadIn: The Authority must keep a register of licensed insurance intermediaries, in a form it thinks fit, containing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name or names, and the reference number assigned by the Authority, of each licensed insurance intermediary, and if applicable, the name of each of its responsible officers;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the business address of each licensed insurance intermediary;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the conditions of the licence of each licensed insurance intermediary;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the conditions of approval of each responsible officer;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the period for which the licence of each licensed insurance intermediary is valid;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to each licensed insurance agency—

subparagraph.content: the name of each of the authorized insurers by which the licensed insurance agency is appointed;
the date of appointment; and
the date on which the appointment is terminated (if applicable);

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to each licensed individual insurance agent—

subparagraph.content: the name of each of the authorized insurers by which the licensed individual insurance agent is appointed;
the date of appointment; and
the date on which the appointment is terminated (if applicable);

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.leadIn: in relation to each licensed technical representative (agent)—

subparagraph.content: the name of the licensed insurance agency by which the licensed technical representative (agent) is appointed;
the date of appointment;
the date on which the appointment is terminated (if applicable); and
information on whether the licensed technical representative (agent) is a responsible officer of the licensed insurance agency;

paragraph.leadIn: in relation to each licensed technical representative (broker)—

subparagraph.content: the name of each of the licensed insurance broker company by which the licensed technical representative (broker) is appointed;
the date of appointment;
the date on which the appointment is terminated (if applicable); and
information on whether the licensed technical representative (broker) is a responsible officer of the licensed insurance broker company;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: the line or lines of business which each licensed insurance intermediary may carry on;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: a record of every disciplinary action (except a private reprimand) taken by a specified authority against any licensed insurance intermediary or responsible officer in the last 5 years, and if a suspension is involved, the period of the suspension;
if a licence is suspended under this Part, a note to that effect;

paragraph.name: m
paragraph.content: if a licensed insurance broker company notifies the Authority of cessation of carrying on regulated activities under section 64T, a note to that effect; and

paragraph.name: n
paragraph.content: any other particulars that are prescribed by rules made under section 129.

subsection.leadIn: A person may, at all reasonable times—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the register is kept in a documentary form—inspect the register free of charge; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the register is kept otherwise than in a documentary form—inspect a reproduction in a legible form of any information recorded in the register free of charge.

subsection.leadIn: A person may, at all reasonable times and on payment of a prescribed fee, obtain—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a copy of an entry in, or extract of, the register; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a copy of the entry or extract, certified by an authorized officer of the Authority as a true copy of the entry or extract.

subsection.leadIn: A right under subsection (2) or (3) is only exercisable for enabling a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to ascertain whether the person is dealing with a licensed insurance intermediary or a responsible officer in matters of or connected with any regulated activity; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: to ascertain the particulars of—

subparagraph.content: the licensing of a person as a licensed insurance intermediary; or
the approval of an individual as a responsible officer.

subsection.leadIn: In any legal proceedings—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a document purporting to be a copy of an entry in, or extract of, the register, and purporting to be certified by an authorized officer of the Authority as a true copy of the entry or extract, is admissible in evidence on its production without further proof; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: unless there is evidence to the contrary, on being admitted in evidence under paragraph (a), the document—

subparagraph.content: is presumed to be certified by an authorized officer of the Authority;
is presumed to be a true copy of the entry or extract; and
is proof of its contents.

subsection.content: The Authority must, as far as practicable, make the register available to any person for inspection free of charge on the Internet.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: *commencement date (生效日期) means the date on which section 74 of the Amendment Ordinance comes into operation;

specified authority (指明當局) means—(a)in relation to a disciplinary action taken on or after the commencement date—the Authority; or(b)in relation to a disciplinary action taken before the commencement date—(i)the Insurance Agents Registration Board set up by the Hong Kong Federation of Insurers; or(ii)a body of insurance brokers approved under section 70 of the pre-amended Ordinance.

section.name: s64P
section.heading: Duty to notify Authority of change in particulars

subsection.content: This section applies if there is a change in any of the particulars specified in subsection (2) of a licensed insurance intermediary or a responsible officer of a licensed insurance intermediary after the particulars are provided by the licensed insurance intermediary for a licence application.

subsection.leadIn: The particulars are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: name;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: business or residential address;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: telephone number;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: electronic mail address; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any other particulars that are prescribed by rules made under section 129.

subsection.name: 2A
subsection.content: If a licensed insurance intermediary that is a non-Hong Kong company later becomes a re-domiciled company, the licensed insurance intermediary must notify the Authority in writing of such fact within 14 days after it becomes a re-domiciled company. (Added 14 of 2025 s. 137)
The licensed insurance intermediary must notify the Authority in writing of any change of particulars within 14 days after the date on which the change takes place.
A notification under subsection (3) must be accompanied by a prescribed fee.
The Authority must, as soon as practicable after receiving a notification under subsection (3), amend any relevant particulars in the register kept under section 64O.
A licensed insurance intermediary who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (3) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 5.

section.name: s64Q
section.heading: Duty to notify Authority of appointment

subsection.content: At least 14 days before an authorized insurer appoints a licensed insurance agency to carry on regulated activities in one or more lines of business as an agent of the insurer, the insurer must notify the Authority in writing of the intended appointment.

At least 14 days before an authorized insurer appoints a licensed individual insurance agent to carry on regulated activities in one or more lines of business as an agent of the insurer, the insurer must notify the Authority in writing of the intended appointment.

At least 14 days before a licensed insurance agency appoints a licensed technical representative (agent) to carry on regulated activities in one or more lines of business as an agent of the agency, the agency must notify the Authority in writing of the intended appointment.

At least 14 days before a licensed insurance broker company appoints a licensed technical representative (broker) to carry on regulated activities in one or more lines of business as an agent of the company, the company must notify the Authority in writing of the intended appointment.

subsection.leadIn: The notification must be accompanied by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a prescribed fee; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the particulars that are prescribed by rules made under section 129.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority must, after receiving a notification under subsection (1), (2), (3) or (4), update the register kept under section 64O accordingly unless the Authority is of the view that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to subsection (1), the licensed insurance agency has not complied with, or will be unable to comply with, the provisions of this Ordinance relating to a licensed insurance agency;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to subsection (2), the licensed individual insurance agent has not complied with, or will be unable to comply with, the provisions of this Ordinance relating to a licensed individual insurance agent;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to subsection (3), the licensed technical representative (agent) has not complied with, or will be unable to comply with, the provisions of this Ordinance relating to a licensed technical representative (agent); or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in relation to subsection (4), the licensed technical representative (broker) has not complied with, or will be unable to comply with, the provisions of this Ordinance relating to a licensed technical representative (broker).

subsection.content: A person who contravenes subsection (1), (2), (3) or (4) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 5.

section.name: s64R
section.heading: Duty to notify Authority of termination of appointment

subsection.content: Within 14 days after the date on which an authorized insurer terminates the appointment of a licensed insurance agency or licensed individual insurance agent, the insurer must notify the Authority in writing of the termination.

Within 14 days after the date on which a licensed insurance agency terminates the appointment of a licensed technical representative (agent), the agency must notify the Authority in writing of the termination.

Within 14 days after the date on which a licensed insurance broker company terminates the appointment of a licensed technical representative (broker), the company must notify the Authority in writing of the termination.

Within 14 days after the date on which the appointment of a responsible officer of a licensed insurance agency or licensed insurance broker company is terminated, the agency or company must notify the Authority in writing of the termination.
The Authority must, as soon as practicable after receiving a notification under subsection (1), (2), (3) or (4), amend any relevant particulars in the register kept under section 64O.
A person who contravenes subsection (1), (2), (3) or (4) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 5.

section.name: s64S
section.heading: Application for varying lines of business

subsection.content: A licensed insurance intermediary may apply to the Authority for the approval of the variation of a line of business specified in the licence of the intermediary.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may approve the variation of a line of business of the applicant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on an application made in the manner specified by the Authority; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on payment of a prescribed fee.

subsection.content: The application under subsection (1) must be accompanied by the particulars that are prescribed by rules made under section 129.

The Authority must not approve the variation unless it is satisfied that the applicant is a fit and proper person to carry on regulated activities in the line or lines of business after the variation.
The Authority must give the applicant a notice in writing of the result of the application made under subsection (1).
If the application is rejected, the notice must include a statement of the reasons for the rejection.
The Authority must, as soon as practicable after granting the approval under subsection (2), amend any relevant particulars in the register kept under section 64O.

section.name: s64T
section.heading: Duty to notify Authority of cessation of carrying on of regulated activities by licensed insurance broker companies

subsection.content: At least 3 months before a licensed insurance broker company ceases to carry on regulated activities, the company must notify the Authority in writing of the intention to do so and the intended date of cessation.

subsection.leadIn: A licensed insurance broker company which ceases to carry on regulated activities must prepare—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an auditor’s report on the financial statements which are to be made up to (and including) the date of cessation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: an auditor’s report stating whether the auditor is of the opinion that the company has, until the date of cessation, continued to comply with rules made under section 129 that set out the requirements—

subparagraph.content: in relation to the capital and net assets of a licensed insurance broker company;
in relation to the professional indemnity insurance taken out by a licensed insurance broker company;
in relation to the keeping of separate client accounts by a licensed insurance broker company; and
in relation to the keeping of proper books and accounts by a licensed insurance broker company; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other documents that are prescribed by rules made under section 129.

subsection.content: A licensed insurance broker company must submit to the Authority the documents specified in subsection (2) not later than 6 months after the date of cessation.
The Authority must, as soon as practicable after receiving a notification under subsection (1), amend any relevant particulars in the register kept under section 64O.
A licensed insurance broker company which, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1), (2) or (3) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 5.

section.name: s64U
section.heading: Grant of licence—insurance agency

subsection.content: A sole proprietor, partnership or company may apply to the Authority for an insurance agency licence to carry on regulated activities in one or more lines of business, as an agent of any authorized insurer.

For a partnership, the application for an insurance agency licence may only be made by a partner authorized by the partnership on behalf of the partnership and, if the licence is granted, it is to be expressed to be granted to that partner on behalf of the partnership.

subsection.leadIn: An application made under subsection (1) must be accompanied by either—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: both of the following—

subparagraph.content: an application made by an individual under section 64Y for a technical representative (agent) licence;
an application made by the applicant under section 64ZE for the approval of the individual as a responsible officer of the applicant; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an application made by the applicant under section 64ZE for the approval of a licensed technical representative (agent) as a responsible officer of the applicant.
