subsection.content: On an application made in the manner specified by the Authority and on payment of a prescribed fee, the Authority may grant to the applicant an insurance agency licence to carry on regulated activities in one or more lines of business specified in the licence, as an agent of any authorized insurer.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority must not grant the licence unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: it is satisifed that—

subparagraph.leadIn: if the applicant is a sole proprietor—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the applicant is a fit and proper person to carry on regulated activities in the lines of business concerned; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: where there is a controller in relation to the applicant, the controller is a fit and proper person to be associated with the carrying on of regulated activities in those lines of business;

subparagraph.leadIn: if the applicant is a partnership—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: each partner of the applicant is a fit and proper person to carry on regulated activities in the lines of business concerned; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: where there is a controller in relation to the applicant, the controller is a fit and proper person to be associated with the carrying on of regulated activities in those lines of business; or

subparagraph.leadIn: if the applicant is a company—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the applicant is a fit and proper person to carry on regulated activities in the lines of business concerned;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: each director of the applicant is a fit and proper person to be associated with the carrying on of regulated activities in those lines of business; and

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: where there is a controller in relation to the applicant, the controller is a fit and proper person to be associated with the carrying on of regulated activities in those lines of business;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it is satisfied that the applicant is appointed as an agent by at least one authorized insurer;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: it is satisfied that the applicant is neither the holder of a licence granted under section 64W, 64Y, 64ZA or 64ZC nor applying for such a licence; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: it is satisfied that either—

subparagraph.leadIn: both of the following—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: an accompanying application is made for subsection (3)(a)(i) and the criteria for the grant of licence under section 64Y(3) are satisfied;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: an accompanying application is made for subsection (3)(a)(ii) and the criteria for the approval under section 64ZE(4) are satisfied; or
an accompanying application is made for subsection (3)(b) and the criteria for the approval under section 64ZE(4) are satisfied.

subsection.content: If the Authority grants an application made under subsection (1), the Authority must also grant the accompanying applications made for subsection (3).
If the Authority rejects an application made under subsection (1), the Authority must also reject the accompanying applications made for subsection (3).
The Authority must give the applicant a notice in writing of the result of the application made under subsection (1).
If the application is rejected, the notice must include a statement of the reasons for the rejection.

section.name: s64V
section.heading: Validity of insurance agency licence
section.content: A licence granted under section 64U is valid for 3 years or, if the Authority considers it appropriate in a particular case, another period determined by the Authority, beginning on the date on which it is granted.

section.name: s64W
section.heading: Grant of licence—individual insurance agent

subsection.content: An individual may apply to the Authority for an individual insurance agent licence to carry on regulated activities in one or more lines of business, as an agent of any authorized insurer.

On an application made in the manner specified by the Authority and on payment of a prescribed fee, the Authority may grant to the applicant an individual insurance agent licence to carry on regulated activities in one or more lines of business specified in the licence, as an agent of any authorized insurer.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority must not grant the licence unless it is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the applicant is a fit and proper person to carry on regulated activities in the lines of business concerned;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the applicant is appointed as an agent by at least one authorized insurer; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the applicant is neither the holder of a licence granted under section 64U, 64Y or 64ZC nor applying for such a licence.

subsection.content: The Authority must give the applicant a notice in writing of the result of the application made under subsection (1).
If the application is rejected, the notice must include a statement of the reasons for the rejection.

section.name: s64X
section.heading: Validity of individual insurance agent licence
section.content: A licence granted under section 64W is valid for 3 years or, if the Authority considers it appropriate in a particular case, another period determined by the Authority, beginning on the date on which it is granted.

section.name: s64Y
section.heading: Grant of licence—technical representative (agent)

subsection.content: An individual may apply to the Authority for a technical representative (agent) licence to carry on regulated activities in one or more lines of business, as an agent of any licensed insurance agency.

On an application made in the manner specified by the Authority and on payment of a prescribed fee, the Authority may grant to the applicant a technical representative (agent) licence to carry on regulated activities in one or more lines of business specified in the licence, as an agent of any licensed insurance agency.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority must not grant the licence unless it is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the applicant is a fit and proper person to carry on regulated activities in the lines of business concerned;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the applicant is appointed as an agent by—

subparagraph.content: a licensed insurance agency; or
a person who applies under section 64U for an insurance agency licence; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the applicant is neither the holder of a licence granted under section 64U, 64W or 64ZC nor applying for such a licence.

subsection.content: The Authority must give the applicant a notice in writing of the result of the application made under subsection (1).
If the application is rejected, the notice must include a statement of the reasons for the rejection.

section.name: s64Z
section.heading: Validity of technical representative (agent) licence
section.content: A licence granted under section 64Y is valid for 3 years or, if the Authority considers it appropriate in a particular case, another period determined by the Authority, beginning on the date on which it is granted.

section.name: s64ZA
section.heading: Grant of licence—insurance broker company

subsection.leadIn: A company may apply to the Authority for an insurance broker company licence to carry on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: regulated activities specified in section 1(a) of Part 1 of Schedule 1A in one or more lines of business, as an agent of any policy holder or potential policy holder; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: regulated activities specified in section 1(b), (c) and (d) of Part 1 of Schedule 1A in one or more lines of business.

subsection.leadIn: An application made under subsection (1) must be accompanied by either—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: both of the following—

subparagraph.content: an application made by an individual under section 64ZC for a technical representative (broker) licence;
an application made by the applicant under section 64ZF for the approval of the individual as a responsible officer of the applicant; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an application made by the applicant under section 64ZF for the approval of a licensed technical representative (broker) as a responsible officer of the applicant.

subsection.leadIn: On an application made in the manner specified by the Authority and on payment of a prescribed fee, the Authority may grant to the applicant an insurance broker company licence to carry on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: regulated activities specified in section 1(a) of Part 1 of Schedule 1A in one or more lines of business specified in the licence, as an agent of any policy holder or potential policy holder; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: regulated activities specified in section 1(b), (c) and (d) of Part 1 of Schedule 1A in one or more lines of business.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority must not grant the licence unless it is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the applicant is a fit and proper person to carry on regulated activities in the lines of business concerned;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: each director of the applicant is a fit and proper person to be associated with the carrying on of regulated activities in those lines of business;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if there is a controller in relation to the applicant, the controller is a fit and proper person to be associated with the carrying on of regulated activities in those lines of business;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: the applicant is able to demonstrate that, if licensed, the applicant will be able to comply with rules made under section 129 that set out the requirements—

subparagraph.content: in relation to the capital and net assets of a licensed insurance broker company;
in relation to the professional indemnity insurance taken out by a licensed insurance broker company;
in relation to the keeping of separate client accounts by a licensed insurance broker company; and
in relation to the keeping of proper books and accounts by a licensed insurance broker company;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the applicant is neither the holder of a licence granted under section 64U nor applying for such a licence; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: either—

subparagraph.leadIn: both of the following—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: an accompanying application is made for subsection (2)(a)(i) and the criteria for the grant of licence under section 64ZC(3) are satisfied;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: an accompanying application is made for subsection (2)(a)(ii) and the criteria for the approval under section 64ZF(4) are satisfied; or
an accompanying application is made for subsection (2)(b) and the criteria for the approval under section 64ZF(4) are satisfied.

subsection.content: If the Authority grants an application made under subsection (1), the Authority must also grant the accompanying applications made for subsection (2).
If the Authority rejects an application made under subsection (1), the Authority must also reject the accompanying applications made for subsection (2).
The Authority must give the applicant a notice in writing of the result of the application made under subsection (1).
If the application is rejected, the notice must include a statement of the reasons for the rejection.

section.name: s64ZB
section.heading: Validity of insurance broker company licence
section.content: A licence granted under section 64ZA is valid for 3 years or, if the Authority considers it appropriate in a particular case, another period determined by the Authority, beginning on the date on which it is granted.

section.name: s64ZC
section.heading: Grant of licence—technical representative (broker)

subsection.content: An individual may apply to the Authority for a technical representative (broker) licence to carry on regulated activities in one or more lines of business, as an agent of any licensed insurance broker company.

On an application made in the manner specified by the Authority and on payment of a prescribed fee, the Authority may grant to the applicant a technical representative (broker) licence to carry on regulated activities in one or more lines of business specified in the licence, as an agent of any licensed insurance broker company.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority must not grant the licence unless it is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the applicant is a fit and proper person to carry on regulated activities in the lines of business concerned;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the applicant is appointed as an agent by—

subparagraph.content: at least one licensed insurance broker company; or
a person who applies under section 64ZA for an insurance broker company licence; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the applicant is neither the holder of a licence granted under section 64U, 64W or 64Y nor applying for such a licence.

subsection.content: The Authority must give the applicant a notice in writing of the result of the application made under subsection (1).
If the application is rejected, the notice must include a statement of the reasons for the rejection.

section.name: s64ZD
section.heading: Validity of technical representative (broker) licence
section.content: A licence granted under section 64ZC is valid for 3 years or, if the Authority considers it appropriate in a particular case, another period determined by the Authority, beginning on the date on which it is granted.

section.name: s64ZE
section.heading: Approval of responsible officers of licensed insurance agencies

subsection.content: A person specified in subsection (2) (principal applicant) may apply to the Authority for the approval of an individual as a responsible officer of the principal applicant.

subsection.leadIn: The principal applicant is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a licensed insurance agency; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person who applies under section 64U for an insurance agency licence.

subsection.content: On an application made in the manner specified by the Authority and on payment of a prescribed fee, the Authority may approve the individual as a responsible officer of the principal applicant.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority must not approve an individual as a responsible officer of the principal applicant unless it is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the individual is—

subparagraph.content: a licensed technical representative (agent); or
a person who applies under section 64Y for a technical representative (agent) licence;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the individual will be fit and proper, whether solely or jointly with other responsible officers of the principal applicant, to discharge his or her responsibilities as a responsible officer of the principal applicant; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the individual has sufficient authority from the principal applicant, and will be provided with sufficient resources and support, for discharging those responsibilities.

subsection.content: The Authority must give the principal applicant and the individual a notice in writing of the result of the application made under subsection (1).
If the application is rejected, the notice must include a statement of the reasons for the rejection.

section.name: s64ZF
section.heading: Approval of responsible officers of licensed insurance broker companies

subsection.content: A company specified in subsection (2) (principal applicant) may apply to the Authority for the approval of an individual as a responsible officer of the principal applicant.

subsection.leadIn: The principal applicant is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a licensed insurance broker company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a company which applies under section 64ZA for an insurance broker company licence.

subsection.content: On an application made in the manner specified by the Authority and on payment of a prescribed fee, the Authority may approve the individual as a responsible officer of the principal applicant.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority must not approve an individual as a responsible officer of the principal applicant unless it is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: the individual is—

subparagraph.content: a licensed technical representative (broker); or
a person who applies under section 64ZC for a technical representative (broker) licence;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the individual will be fit and proper, whether solely or jointly with other responsible officers of the principal applicant, to discharge his or her responsibilities as a responsible officer of the principal applicant; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the individual has sufficient authority from the principal applicant, and will be provided with sufficient resources and support, for discharging those responsibilities.

subsection.content: The Authority must give the principal applicant and the individual a notice in writing of the result of the application made under subsection (1).
If the application is rejected, the notice must include a statement of the reasons for the rejection.

section.name: s64ZG
section.heading: Authority may impose conditions on granting licence or approval

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if the Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: grants an insurance agency licence under section 64U;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: grants an individual insurance agent licence under section 64W;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: grants a technical representative (agent) licence under section 64Y;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: grants an insurance broker company licence under section 64ZA;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: grants a technical representative (broker) licence under section 64ZC;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: approves an individual as a responsible officer of a licensed insurance agency under section 64ZE; or

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: approves an individual as a responsible officer of a licensed insurance broker company under section 64ZF.

subsection.content: The Authority may impose any conditions that it considers appropriate on the licence or approval when granting the licence or approval.
The Authority may also impose any conditions that it considers appropriate on the licence or approval after the Authority has granted the licence or approval.
The Authority may amend or revoke any conditions imposed under subsection (2) or (3).

subsection.leadIn: The power under subsection (2), (3) or (4) is only exercisable by notice in writing served on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to subsection (1)(a), (b), (c), (d) or (e)—the licensee; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to subsection (1)(f) or (g)—the licensee and the individual.

subsection.content: A notice under subsection (5) must, in the case of a conditions being imposed or amended, include a statement of reasons for imposing or amending the conditions.

An imposition, amendment or revocation of any conditions under subsection (2), (3) or (4) takes effect at the time the notice under subsection (5) is served or at the time specified in the notice, whichever is the later.

subdivision.name: SD3
subdivision.heading: Revocation and Suspension on Non-disciplinary Grounds

section.name: s64ZH
section.heading: Licensed insurance agency no longer appointed by authorized insurer
section.leadIn: If a licensed insurance agency ceases to be appointed as an agent by at least one authorized insurer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the licence of the licensed insurance agency is suspended on and from the date on which the cessation takes effect; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the cessation continues for 180 days after that date—the licence of the licensed insurance agency is revoked on the expiry of those days.

section.name: s64ZI
section.heading: Licensed individual insurance agent no longer appointed by authorized insurer
section.leadIn: If a licensed individual insurance agent ceases to be appointed as an agent by at least one authorized insurer—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the licence of the licensed individual insurance agent is suspended on and from the date on which the cessation takes effect; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the cessation continues for 180 days after that date—the licence of the licensed individual insurance agent is revoked on the expiry of those days.

section.name: s64ZJ
section.heading: Revocation and suspension of technical representative (agent) licence

subsection.content: If a licensed technical representative (agent) ceases to be appointed as an agent by a licensed insurance agency, the licence of the licensed technical representative (agent) is suspended on and from the date on which the cessation takes effect.

If the licence of the licensed insurance agency by which a licensed technical representative (agent) is appointed is suspended under section 64ZH(a) or 64ZN(1), the licence of the licensed technical representative (agent) is suspended on and from the date on which the licence of the licensed insurance agency is suspended.
If the licence of a licensed technical representative (agent) is suspended continuously for 180 days under this section, the licence is revoked on the expiry of those days.

section.name: s64ZK
section.heading: Revocation and suspension of technical representative (broker) licence

subsection.content: If a licensed technical representative (broker) ceases to be appointed as an agent by at least one licensed insurance broker company, the licence of the licensed technical representative (broker) is suspended on and from the date on which the cessation takes effect.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a licensed technical representative (broker) is appointed by 1 licensed insurance broker company only; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the licence of the licensed insurance broker company by which the licensed technical representative (broker) is appointed is suspended under section 64ZO(1),

subsection.continued: the licence of the licensed technical representative (broker) is suspended on and from the date on which the licence of the licensed insurance broker company is suspended.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a licensed technical representative (broker) is appointed by more than one licensed insurance broker company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the licences of all the licensed insurance broker companies by which the licensed technical representative (broker) is appointed are suspended under section 64ZO(1),

subsection.continued: the licence of the licensed technical representative (broker) is suspended on and from the date on which the licence of the last of those licensed insurance broker companies is suspended.

subsection.content: If the licence of a licensed technical representative (broker) is suspended continuously for 180 days under this section, the licence is revoked on the expiry of those days.

section.name: s64ZL
section.heading: Revocation of approval of responsible officer of licensed insurance agency

subsection.content: The approval of a person as a responsible officer of a licensed insurance agency is revoked if the person ceases to be a licensed technical representative (agent).

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may revoke the approval of a person as a responsible officer of a licensed insurance agency if it is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person ceases to be responsible for the conduct in relation to the licensed insurance agency’s carrying on of regulated activities; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person ceases to have sufficient authority from the licensed insurance agency, or to be provided with sufficient resources and support, for discharging his or her responsibilities as a responsible officer of the licensed insurance agency.

subsection.leadIn: The power under subsection (2) is not exercisable unless, before exercising the power, the Authority has given the individual and the licensed insurance agency—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a notice in writing of its intention to do so and the reasons for doing so; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an opportunity to make written representations or oral representations in relation to those reasons.

subsection.leadIn: A notice under subsection (3)(a) must also include a statement describing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the right of the individual and the licensed insurance agency to make representations; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: how and when the individual and the licensed insurance agency may make representations.

section.name: s64ZM
section.heading: Revocation of approval of responsible officer of licensed insurance broker company

subsection.content: The approval of a person as a responsible officer of a licensed insurance broker company is revoked if the person ceases to be a licensed technical representative (broker).

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may revoke the approval of a person as a responsible officer of a licensed insurance broker company if it is satisfied that— (Amended E.R. 3 of 2015)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person ceases to be responsible for the conduct in relation to the licensed insurance broker company’s carrying on of regulated activities; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person ceases to have sufficient authority from the licensed insurance broker company, or to be provided with sufficient resources and support, for discharging his or her responsibilities as a responsible officer of the licensed insurance broker company.

subsection.leadIn: The power under subsection (2) is not exercisable unless, before exercising the power, the Authority has given the individual and the licensed insurance broker company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a notice in writing of its intention to do so and the reasons for doing so; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an opportunity to make written representations or oral representations in relation to those reasons.

subsection.leadIn: A notice under subsection (3)(a) must also include a statement describing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the right of the individual and the licensed insurance broker company to make representations; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: how and when the individual and the licensed insurance broker company may make representations.

section.name: s64ZN
section.heading: Licensed insurance agencies without responsible officers

subsection.content: If the Authority is satisfied that a licensed insurance agency ceases to have a responsible officer, the Authority may suspend the licence of the licensed insurance agency for a period, or until the occurrence of an event, specified by the Authority.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may revoke the licence of the licensed insurance agency if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the licensed insurance agency has not made an application under section 64ZE for the approval of an individual as a responsible officer of the licensed insurance agency within 90 days after the date on which the suspension takes effect; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the licensed insurance agency has made such an application within 90 days after the date on which the suspension takes effect and the Authority rejects the application.

subsection.leadIn: The power under subsection (1) is not exercisable unless, before exercising the power, the Authority has given the licensed insurance agency—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a notice in writing of its intention to do so and the reasons for doing so; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an opportunity to make written representations or oral representations in relation to those reasons.

subsection.leadIn: A notice under subsection (3)(a) must also include a statement describing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the right of the licensed insurance agency to make representations; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: how and when the licensed insurance agency may make representations.

section.name: s64ZO
section.heading: Licensed insurance broker companies without responsible officers

subsection.content: If the Authority is satisfied that a licensed insurance broker company ceases to have a responsible officer, the Authority may suspend the licence of the licensed insurance broker company for a period, or until the occurrence of an event, specified by the Authority.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may revoke the licence of the licensed insurance broker company if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the licensed insurance broker company has not made an application under section 64ZF for the approval of an individual as a responsible officer of the licensed insurance broker company within 90 days after the date on which the suspension takes effect; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the licensed insurance broker company has made such an application within 90 days after the date on which the suspension takes effect and the Authority rejects the application.

subsection.leadIn: The power under subsection (1) is not exercisable unless, before exercising the power, the Authority has given the licensed insurance broker company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a notice in writing of its intention to do so and the reasons for doing so; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an opportunity to make written representations or oral representations in relation to those reasons.

subsection.leadIn: A notice under subsection (3)(a) must also include a statement describing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the right of the licensed insurance broker company to make representations; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: how and when the licensed insurance broker company may make representations.

section.name: s64ZP
section.heading: Licence revoked on death, dissolution, etc. of licensee
section.leadIn: A licence is revoked—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the licensed insurance intermediary is an individual—on the death of the individual;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the licensed insurance intermediary is a partnership—on the dissolution of the partnership; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the licensed insurance intermediary is a company—on the winding up of the company or on the date on which the company is struck off the Companies Register under the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622).

section.name: s64ZQ
section.heading: Licence revoked or suspended on licensed insurance intermediary’s request

subsection.content: The Authority may revoke the licence of a licensed insurance intermediary if the intermediary requests the Authority to do so.
The Authority may suspend the licence of a licensed insurance intermediary if the intermediary requests the Authority to do so.

section.name: s64ZR
section.heading: Effect of suspension under this Subdivision
section.leadIn: If the licence of a person is suspended under this Subdivision, the person must, during the suspension period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: continue to be regarded for the purposes of this Ordinance, but not sections 64G, 64ZE, 64ZF, 64ZN and 64ZO, to be licensed; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: without limiting paragraph (a), continue to be required to comply with the provisions of this Ordinance relating to a licensed insurance intermediary as would apply to the person were the licence not so suspended.

section.name: s64ZS
section.heading: Revocation or suspension of licence does not avoid or affect agreement, etc.
section.leadIn: Subject to section 64N, a revocation or suspension of the licence of a person under this Subdivision does not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: avoid or affect an agreement, transaction or arrangement entered into or arranged by the person, regardless of whether the agreement, transaction or arrangement was entered into or arranged before or after the revocation or suspension; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: affect a right, obligation or liability arising under the agreement, transaction or arrangement.

section.name: s64ZT
section.heading: Requirement to transfer records on revocation or suspension of licence

subsection.content: If the licence of a person is revoked or suspended under this Subdivision, the Authority may, by notice in writing, require the person to transfer to a client a copy of the records relating to the client’s assets or affairs, held at any time for the client as specified in the notice.

A person who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with a requirement imposed on the person under subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

section.name: s64ZU
section.heading: Permission to carry on business operations on revocation or suspension of licence

subsection.content: If the licence of a person is revoked under section 64ZH, 64ZI, 64ZJ, 64ZK, 64ZN or 64ZO, the Authority may, by notice in writing, permit the person, subject to the conditions specified in the notice, to carry on business operations for closing down the business connected with the revocation.

If the licence of a person is suspended under section 64ZH, 64ZI, 64ZJ, 64ZK, 64ZN or 64ZO, the Authority may, by notice in writing, permit the person, subject to the conditions specified in the notice, to carry on only essential business operations for the protection of the interests of the policy holders concerned during the period of suspension.

If the Authority has granted a permission to a person under subsection (1) or (2), the person must not, because of its carrying on business operations in compliance with the permission, be regarded as having contravened section 64G or 120.

A permission under subsection (1) or (2), and the imposition of conditions under any of those subsections, take effect at the time of the service of the notice or at the time specified in the notice, whichever is the later.

section.name: s64ZV
section.heading: Renewal of licences

subsection.content: A person licensed under section 64U, 64W, 64Y, 64ZA or 64ZC may apply to the Authority for a renewal of the licence.

For a partnership, the application for a renewal of the licence may only be made by a partner authorized by the partnership on behalf of the partnership and, if the licence is renewed, it is to be expressed to be renewed to that partner on behalf of the partnership.
An application under subsection (1) may only be made no later than 45 days before the licence is due to expire.
On an application made in the manner specified by the Authority and on payment of a prescribed fee, the Authority may renew the licence.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority must not renew an insurance agency licence granted under section 64U unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: it is satisfied that—

subparagraph.content: if the applicant was a sole proprietor at the time when the licence was first applied for, the applicant is a sole proprietor;
if the applicant was a partnership at the time when the licence was first applied for, the applicant is a partnership; or
if the applicant was a company at the time when the licence was first applied for, the applicant is a company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: it is satisfied that—

subparagraph.leadIn: if the applicant is a sole proprietor—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the applicant is a fit and proper person to carry on regulated activities in the lines of business concerned; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: where there is a controller in relation to the applicant, the controller is a fit and proper person to be associated with the carrying on of regulated activities in those lines of business;

subparagraph.leadIn: if the applicant is a partnership—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: each partner of the applicant is a fit and proper person to carry on regulated activities in the lines of business concerned; and

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: where there is a controller in relation to the applicant, the controller is a fit and proper person to be associated with the carrying on of regulated activities in those lines of business; or

subparagraph.leadIn: if the applicant is a company—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: the applicant is a fit and proper person to carry on regulated activities in the lines of business concerned;

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: each director of the applicant is a fit and proper person to be associated with the carrying on of regulated activities in those lines of business; and

subparagraph.name: C
subparagraph.content: where there is a controller in relation to the applicant, the controller is a fit and proper person to be associated with the carrying on of regulated activities in those lines of business;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: it is satisfied that the applicant is appointed as an agent by at least one authorized insurer; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: it is satisfied that either—

subparagraph.content: the applicant has a responsible officer; or

the applicant has made an application for the approval of an individual as a responsible officer of the applicant under section 64ZE, and the criteria for the approval under section 64ZE(4) are satisfied.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority must not renew an individual insurance agent licence granted under section 64W unless it is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the applicant is a fit and proper person to carry on regulated activities in the lines of business concerned; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the applicant is appointed as an agent by at least one authorized insurer.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority must not renew a technical representative (agent) licence granted under section 64Y unless it is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the applicant is a fit and proper person to carry on regulated activities in the lines of business concerned; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the applicant is appointed as an agent by a licensed insurance agency.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority must not renew an insurance broker company licence granted under section 64ZA unless it is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the applicant is a company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the applicant is a fit and proper person to carry on regulated activities in the lines of business concerned;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: each director of the applicant is a fit and proper person to be associated with the carrying on of regulated activities in those lines of business;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if there is a controller in relation to the applicant, the controller is a fit and proper person to be associated with the carrying on of regulated activities in those lines of business;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: the applicant is able to demonstrate that, if the licence is renewed, the applicant will be able to continue to comply with rules made under section 129 that set out the requirements—

subparagraph.content: in relation to the capital and net assets of a licensed insurance broker company;
in relation to the professional indemnity insurance taken out by a licensed insurance broker company;
in relation to the keeping of separate client accounts by a licensed insurance broker company; and
in relation to the keeping of proper books and accounts by a licensed insurance broker company; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: either—

subparagraph.content: the applicant has a responsible officer; or

the applicant has made an application for the approval of an individual as a responsible officer of the applicant under section 64ZF, and the criteria for the approval under section 64ZF(4) are satisfied.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority must not renew a technical representative (broker) licence granted under section 64ZC unless it is satisfied that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the applicant is a fit and proper person to carry on regulated activities in the lines of business concerned; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the applicant is appointed as an agent by at least one licensed insurance broker company.

subsection.content: The Authority must give the applicant a notice in writing of the result of the application for a renewal made under subsection (1).
If the application is rejected, the notice must include a statement of the reasons for the rejection.

section.name: s64ZW
section.heading: Amendment, revocation and imposition of conditions on renewal of licences

subsection.content: On renewing a licence under section 64ZV, the Authority may amend or revoke a condition of the licence previously imposed on the licensee, or impose a new condition on the licensee, that the Authority thinks fit.
If the Authority amends or revokes a condition or imposes a new condition, the Authority must, at the time the licence is renewed, inform the licensee by notice in writing.
The notice must include a statement of reasons for imposing or amending the conditions.

An amendment, revocation or imposition of any condition under subsection (1) takes effect at the time the notice under subsection (2) is served on the licensee or at the time specified in the notice, whichever is the later.

section.name: s64ZX
section.heading: Validity of licences for which applications have been made under section 64ZV

subsection.leadIn: A licence for which an application for a renewal is made under section 64ZV and which expires before the determination of the application by the Authority remains in force—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: until the licence is renewed; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the renewal is refused—until the Authority’s decision to refuse to renew the licence takes effect.

subsection.content: Subsection (1) does not apply if the application for the renewal is withdrawn or the licence is revoked.

section.name: s64ZY
section.heading: Validity of licences renewed under section 64ZV

subsection.content: A renewal granted under section 64ZV takes effect on the day following the expiry of the licence.
A licence renewed under section 64ZV is valid for 3 years or, if the Authority considers it appropriate in a particular case, another period determined by the Authority.

section.name: s64ZZ
section.heading: Applicants to provide information

subsection.leadIn: A person who applies—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for the approval of the variation of a line of business specified in a licence under section 64S;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a licence under section 64U, 64W, 64Y, 64ZA or 64ZC;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for the approval of an individual as a responsible officer under section 64ZE or 64ZF; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: for a renewal of a licence under section 64ZV,

subsection.continued: must provide the Authority with information that it reasonably requires to enable it to consider the application.

subsection.content: In considering the application, the Authority may have regard to any information in its possession (whether provided by the applicant or not).

section.name: s64ZZA
section.heading: Determination of fit and proper

subsection.leadIn: In determining whether a person is a fit and proper person for the purposes of this Division, the Authority must have regard to the following matters—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the education or other qualifications or experience of the person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person’s ability to carry on a regulated activity competently, honestly and fairly;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the reputation, character, reliability and integrity of the person;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the person’s financial status or solvency;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: whether any disciplinary action has been taken against the person by—

subparagraph.content: the Monetary Authority;
the Securities and Futures Commission;
the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes Authority; or
any other authority or regulatory organization, whether in Hong Kong or elsewhere, which, in the Authority’s opinion, performs a function similar to those of the Authority;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: if the person is a company in a group of companies, any information in the possession of the Authority, whether provided by the person or not, relating to—

subparagraph.content: any other company in the group of companies; or
any controller or director of the person or of any company referred to in subparagraph (i);

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the state of affairs of any other business which the person carries on or proposes to carry on.

subsection.leadIn: In determining whether a person is a fit and proper person for the purposes of section 64U or 64ZA, or section 64ZV for the renewal of a licence granted under section 64U or 64ZA, the Authority must also have regard to any information in its possession whether provided by the person or not relating to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any other person who is or is to be employed by, or associated with the person for the purposes of carrying on regulated activities;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any other person who is or will be acting for or on behalf of the person in relation to carrying on regulated activities; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the question as to whether the person has established effective internal control procedures and risk management systems to ensure its compliance with this Ordinance.

subsection.content: The obligations imposed on the Authority under subsection (1) or (2) (or both) are in addition to those of the Authority to have regard to any other matter that the Authority considers relevant in making the determination.

section.name: s64ZZB
section.heading: Procedural requirements for rejecting application, or imposing or amending conditions

subsection.leadIn: The Authority must not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: reject an application made under section 64U(1) or 64ZV(1) for an insurance agency licence or a renewal of such a licence;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: impose a condition under section 64ZG(2) or (3) or 64ZW(1) on granting or renewing such a licence; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: amend such a condition under section 64ZG(4) or 64ZW(1),

subsection.continued: without giving the applicant an opportunity to make representations as to why the application should not be rejected or why the condition should not be imposed or amended.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority must not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: reject an application made under section 64W(1) or 64ZV(1) for an individual insurance agent licence or a renewal of such a licence;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: impose a condition under section 64ZG(2) or (3) or 64ZW(1) on granting or renewing such a licence; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: amend such a condition under section 64ZG(4) or 64ZW(1),

subsection.continued: without giving the applicant an opportunity to make representations as to why the application should not be rejected or why the condition should not be imposed or amended.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority must not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: reject an application made under section 64Y(1) or 64ZV(1) for a technical representative (agent) licence or a renewal of such a licence;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: impose a condition under section 64ZG(2) or (3) or 64ZW(1) on granting or renewing such a licence; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: amend such a condition under section 64ZG(4) or 64ZW(1),

subsection.continued: without giving the applicant an opportunity to make representations as to why the application should not be rejected or why the condition should not be imposed or amended.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority must not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: reject an application made under section 64ZA(1) or 64ZV(1) for an insurance broker company licence or a renewal of such a licence;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: impose a condition under section 64ZG(2) or (3) or 64ZW(1) on granting or renewing such a licence; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: amend such a condition under section 64ZG(4) or 64ZW(1),

subsection.continued: without giving the applicant an opportunity to make representations as to why the application should not be rejected or why the condition should not be imposed or amended.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority must not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: reject an application made under section 64ZC(1) or 64ZV(1) for a technical representative (broker) licence or a renewal of such a licence;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: impose a condition under section 64ZG(2) or (3) or 64ZW(1) on granting or renewing such a licence; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: amend such a condition under section 64ZG(4) or 64ZW(1),

subsection.continued: without giving the applicant an opportunity to make representations as to why the application should not be rejected or why the condition should not be imposed or amended.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority must not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: reject an application made under section 64ZE(1) for the approval of an individual as a responsible officer of a licensed insurance agency;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: impose a condition under section 64ZG(2) or (3) on such an approval; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: amend such a condition under section 64ZG(4),

subsection.continued: without giving the individual and the licensed insurance agency or an applicant for an insurance agency licence an opportunity to make representations as to why the application should not be rejected or why the condition should not be imposed or amended.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority must not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: reject an application made under section 64ZF(1) for the approval of an individual as a responsible officer of a licensed insurance broker company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: impose a condition under section 64ZG(2) or (3) on such an approval; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: amend such a condition under section 64ZG(4),

subsection.continued: without giving the individual and the licensed insurance broker company or an applicant for an insurance broker company licence an opportunity to make representations as to why the application should not be rejected or why the condition should not be imposed or amended.

subsection.content: In this section, a reference to an opportunity to make representations is a reference to an opportunity to make written representations or oral representations.

section.name: s64ZZC
section.heading: Form of licence

subsection.leadIn: A licence granted under section 64U, 64W, 64Y, 64ZA, or 64ZC or renewed under section 64ZV must be in a form specified by the Authority and must specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name or names of the licensee and the reference number assigned by the Authority;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the conditions imposed or amended;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the period for which the licence is valid;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: one or more of the following lines of business which the licensee may carry on—

subparagraph.content: general business;
long term business (excluding linked long term business as referred to in Part 2 of Schedule 1);
long term business (including linked long term business as referred to in Part 2 of Schedule 1);
restricted scope travel business; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: any other particulars that are prescribed by rules made under section 129.

subsection.content: A licence granted under section 64U or 64ZA, or the licence renewed under section 64ZV, must also specify the business address of the licensee.
A licence granted under section 64U or 64W, or the licence renewed under section 64ZV, must also specify the name of the authorized insurer by which the licensee is appointed.

subsection.leadIn: A licence granted under section 64Y, or the licence renewed under section 64ZV, must also specify the name of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the licensed insurance agency by which the licensee is appointed; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the authorized insurer by which the licensed insurance agency is appointed.

subsection.content: A licence granted under section 64ZC, or the licence renewed under section 64ZV, must also specify the name of the licensed insurance broker company by which the licensee is appointed.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: restricted scope travel business (有限制旅保業務), in relation to a travel agent that is a licensed insurance agency—(a)means effecting a travel insurance policy that is tied to a tour, travel package, trip or other travel services arranged by the travel agent for its customers; and(b)does not include effecting an annual travel insurance policy.

section.name: s64ZZD
section.heading: Duty to notify Authority of change in partners, directors or controllers

subsection.content: Within 1 month after the date on which a person becomes, or ceases to be, a partner, director or controller of a licensed insurance agency, the agency must notify the Authority in writing of that fact.

Within 1 month after the date on which a person becomes, or ceases to be, a director or controller of a licensed insurance broker company, the company must notify the Authority in writing of that fact.
A notification under subsection (1) or (2) must be accompanied by a prescribed fee.
A licensed insurance agency who, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 5.
A licensed insurance broker company which, without reasonable excuse, contravenes subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 5.

section.name: s64ZZE
section.heading: Offence to provide false information in connection with application for licence or approval

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person, in connection with an application for the grant or renewal of a licence, or with an application for the approval, under this Division—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: makes a statement that is false or misleading in a material particular; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: knows that, or is reckless as to whether, the statement is false or misleading in the material particular.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person, in connection with an application for the grant or renewal of a licence, or with an application for the approval, under this Division—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: omits a material particular from a statement with the result that the statement is rendered false or misleading; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: knows that, or is reckless as to whether, the material particular is omitted from the statement.

subsection.content: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) or (2) is liable to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s64ZZF
section.heading: Power to conduct inspection

subsection.leadIn: An inspector may exercise the powers under subsections (2) and (3) for ascertaining whether a licensed insurance intermediary is complying with, has complied with, or is likely to be able to comply with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a provision of this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a notice or requirement given or imposed under a provision of this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a term or condition of a licence granted under this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: any other condition imposed under a provision of this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: At any reasonable time, an inspector—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may enter any business premises of the licensed insurance intermediary;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may inspect, and may make copies or otherwise record details of, a business record of the intermediary; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: may make inquiries of the intermediary or a person specified in subsection (5)—

subparagraph.content: concerning a business record of the intermediary; or
concerning a transaction or activity that was undertaken in the course of, or may affect, the regulated activity carried on by the intermediary.

subsection.leadIn: In exercising a power under subsection (2)(b) or (c), the inspector may require the licensed insurance intermediary, or a person specified in subsection (5)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to give the inspector access to a business record of the intermediary;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to produce to the inspector, within the time and at the place specified in the requirement, a business record of the intermediary; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: to answer a question concerning—

subparagraph.content: a business record of the intermediary; or
a transaction or activity that was undertaken in the course of, or may affect, the regulated activity carried on by the intermediary.

subsection.content: The power under subsection (2)(c) or (3) is not exercisable in relation to a person specified in subsection (5) unless the inspector has reasonable cause to believe that the information or record being sought cannot be obtained by exercising the power in relation to the licensed insurance intermediary.

The person specified for subsections (2)(c) and (3) is a person whom the inspector has reasonable cause to believe has information relating to, or is in possession of, a business record of the licensed insurance intermediary.
The Authority may in writing appoint a person, or a person belonging to a class of persons, as an inspector for the purposes of this section.
The Authority must provide an inspector with a copy of its appointment.
When imposing a requirement on a person under subsection (3), an inspector must, if so requested, produce a copy of the appointment to that person for inspection as soon as practicable.
This section is subject to section 64ZZJ.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: business premises (業務處所), in relation to a licensed insurance intermediary, means any non-domestic premises at which—(a)the intermediary carries on business; or(b)the person by whom the intermediary is appointed as an agent carries on business.

section.name: s64ZZG
section.heading: Inspector may require answer, etc. to be verified by statutory declaration

subsection.content: If a person gives an answer in compliance with a requirement imposed under section 64ZZF(2)(c) or (3), the inspector may, in writing, require the person to verify, within the time specified in the requirement, the answer by a statutory declaration.

If a person does not give an answer in compliance with a requirement imposed under section 64ZZF(2)(c) or (3) for the reason that the information concerned was not within the person’s knowledge or possession, the inspector may, in writing, require the person to verify, within the time specified in the requirement, by a statutory declaration, that the person did not comply with the requirement for that reason.
A statutory declaration under subsection (1) or (2) may be made before the inspector and, for that purpose, the inspector is to have full power to administer the statutory declaration.

section.name: s64ZZH
section.heading: Power to conduct investigation

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Authority has reasonable cause to believe that a provision of this Ordinance may have been contravened;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Authority has reasonable cause to believe that a person may have been involved in defalcation, fraud, misfeasance or other misconduct in relation to the carrying on of a regulated activity;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the Authority has reasonable cause to believe that a person has carried on, or is carrying on, a regulated activity in a manner that is not in the interests of policy holders or potential policy holders or the public interest; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: the Authority, for considering whether to exercise any power under section 81, has reason to enquire if—

subparagraph.content: a person is, or was, guilty of misconduct as defined by section 80; or
a person is, or was, not a fit and proper person as described in section 81(1)(c),

subsection.continued: the Authority may in writing direct one or more of its employees, or, with the consent of the Financial Secretary, appoint one or more other persons, to investigate the matter.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority must consult the Monetary Authority before the Authority directs any of its employees, or appoints a person to investigate a matter in respect of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an authorized institution;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person who is, or was, employed by an authorized institution; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a person who is, or was, appointed as an agent by an authorized institution,

subsection.continued: in relation to any regulated activity carried on by the institution.

subsection.content: The costs and expenses incurred by an investigator, other than an employee of the Authority, may be paid out of moneys provided by the Legislative Council.
The Authority must provide an investigator with a copy of its direction or appointment.
Before first imposing a requirement on a person under subsection (6), an investigator must produce a copy of the direction or appointment to that person for inspection.

subsection.leadIn: An investigator may require a person specified in subsection (7)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: to produce, within the time and at the place the investigator requires in writing, a record or document specified by the investigator that—

subparagraph.content: is or may be relevant to the investigation; and
is in the person’s possession;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to give an explanation or further particulars in respect of a record or document produced;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to attend before the investigator at the time and place the investigator requires in writing, and answer a question relating to any matter under investigation that may be raised by the investigator;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: to answer in writing, within the time the investigator requires in writing, a written question relating to any matter under investigation that may be raised by the investigator; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: to give the investigator all other assistance in connection with the investigation that the person is able to give.

subsection.leadIn: The person specified for subsection (6) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person who is relevant to the matter that an investigator is directed or appointed to investigate; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a person whom an investigator has reasonable cause to believe—

subparagraph.content: to be in possession of a record or document that contains, or is likely to contain, information relevant to the investigation; or
to be otherwise in possession of such information.

subsection.content: This section is subject to section 64ZZJ.

section.name: s64ZZI
section.heading: Investigator may require explanation, etc. to be verified by statutory declaration

subsection.content: If a person gives any explanation, particulars or answer in compliance with a requirement imposed under section 64ZZH(6), the investigator may, in writing, require the person to verify, within the time specified in the requirement, the explanation, particulars or answer by a statutory declaration.

If a person does not give any explanation, particulars or answer in compliance with a requirement imposed under section 64ZZH(6) for the reason that the information concerned was not within the person’s knowledge or possession, the investigator may, in writing, require the person to verify, within the time specified in the requirement, by a statutory declaration, that the person did not comply with the requirement for that reason.
A statutory declaration under subsection (1) or (2) may be made before the investigator and, for that purpose, the investigator is to have full power to administer the statutory declaration.

section.name: s64ZZJ
section.heading: Inspection and investigation powers in relation to authorized institutions

subsection.leadIn: An inspector has no power under section 64ZZF or 64ZZG to require an authorized institution to disclose any information, or to produce a record or document, relating to the affairs of a customer of the institution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: unless the inspector is a specified authority; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: unless the inspector is satisfied that the disclosure or production is necessary for ascertaining a matter specified in section 64ZZF(1) and so certifies in writing to the institution.

subsection.leadIn: An investigator has no power under section 64ZZH or 64ZZI to require an authorized institution to disclose any information, or to produce a record or document, relating to the affairs of a customer of the institution—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: unless the investigator is a specified authority; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: unless—

subparagraph.content: the customer is a person whom the investigator has reasonable cause to believe may be able to give information relevant to the matter under investigation; and
the investigator is satisfied that the disclosure or production is necessary for the investigation and so certifies in writing to the institution.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: specified authority (指明當局)—(a)in relation to subsection (1), means—(i)the Monetary Authority; or(ii)a person appointed by the Monetary Authority under section 64ZZF(6); or(b)in relation to subsection (2), means—(i)the Monetary Authority; or(ii)a person directed or appointed by the Monetary Authority under section 64ZZH(1).

section.name: s64ZZK
section.heading: Application to Court of First Instance for inquiry into failure

subsection.content: If a person fails to comply with a requirement imposed by an inspector under section 64ZZF or 64ZZG or an investigator under section 64ZZH or 64ZZI, the inspector or investigator may apply by originating summons to the Court of First Instance for an inquiry into the failure.

subsection.leadIn: On an application under subsection (1), the Court of First Instance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on being satisfied that there is no reasonable excuse for the person not to comply with the requirement, may order the person to comply with the requirement within the time specified by the Court; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on being satisfied that the failure was without reasonable excuse, may punish the person, and any other person knowingly involved in the failure, in the same manner as if the person and that other person had been guilty of contempt of court.

subsection.content: An originating summons under subsection (1) is to be in Form No. 10 in Appendix A to the Rules of the High Court (Cap. 4 sub. leg. A).

subsection.leadIn: Despite anything in this Ordinance, no proceedings may be instituted against a person for subsection (2)(b) in respect of a conduct if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: criminal proceedings have previously been instituted against the person under section 64ZZL(1), (2), (3), (4) or (5) in respect of the same conduct; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: those proceedings remain pending, or because of the previous institution of those proceedings, no criminal proceedings may again be lawfully instituted against that person under section 64ZZL(1), (2), (3), (4) or (5) in respect of the same conduct.

section.name: s64ZZL
section.heading: Offences in relation to inspections and investigations

subsection.content: A person commits an offence if the person, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with a specified requirement imposed on the person.
A person commits an offence if the person, with intent to defraud, fails to comply with a specified requirement imposed on the person.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in purported compliance with a specified requirement imposed on the person, the person produces a record or document, gives an answer, or gives any explanation or particulars, that are false or misleading in a material particular; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person knows that, or is reckless as to whether, the record or document, the answer, or the explanation or particulars, are false or misleading in the material particular.

subsection.content: A person commits an offence if, in purported compliance with a specified requirement imposed on the person, the person, with intent to defraud, produces a record or document, gives an answer, or gives any explanation or particulars, that are false or misleading in a material particular.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person, with intent to defraud—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: causes or allows another person to fail to comply with a specified requirement imposed on that other person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: causes or allows that other person, in purported compliance with a specified requirement imposed on that other person, to produce a record or document, to give an answer, or to give any explanation or particulars, that are false or misleading in a material particular.

subsection.content: A person is not excused from complying with a requirement imposed on the person under section 64ZZH(6) or 64ZZI(1) only on the ground that to do so might tend to incriminate the person.

subsection.leadIn: Despite anything in this Ordinance, no criminal proceedings may be instituted against a person under subsection (1), (2), (3), (4) or (5) in respect of a conduct if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: proceedings have previously been instituted against the person under section 64ZZK(2)(b) in respect of the same conduct; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: those proceedings remain pending, or because of the previous institution of those proceedings, no proceedings may again be lawfully instituted against that person under section 64ZZK(2)(b) in respect of the same conduct.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 1 year; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (3) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (2), (4) or (5) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 7 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: specified requirement (指明要求) means a requirement imposed under section 64ZZF(3), 64ZZG(1) or (2), 64ZZH(6) or 64ZZI(1) or (2).

section.name: s64ZZM
section.heading: Use of incriminating evidence in proceedings

subsection.content: If an investigator requires a person to give an answer to a question or to give an explanation or further particulars under this Division, the investigator must ensure that the person has first been informed of the effect of subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: Despite anything in this Ordinance and subject to subsection (3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if an investigator requires a person to give an answer to a question or to give an explanation or further particulars under this Division; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the answer, or the explanation or further particulars, might tend to incriminate the person and the person so claims before giving the answer or giving the explanation or further particulars,

subsection.continued: the requirement and the question and answer, or the explanation or further particulars, are not admissible in evidence against the person in criminal proceedings in a court of law.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2) does not apply to criminal proceedings in which the person is, in relation to the answer, or the explanation or further particulars, charged with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an offence under section 64ZZL(1), (2), (3), (4) or (5), or under Part V of the Crimes Ordinance (Cap. 200); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: perjury.

section.name: s64ZZN
section.heading: Offences in relation to destruction of records and documents

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person destroys, falsifies, conceals or otherwise disposes of, or causes or permits the destruction, falsification, concealment or disposal of, a record or document that the person is required by an inspector or investigator to produce under section 64ZZF or 64ZZH; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person does so with intent to conceal, from the inspector or investigator, facts or matters capable of being disclosed by the record or document.

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s64ZZO
section.heading: Order to pay costs of investigation

subsection.leadIn: If a person is convicted by a court on a prosecution instituted as a result of the findings of an investigation under section 64ZZH—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the court may order the person to pay to the Authority the whole or a part of the costs and expenses of the investigation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Authority may recover the whole or that part of the costs and expenses as a civil debt due to it.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (3) applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Authority receives an amount under an order made under subsection (1) in respect of any of the costs and expenses of an investigation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: all or any of the costs and expenses have already been paid out of moneys provided by the Legislative Council.

subsection.content: The Authority must pay to the Financial Secretary the amount received under the order to the extent to which it has already been paid out of moneys provided by the Legislative Council.

section.name: s64ZZP
section.heading: Magistrate’s warrants to enter premises, etc.

subsection.content: This section applies if a magistrate is satisfied on information on oath laid by a person specified in subsection (3) that there are reasonable grounds to suspect that there is, or is likely to be, on premises specified in the information a record or document that may be required to be produced under section 64ZZF or 64ZZH.

subsection.leadIn: If this section applies, the magistrate may issue a warrant authorizing a person mentioned in the warrant, and other persons who may be necessary to assist in the execution of the warrant—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to enter the premises, if necessary by force, at any time within the period of 7 days beginning on the date of the warrant; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to search for, seize and remove a record or document that the person mentioned in the warrant has reasonable cause to believe may be required to be produced under section 64ZZF or 64ZZH.

subsection.leadIn: The person specified for subsection (1) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a record or document that may be required to be produced under section 64ZZF—an inspector; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to a record or document that may be required to be produced under section 64ZZH—an investigator.

subsection.leadIn: If an authorized person has reasonable cause to believe that a person found on the premises is employed, or engaged to provide a service, in connection with a business that is or has been conducted on the premises, the authorized person may require that person to produce for examination a record or document that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is in the possession of that person; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the authorized person has reasonable cause to believe may be required to be produced under section 64ZZF or 64ZZH.

subsection.leadIn: An authorized person may, in relation to a record or document required to be produced under subsection (4)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: prohibit a person found on the premises from—

subparagraph.content: removing the record or document from the premises;
erasing anything from, adding anything to, or otherwise altering anything in, the record or document; or
otherwise interfering in any way with, or causing or permitting any other person to interfere with, the record or document; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: take any other step that appears to the authorized person to be necessary for—

subparagraph.content: preserving the record or document; or
preventing interference with the record or document.

subsection.content: An authorized person who enters any premises under this section must, if required, produce the warrant for inspection.

Section 102 of the Criminal Procedure Ordinance (Cap. 221) applies to any property that has, because of this section, come into the possession of the Authority, as it applies to property that has come into the possession of the police.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with a requirement or prohibition imposed on the person under subsection (4) or (5); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: obstructs an authorized person exercising a power conferred by subsection (4) or (5).

subsection.leadIn: A person who commits an offence under subsection (8) is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
