subsection.def: authorized person (獲授權人) means a person mentioned in, and authorized by, a warrant issued under subsection (2) to carry out the acts set out in paragraphs (a) and (b) of that subsection.

section.name: s64ZZQ
section.heading: Removal of records and documents under section 64ZZP

subsection.leadIn: A record or document removed under section 64ZZP(2) may be retained—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a period not exceeding 6 months beginning on the day of its removal; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a longer period that may be required because of any criminal proceedings, or any proceedings under this Ordinance.

subsection.content: If an authorized person removes a record or document under section 64ZZP(2), the authorized person must, as soon as practicable after the removal, give a receipt for the record or document.

section.name: s64ZZR
section.heading: Lien claimed on records or documents
section.leadIn: If the person in possession of a record or document required to be produced under section 64ZZF or 64ZZH claims a lien on the record or document—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the requirement to produce the record or document is not affected by the lien;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: no fee is payable for the production; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the production is without prejudice to the lien.

section.name: s64ZZS
section.heading: Production of information in information systems, etc.
section.leadIn: If any information or matter contained in a record or document required to be produced under section 64ZZF or 64ZZH is recorded otherwise than in a legible form, a power to require the production of the record or document includes the power to require the production of a reproduction of the recording of the information or matter or of the relevant part of it—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the recording enables the information or matter to be reproduced in a legible form—in a legible form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the information or matter is recorded in an information system—in a form which enables the information or matter to be reproduced in a legible form.

section.name: s64ZZT
section.heading: Inspection of records or documents seized, etc.

subsection.content: If a specified person has taken possession of a record or document under this Division, the specified person must permit a person who would be entitled to inspect the record or document had the specified person not taken possession of it, to inspect it and to make copies or otherwise record details of it at all reasonable times.
The permission is subject to any reasonable conditions the specified person imposes.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: specified person (指明人士) means—(a)an authorized person within the meaning of section 64ZZP; or(b)an investigator.

section.name: s68
section.heading: Authorized insurer’s relationship with its agent

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an authorized insurer has appointed a person as an agent of the insurer; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the person has dealings with another person (client) for—

subparagraph.content: the issue of a contract of insurance for the client; or
insurance business relating to the contract. (Replaced 12 of 2015 s. 76)

subsection.content: If the person is appointed by 1 authorized insurer as an agent, the insurer is liable for any act of the person in relation to those dealings, whether or not the act is within the scope of the person’s authority. (Replaced 12 of 2015 s. 76)

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person is appointed by more than one authorized insurer as an agent;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: those dealings relate to a particular line of business; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the person is appointed by only one of those insurers (empowering insurer) to engage in that line of business,

subsection.continued: the empowering insurer is liable for any act of the person in relation to those dealings, whether or not the act is within the scope of the person’s authority. (Replaced 12 of 2015 s. 76)

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person is appointed by more than one authorized insurer as an agent to engage in a particular line of business;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: those dealings relate to that line of business; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an act of the person in relation to those dealings is within the scope of the person’s authority in relation to only one of those insurers (empowering insurer),

subsection.continued: the empowering insurer is liable for the act of the person in relation to those dealings. (Replaced 12 of 2015 s. 76)

subsection.name: 4A
subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person is appointed by more than one authorized insurer as an agent to engage in a particular line of business;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: those dealings relate to that line of business; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an act of the person in relation to those dealings is within the scope of the person’s authority in relation to 2 or more of those insurers (empowering insurers),

subsection.continued: the empowering insurers are jointly and severally liable for the act of the person in relation to those dealings. (Added 12 of 2015 s. 76)

subsection.name: 4B
subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person is appointed by more than one authorized insurer as an agent to engage in a particular line of business;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: those dealings relate to that line of business; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an act of the person in relation to those dealings is not within the scope of the person’s authority in relation to any of those insurers,

subsection.continued: all of those insurers are jointly and severally liable for the act of the person in relation to those dealings. (Added 12 of 2015 s. 76)

subsection.name: 4C
subsection.leadIn: Despite subsections (2), (3), (4), (4A) and (4B) and subject to subsection (4D), an authorized insurer is not liable for the act of the person if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the act is not within the scope of the person’s authority in relation to that insurer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person disclosed that the fact to the client before the client relied on the act; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the clarity and prominence of the disclosure was what a person would reasonably require for deciding whether to enter into any dealing referred to in subsection (1)(b). (Added 12 of 2015 s. 76)

subsection.name: 4D
subsection.content: In considering a claim under this section, despite subsection (4C), the court may take into account any other factors relevant in the circumstances in determining whether an authorized insurer is liable for the act of the person. (Added 12 of 2015 s. 76)

subsection.name: 4E
subsection.content: If a contract of insurance or an agency agreement contains a provision that is inconsistent with this section, that provision is void. (Added 12 of 2015 s. 76)
The liability of an authorized insurer under this section arises whether the person purports to act as a principal or as an agent for an undisclosed or disclosed principal. (Amended 12 of 2015 s. 76)

section.name: s68A
section.heading: Validity of agency agreements
section.content: If an agency agreement contains a provision purporting to affect, or having the effect of affecting the obligation of a licensed insurance intermediary under section 90(a), that provision is void.

section.name: s71
section.heading: Licensed insurance broker company’s client monies

subsection.leadIn: A licensed insurance broker company must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: hold any of the monies specified in subsection (2) separate from the company’s monies; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: pay them, as soon as practicable after receiving the monies, into an account maintained by the company with an authorized institution for holding the specified monies.

subsection.leadIn: The monies specified for subsection (1) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: monies received by the company from or on behalf of a policy holder or potential policy holder for or on account of an insurer in connection with a contract of insurance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: monies received by the company from or on behalf of an insurer for or on account of a policy holder or potential policy holder.

subsection.content: A licensed insurance broker company must pay to an insurer, within the time as agreed with the insurer, insurance premiums received from a policy holder or potential policy holder that are due to the insurer in relation to a contract of insurance.
A licensed insurance broker company may use client monies relating to a client only for the purposes of that client.

A licensed insurance broker company is entitled to retain the interest that is earned on client monies relating to a client held in the company’s client account unless the client and the company agree otherwise.
A lien or claim on client monies made by or through a licensed insurance broker company is void unless the monies in the client account of the company are for fees then due and owing to the company.
A licensed insurance broker company must not create a charge or mortgage on client monies.
A charge or mortgage on client monies created by a licensed insurance broker company is void.

subsection.leadIn: A licensed insurance broker company which contravenes subsection (1), (4) or (7) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment to a fine of $1,000,000 and to imprisonment for 5 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction to a fine at level 6 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s72
section.heading: Licensed insurance broker company must appoint auditor

subsection.leadIn: A licensed insurance broker company must, within 1 month after being granted a licence under section 64ZA, appoint as its auditor— (Amended 12 of 2015 s. 80)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person who is not prohibited under section 20AAZZR of the Accounting and Financial Reporting Council Ordinance (Cap. 588) from holding any appointment as an auditor of a company and is not disqualified under section 393 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622); or (Amended 28 of 2012 ss. 912 & 920; L.N. 66 of 2022)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for a licensed insurance broker company incorporated outside Hong Kong (other than a re-domiciled company), a person— (Amended 12 of 2015 s. 80; 14 of 2025 s. 138)

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: who may lawfully practise as an auditor in the place of its incorporation; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: who holds a qualification that the Authority accepts as being of a standard comparable to that of a person referred to in paragraph (a).

subsection.content: A licensed insurance broker company must within 1 month from appointing an auditor under subsection (1) serve on the Authority a notice in writing of the appointment and the name and qualifications of the auditor appointed. (Amended 12 of 2015 s. 80)

subsection.leadIn: If the appointment of an auditor ends, the licensed insurance broker company must within 1 month from the ending of the appointment— (Amended 12 of 2015 s. 80)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: appoint a new auditor; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: serve notice on the Authority of the ending and new appointment.

subsection.content: A licensed insurance broker company which contravenes this section commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 3, and in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $500 for each day during which the offence continues. (Added 12 of 2015 s. 80)

section.name: s73
section.heading: Audit of licensed insurance broker company

subsection.leadIn: A licensed insurance broker company must, within 6 months after the end of each financial year, provide the Authority with all of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a copy of the audited profit and loss account for that year;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a copy of the audited income and expenditure account for that year;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a copy of the audited balance sheet as at the end of that year;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: an auditor’s report on the financial statements;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: an auditor’s report stating whether the auditor is of the opinion that the company has continued to comply with rules made under section 129 that set out the requirements—

subparagraph.content: in relation to the capital and net assets of a licensed insurance broker company;
in relation to the professional indemnity insurance taken out by a licensed insurance broker company;
in relation to the keeping of separate client accounts by a licensed insurance broker company; and
in relation to the keeping of proper books and accounts by a licensed insurance broker company;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: any other information that is prescribed by rules made under section 129.

subsection.content: A licensed insurance broker company which contravenes this section commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 6, and in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $500 for each day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s74
section.heading: Powers of Authority to require production, etc.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may require an authorized insurer or a licensed insurance intermediary to produce, at the time and place that the Authority specifies, the books or papers that it specifies for obtaining information in relation to a regulated activity carried on by a licensed insurance intermediary; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may authorize a person, on producing (if required to do so) evidence of the person’s authority, to require an authorized insurer or a licensed insurance intermediary to produce to the person, at the time and place that the person specifies, the books or papers that the person specifies for obtaining information in relation to a regulated activity carried on by a licensed insurance intermediary. (Replaced 12 of 2015 s. 82)

subsection.content: Where the Authority or a person authorized by the Authority has power to require the production of any books or papers from an authorized insurer or a licensed insurance intermediary, the Authority or the authorized person shall have the same power to require production of those books or papers from any person who appears to the Authority or the authorized person to be in possession of them. (Amended 12 of 2015 ss. 2 & 82)

subsection.leadIn: A power to require an authorized insurer or a licensed insurance intermediary or other person to produce books or papers shall include power— (Amended 12 of 2015 s. 82)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: if the books or papers are produced—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: to take copies of them or extracts from them; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: to require the person, or any other person who is a present or past director, controller, auditor or actuary of, or is or was at any time employed by, the authorized insurer or the licensed insurance intermediary in question, to provide an explanation of any of them; (Amended 12 of 2015 s. 82)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the books or papers are not produced, to require the person who was required to produce them to state, to the best of his knowledge and belief, where they are.

subsection.content: A person who fails to produce books or papers required under this section commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 6, and in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $500 for each day during which the offence continues. (Added 12 of 2015 s. 82)

section.name: s76
section.heading: Authority may petition for winding up or bankruptcy of licensed insurance intermediary

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may present a petition for a licensed insurance intermediary, other than a licensed insurance intermediary which is an authorized institution, to be wound up in accordance with the Companies (Winding Up and Miscellaneous Provisions) Ordinance (Cap. 32) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the intermediary is a company which may be wound up by the Court of First Instance under that Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Authority considers that it is in the public interest that the intermediary should be wound up.

subsection.content: However, the Authority may not present a petition under subsection (1) for a licensed insurance intermediary to be wound up if the intermediary is already being wound up by the Court of First Instance.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may present a petition for any of the following persons to be declared bankrupt if the Authority considers that it is in the public interest that the person should be made bankrupt—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an individual who is a licensed insurance intermediary;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any of the partners of a partnership which is a licensed insurance intermediary.

section.name: s78
section.heading: Exemptions for authorized insurers, etc.

subsection.leadIn: Despite section 64G, an authorized insurer is not required to be a licensed insurance intermediary in order to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: carry on any regulated activity; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: hold out that it is carrying on any regulated activity. (Replaced 12 of 2015 s. 86)

subsection.content: The exemption given under subsection (1) extends only to an authorized insurer and does not extend to its agent. (Amended 12 of 2015 s. 86)

subsection.leadIn: If a person holds out in Hong Kong—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to carry on regulated activities specified in section 1(a) of Part 1 of Schedule 1A as an agent of a policy holder or potential policy holder for contracts of reinsurance only; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to carry on regulated activities specified in section 1(b), (c) and (d) of Part 1 of Schedule 1A for contracts of reinsurance only,

subsection.continued: the person is not required to be a licensed insurance broker. (Replaced 12 of 2015 s. 86)

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.leadIn: Subsection (3) does not apply to any of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a body corporate that is incorporated in Hong Kong or is a re-domiciled company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a body corporate incorporated outside Hong Kong (other than a re-domiciled company) that has a place of business in Hong Kong or is represented in Hong Kong by an agent;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other person or a partnership having a place of business in Hong Kong. (Added 12 of 2015 s. 86. Amended 14 of 2025 s. 139)

section.name: s79
section.heading: Power of Authority to grant exemptions

subsection.content: A person may apply to the Authority for an exemption from any provision of this Part.

subsection.leadIn: An application for exemption must be accompanied by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a prescribed fee; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any information and documents that the Authority reasonably requires to enable it to consider the application.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may, on receipt of an application for exemption—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: approve the application and grant the exemption; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: reject the application.

subsection.content: The Authority must give the person a notice in writing of the result of the application.

subsection.leadIn: In approving an application for exemption, the Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may limit the validity of the exemption to a specified period; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may impose any conditions that the Authority considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may at any time by notice in writing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: revoke an exemption; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: revoke, vary, or add to, any condition subject to which an exemption is granted.

subsection.leadIn: If a condition imposed under this section in relation to an exemption is contravened—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the exemption ceases to have effect; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: this Part applies to the person to whom the exemption was granted as if the exemption had not been granted.

part.name: P11
part.heading: Disciplinary Actions and Conduct Requirements for Licensed Insurance Intermediaries and Certain Officers

section.name: s80
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Part—
subsection.def: controller (控權人) has the meaning given by section 64F;

misconduct (不當行為) means—(a)a contravention of a provision of this Ordinance;(b)a contravention of a term or condition of a licence granted under this Ordinance;(c)a contravention of any other condition imposed under a provision of this Ordinance; or(d)an act or omission relating to the carrying on of any regulated activity which, in the Authority’s opinion, is or is likely to be prejudicial to the interests of policy holders or potential policy holders or the public interest,and guilty of misconduct (犯不當行為) is to be construed accordingly;

regulated person (受規管人士) means—(a)a licensed insurance intermediary;(b)a responsible officer of a licensed insurance agency;(c)a responsible officer of a licensed insurance broker company;(d)a person concerned in the management of the regulated activities carried on by a licensed insurance agency; or(e)a person concerned in the management of the regulated activities carried on by a licensed insurance broker company.

subsection.content: For the purposes of paragraph (d) of the definition of misconduct in subsection (1), the Authority must not form an opinion that an act or omission is or is likely to be prejudicial to the interests of policy holders or potential policy holders or the public interest, unless it has had regard to those provisions set out in any code of conduct published under section 95 or any code or guideline published under section 133, that are in force at the time of the occurrence of, and applicable in relation to, the act or omission.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a licensed insurance agency is, or was at any time, guilty of misconduct; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a former licensed insurance agency was at any time guilty of misconduct,

subsection.continued: as a result of a conduct occurring with the consent or connivance of, or attributable to neglect on the part of, a person specified in subsection (4), the conduct is also to be regarded as misconduct on the part of the person, and guilty of misconduct (犯不當行為) is to be construed accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: The person specified for subsection (3) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a responsible officer or former responsible officer of the agency; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person concerned in the management of the regulated activities carried on by the agency.

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a licensed insurance broker company is, or was at any time, guilty of misconduct; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a former licensed insurance broker company was at any time guilty of misconduct,

subsection.continued: as a result of a conduct occurring with the consent or connivance of, or attributable to neglect on the part of, a person specified in subsection (6), the conduct is also to be regarded as misconduct on the part of the person, and guilty of misconduct (犯不當行為) is to be construed accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: The person specified for subsection (5) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a responsible officer or former responsible officer of the company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person concerned in the management of the regulated activities carried on by the company.

section.name: s81
section.heading: Disciplinary action in respect of regulated persons

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may exercise any of the powers specified in subsection (4) in respect of a person if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person is, or was at any time, guilty of misconduct when the person is a regulated person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person was at any time guilty of misconduct when the person was a regulated person; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: the Authority is of the opinion that—

subparagraph.content: at the time when the person is a regulated person, the person is not a fit and proper person; or
at a time when the person was a regulated person, the person was not a fit and proper person.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may also exercise any of the powers specified in subsection (4)(a) in respect of a person who is a licensed insurance intermediary if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: for a person who is an individual—

subparagraph.content: the person enters into a voluntary arrangement with creditors, or has a bankruptcy order made against the individual, under the Bankruptcy Ordinance (Cap. 6);
the person is convicted of an offence in Hong Kong or elsewhere, which in the opinion of the Authority impugns the fitness and properness of the person to remain licensed; or

the person has been found by a court to be mentally incapacitated, or is detained in a mental hospital, under the Mental Health Ordinance (Cap. 136), which in the opinion of the Authority impugns the fitness and properness of the person to remain licensed;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for a person that is a partnership—

subparagraph.content: any of the partners of the person enters into a voluntary arrangement with creditors, or has a bankruptcy order made against the partner, under the Bankruptcy Ordinance (Cap. 6);
any of the partners of the person is convicted of an offence in Hong Kong or elsewhere, which in the opinion of the Authority impugns the fitness and properness of the person to remain licensed; or

any of the partners of the person has been found by a court to be mentally incapacitated, or is detained in a mental hospital, under the Mental Health Ordinance (Cap. 136), which in the opinion of the Authority impugns the fitness and properness of the person to remain licensed;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: for a person that is a company—

subparagraph.content: a receiver or manager of the property or business of the person is appointed;
the person enters into a scheme of arrangement with its creditors;
the person goes into liquidation;
the person is convicted of an offence in Hong Kong or elsewhere, which in the opinion of the Authority impugns the fitness and properness of the person to remain licensed;
any of the directors of the person is convicted of an offence in Hong Kong or elsewhere, which in the opinion of the Authority impugns the fitness and properness of the person to remain licensed; or

any of the directors of the person has been found by a court to be mentally incapacitated, or is detained in a mental hospital, under the Mental Health Ordinance (Cap. 136), which in the opinion of the Authority impugns the fitness and properness of the person to remain licensed; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: for a person that is a sole proprietorship, partnership or company—any of the controllers of the person is convicted of an offence in Hong Kong or elsewhere, which in the opinion of the Authority impugns the fitness and properness of the person to remain licensed.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may also exercise any of the powers specified in subsection (4)(b) in respect of a person who is a responsible officer of a licensed insurance agency or a licensed insurance broker company if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person is convicted of an offence in Hong Kong or elsewhere; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the opinion of the Authority, the conviction impugns the fitness and properness of the person to remain as a responsible officer.

subsection.leadIn: The following powers are specified for subsections (1), (2) and (3)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: for a person who is a licensed insurance intermediary—

subparagraph.content: to revoke the licence of the person;
to suspend the licence of the person, for a period or until the occurrence of an event that the Authority specifies;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for a person who is a responsible officer—

subparagraph.content: to revoke the approval of the person as a responsible officer;
to suspend the approval of the person as a responsible officer for a period or until the occurrence of an event that the Authority specifies;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: for a person who is or was a regulated person—

subparagraph.content: to prohibit the person from applying to be licensed for a period or until the occurrence of an event that the Authority specifies;
to prohibit the person from being appointed as a responsible officer for a period or until the occurrence of an event that the Authority specifies;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: for a person who is or was a regulated person—to reprimand the person publicly or privately;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: for a person who is or was a regulated person—to order the person to pay a pecuniary penalty not exceeding the amount which is the greater of—

subparagraph.content: 3 times the amount of the profit gained or loss avoided by the person as a result of the misconduct, or of the other conduct of the person which leads the Authority to form the opinion referred to in subsection (1)(c).

subsection.content: If the Authority has exercised its power under subsection (1), (2) or (3), it may disclose to the public details of its decision, the reasons for which the decision was made, and any material facts relating to the case.
The Authority, in forming an opinion for subsection (1)(c), may, among other matters (including those specified in section 64ZZA), take into account the present or past conduct of the person.

section.name: s82
section.heading: Procedural requirements in respect of exercise of powers under section 81

subsection.content: The Authority must not exercise a power under section 81 without first giving the person in respect of whom the power is to be exercised a reasonable opportunity of being heard.
If the Authority decides to exercise a power under section 81 in respect of a person, the Authority must inform the person of its decision to do so by notice in writing.

subsection.leadIn: The notice must include—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a statement of the reasons for the decision;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the time when the decision is to take effect;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in so far as applicable, the duration and terms of the revocation, suspension or prohibition to be imposed under the decision;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: in so far as applicable, the terms in which the person is to be reprimanded under the decision; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: in so far as applicable, the amount of the pecuniary penalty to be imposed under the decision and the period within which it is required to be paid.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority must consult the Monetary Authority before exercising a power under section 81 in respect of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an authorized institution;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a person who—

subparagraph.content: is, or was, a regulated person; and
is, or was, employed by an authorized institution; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: a person who—

subparagraph.content: is, or was, a regulated person; and
is, or was, appointed as an agent by an authorized institution,

subsection.continued: in relation to any regulated activity carried on by the institution.

subsection.content: In subsection (1), a reference to an opportunity of being heard is a reference to an opportunity to make written representations or oral representations.

section.name: s83
section.heading: Guidelines for exercise of power to impose pecuniary penalty under section 81

subsection.leadIn: The Authority must not exercise a power under section 81 to impose a pecuniary penalty unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it has published, in the Gazette and in any other manner it considers appropriate, guidelines to indicate the way in which it proposes to exercise that power; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in exercising that power, it has had regard to the guidelines so published.

subsection.content: The guidelines are not subsidiary legislation.
The Authority must consult the Monetary Authority before publishing any guideline under subsection (1).

section.name: s84
section.heading: General provisions relating to exercise of disciplinary powers

subsection.leadIn: At any time when the Authority is contemplating exercising a power under section 81, it may, if it considers it appropriate to do so in the interests of policy holders or potential policy holders or the public interest, by agreement with the person concerned—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: exercise a power that the Authority may exercise in respect of the person under section 81; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: take an additional action that the Authority considers appropriate in the circumstances of the case.

subsection.content: If the Authority exercises a power or takes an additional action in respect of a person under subsection (1), it must comply with section 82 as if that section applied to the power or action, unless the person agrees otherwise.

In reaching a decision under this Part, the Authority may have regard to any information or material in its possession which is relevant to the decision, regardless of how the information or material has come into its possession.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority must consult the Monetary Authority before exercising a power under subsection (1) in respect of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an authorized institution;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: a person who—

subparagraph.content: is, or was, a regulated person; and
is, or was, employed by an authorized institution; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: a person who—

subparagraph.content: is, or was, a regulated person; and
is, or was, appointed as an agent by an authorized institution,

subsection.continued: in relation to any regulated activity carried on by the institution.

section.name: s85
section.heading: Order for payment of pecuniary penalty

subsection.content: A person ordered to pay a pecuniary penalty under section 81 must pay the penalty to the Authority within 30 days, or a longer period that the Authority specifies by notice under section 82(3)(e), after the order has taken effect.
The Court of First Instance may, on an application of the Authority, register an order to pay a pecuniary penalty made under section 81 in the Court.
On registration, the order is to be regarded as an order of the Court of First Instance made within the civil jurisdiction of the Court for the payment of money.

For making an application under subsection (2), the Authority must produce to the Registrar of the High Court a notice in writing requesting that the order be registered, together with the original and a copy of the order.
A pecuniary penalty paid to or recovered by the Authority under an order made under section 81 must be paid by the Authority into the general revenue.

division.name: D3
division.heading: Consequences of Revocation or Suspension under Division 2

section.name: s86
section.heading: Effect of suspension under section 81

subsection.leadIn: If a licence or approval of a person is suspended under section 81, the person must, during the suspension period—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: continue to be regarded for the purposes of this Ordinance, but not sections 64G, 64ZE, 64ZF, 64ZN and 64ZO, to be licensed; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: without limiting paragraph (a), continue to be required to comply with the provisions of this Ordinance relating to a licensed insurance intermediary or responsible officer as would apply to the person were the licence or approval not so suspended.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting the powers that can be exercised by the Authority under section 81, the Authority may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: revoke the licence of a person under this Part even though the licence is suspended under section 81; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: revoke the approval of a person under this Part even though the approval is suspended under section 81.

section.name: s87
section.heading: Revocation or suspension of licence does not avoid or affect agreement, etc.
section.leadIn: Subject to section 64N, a revocation or suspension of the licence of a person under section 81 does not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: avoid or affect an agreement, transaction or arrangement entered into or arranged by the person, regardless of whether the agreement, transaction or arrangement was entered into or arranged before or after the revocation or suspension; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: affect a right, obligation or liability arising under the agreement, transaction or arrangement.

section.name: s88
section.heading: Requirement to transfer records on revocation or suspension of licence

subsection.content: If the licence of a person is revoked or suspended under section 81, the Authority may, by notice in writing, require the person to transfer to a client a copy of the records relating to the client’s assets or affairs, held at any time for the client as specified in the notice.

A person who, without reasonable excuse, fails to comply with a requirement imposed on the person under subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years.

section.name: s89
section.heading: Permission to carry on business operations on revocation or suspension of licence

subsection.leadIn: If the licence of a person is revoked under section 81, the Authority may, by notice in writing, permit the person, subject to the conditions specified in the notice, to carry on business operations for closing down the business connected with the revocation.

If the licence of a person is suspended under section 81, the Authority may, by notice in writing, permit the person, subject to the conditions specified in the notice, to carry on only essential business operations for the protection of the interests of the policy holders concerned during the period of suspension.

subsection.content: If the Authority has granted a permission to a person under subsection (1) or (2), the person must not, because of its carrying on business operations in compliance with the permission, be regarded as having contravened section 64G or 120.

A permission under subsection (1) or (2), and the imposition of conditions under any of those subsections, take effect at the time of the service of the notice or at the time specified in the notice, whichever is the later.

section.name: s90
section.heading: Conduct requirements for licensed insurance intermediaries
section.leadIn: When carrying on a regulated activity, a licensed insurance intermediary—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must act honestly, fairly, in the best interests of the policy holder concerned or the potential policy holder concerned, and with integrity;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must exercise a level of care, skill and diligence that may reasonably be expected of a prudent person who is carrying on the regulated activity;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: may advise only on matters for which the intermediary is competent to advise;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: must have regard to the particular circumstances of the policy holder or the potential policy holder that are necessary for ensuring that the regulated activity is appropriate to the policy holder or the potential policy holder;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: must make the disclosure of information to the policy holder or the potential policy holder that is necessary for the policy holder or the potential policy holder to be sufficiently informed for the purpose of making any material decision;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: must use its best endeavours to avoid a conflict between the interests of the intermediary and the interests of the policy holder or the potential policy holder;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: must disclose any conflict mentioned in paragraph (f) to the policy holder or the potential policy holder;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: must ensure that the assets of the policy holder or the potential policy holder are promptly and properly accounted for; and
must comply with other requirements that are prescribed by rules made under sections 94 and 129.

section.name: s91
section.heading: Conduct requirements for licensed insurance agencies and their responsible officers

subsection.leadIn: A licensed insurance agency—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must establish and maintain proper controls and procedures for securing compliance with the conduct requirements set out in section 90 by the agency and the licensed technical representatives (agent) appointed by the agency;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must use its best endeavours to secure observance with the controls and procedures established under paragraph (a) by the licensed technical representatives (agent) appointed by the agency;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: must ensure that its responsible officer has sufficient authority within the agency for carrying out the responsibilities set out in subsection (2); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: must provide its responsible officer with sufficient resources and support for carrying out the responsibilities set out in subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: A responsible officer of a licensed insurance agency must use the officer’s best endeavours to ensure that the agency—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has established and maintains proper controls and procedures for securing compliance with the conduct requirements set out in section 90 by the agency and the licensed technical representatives (agent) appointed by the agency; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: uses its best endeavours to secure observance with the controls and procedures established under paragraph (a) by the licensed technical representatives (agent) appointed by the agency.

section.name: s92
section.heading: Conduct requirements for licensed insurance broker companies and their responsible officers

subsection.leadIn: A licensed insurance broker company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must establish and maintain proper controls and procedures for securing compliance with the conduct requirements set out in section 90 by the company and the licensed technical representatives (broker) appointed by the company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must use its best endeavours to secure observance with the controls and procedures established under paragraph (a) by the licensed technical representatives (broker) appointed by the company;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: must ensure that its responsible officer has sufficient authority within the company for carrying out the responsibilities set out in subsection (2); and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: must provide its responsible officer with sufficient resources and support for carrying out the responsibilities set out in subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: A responsible officer of a licensed insurance broker company must use the officer’s best endeavours to ensure that the company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has established and maintains proper controls and procedures for securing compliance with the conduct requirements set out in section 90 by the company and the licensed technical representative (broker) appointed by the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: uses its best endeavours to secure observance with the controls and procedures established under paragraph (a) by the licensed technical representatives (broker) appointed by the company.

section.name: s93
section.heading: Breach of conduct requirements

subsection.content: A failure to comply with a requirement specified in section 90, 91 or 92 does not by itself render any person liable to any judicial proceedings.

subsection.leadIn: To avoid doubt, this section does not affect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the extent (if any) to which a failure to comply with any other provision of this Ordinance is actionable; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any liability of a person under the common law or any other enactment, regardless of whether the circumstances giving rise to the liability would also constitute a failure mentioned in subsection (1).

section.name: s94
section.heading: Rules on conduct requirements for licensed insurance intermediaries

subsection.content: The Authority may make rules requiring licensed insurance intermediaries to comply with the practices and standards, relating to the conduct of the intermediaries in carrying on regulated activities, that are specified in the rules.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (1) and without affecting section 131, the Authority may in the rules—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: prohibit the use of any misleading or deceptive advertisement by a licensed insurance intermediary and impose conditions on the use of advertisements;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: require a licensed insurance intermediary to provide specified information to its client on entering into a policy or on the request of the client;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: require a licensed insurance intermediary to take specified steps to ascertain, in relation to its client, specified matters relating to the identity, financial situation and financial and insurance needs of the client that are relevant to the services to be provided by the intermediary;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: require a licensed insurance intermediary to take specified steps before providing information or advice to its client;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: require a licensed insurance intermediary to take specified steps to ensure that disclosure is made to its client of the coverage, terms and conditions, and risks in relation to the policy recommended to the client;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: require a licensed insurance intermediary to take specified steps to ensure that disclosure is made to its client of any commission or advantage that the intermediary receives or is to receive in relation to the policy recommended to the client;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: require a licensed insurance intermediary to take specified steps to comply with the conduct requirements under sections 90, 91 and 92;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: require a licensed insurance intermediary not to effect a transaction in specified circumstances;
prohibit the use by a licensed insurance intermediary of information relating to the affairs of its clients except in specified circumstances and under specified conditions;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: require a licensed insurance intermediary to take specified steps in cases of conflict of interest between the intermediary and its client;

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: specify the circumstances and conditions under which a licensed insurance intermediary may receive any property or services from another licensed insurance intermediary in consideration of directing business to that other licensed insurance intermediary; and
provide for any other matter in relation to the practices and standards relating to conduct in carrying on regulated activities by a licensed insurance intermediary.

section.name: s95
section.heading: Codes of conduct for licensed insurance intermediaries

subsection.content: The Authority may publish, in the Gazette and in any other manner it considers appropriate, codes of conduct for giving guidance relating to the practices and standards with which licensed insurance intermediaries are ordinarily expected to comply in carrying on regulated activities.
Subsection (1) applies without limiting the powers of the Authority to make rules under section 94.

subsection.leadIn: A code of conduct may refer to obligations to observe—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any other codes or requirements issued or imposed otherwise than by the Authority;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: continuing obligations, including an obligation to provide or undergo continuous training; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: practices and standards concerning any of the matters described in section 94(2).

subsection.content: The Authority may from time to time amend the whole or any part of any code of conduct published.
A failure on the part of a licensed insurance intermediary to comply with a code of conduct does not by itself render the intermediary liable to any judicial or other proceedings.
However, the failure may be taken into account in considering, for a provision of this Ordinance, whether the intermediary is a fit and proper person to remain licensed.

subsection.leadIn: In any proceedings under this Ordinance before a court—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a code of conduct is admissible in evidence; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a provision in the code appears to the court to be relevant to a question arising in the proceedings, the court must, in determining the question, take into account any compliance or non-compliance of the provision.

subsection.leadIn: A code of conduct published under this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may be of general or special application and may be made so as to apply only in specified circumstances; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may make different provisions for different circumstances and provide for different cases or classes of cases.

subsection.content: A code of conduct published under this section is not subsidiary legislation.

part.name: P11A
part.heading: Insurance Groups and Insurance Holding Companies

section.name: s95A
section.heading: Interpretation of Part XIA

subsection.leadIn: In this Part—
subsection.def: chief executive (行政總裁), in relation to a designated insurance holding company, means a person (by whatever name called) who—(a)is in direct employment of, or is acting for or by arrangement with, the company; and(b)is, whether alone or jointly with another person, responsible for the management, and the conduct of the business, of the company and its supervised group;

control function (管控職能), in relation to the supervised group of a designated insurance holding company, means any of the following functions that is likely to enable the individual responsible for the performance of the function to exercise a significant influence on the business of the group—(a)risk management function, which is a function to establish the strategies, policies and procedures to manage different types of key risks of the group;(b)financial control function, which is a function to oversee all financial matters (including investments, accounting and financial reporting) of the group;(c)compliance function, which is a function to establish and formulate the standards, policies and procedures to ensure the compliance with legal and regulatory requirements that are applicable to the group;(d)internal audit function, which is a function to establish and implement an audit plan to examine and evaluate the adequacy and effectiveness of the controls to manage risks of the group;(e)actuarial function, which is a function to evaluate and monitor—(i)the technical provisions, premium and pricing strategies of any member of the group that carries on insurance business (insurer group member);(ii)the reserving and investment policies and reinsurance arrangements of any insurer group member; and(iii)the policies and controls in respect of any insurer group member’s vulnerability to fluctuations in risk exposures and distribution policies;(f)any other function specified in a notice under subsection (4);
designation (指定) means a designation made under section 95C(1);
director (董事), in relation to a designated insurance holding company, includes a person in accordance with whose directions or instructions a director of the company is accustomed to act;
Hong Kong company (香港公司) means a company as defined by section 2(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622);
IAIS principles (國際保險監管者協會原則) means principles adopted by the International Association of Insurance Supervisors;
inspector (查察員) means a person appointed as an inspector under section 95ZZE(6);
insurance group (保險集團) means any grouping of 2 or more entities the primary business of which is insurance business;

insurance holding company (保險控權公司) means a Hong Kong company— (Amended 14 of 2025 s. 140)(a)that is a holding company of an authorized insurer, whether or not it is also an authorized insurer; or(b)that is both—(i)an authorized insurer; and(ii)a holding company of a body corporate that carries on insurance business in or from a place outside Hong Kong;

International Association of Insurance Supervisors (國際保險監管者協會) means the body, whose general secretariat is based in Basel, Switzerland, that sets international standards for insurance supervision and includes any successor body of that body;
investigator (調查員) means a person directed or appointed under section 95ZZG(2) to investigate a matter;

involved supervisor (法定監管者), in relation to an insurance group or a supervised group, means an authority that performs a function under the laws of any place to supervise a member of the group in relation to matters concerning insurance or any other financial service;

key person in control functions (管控要員), in relation to a designated insurance holding company, means an individual who is responsible for the performance of one or more of the control functions for the company in respect of its supervised group;

majority shareholder controller (大股東控權人), in relation to a designated insurance holding company—(a)means a person who, alone or with an associate or through a nominee, is entitled to exercise, or control the exercise of, 50% or more of the voting power at a general meeting of the company; but(b)does not include a supervisory manager of the company; (Added 20 of 2023 s. 74)

minority shareholder controller (小股東控權人), in relation to a designated insurance holding company—(a)means a person who, alone or with an associate or through a nominee, is entitled to exercise, or control the exercise of, 15% or more but less than 50%, of the voting power at a general meeting of the company; but(b)does not include a supervisory manager of the company; (Added 20 of 2023 s. 74)

policy holder (保單持有人), in relation to a supervised group, means—(a)a person who for the time being is the legal holder of a policy for securing a contract with any member of the group that carries on insurance business; and(b)a person to whom, under such a policy, a benefit is due or a payment is payable;
shareholder controller (股東控權人) means a majority shareholder controller or a minority shareholder controller; (Replaced 20 of 2023 s. 74)
supervised group (受監管集團)—see section 95D;
supervisory manager (監管經理), in relation to a designated insurance holding company, means the person appointed under section 95ZT(1)(b) to be the supervisory manager of the company.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of the definition of insurance group in subsection (1), it does not matter—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: whether the grouping of the entities exists as a distinct legal person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: whether the entities are incorporated, established or formed in or outside Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: whether the insurance business is carried on, whether wholly or partly, in or from Hong Kong or a place outside Hong Kong.

subsection.content: For the purposes of the definition of key person in control functions in subsection (1), it does not matter whether the individual is solely responsible, or is jointly responsible with other key persons in control functions of the designated insurance holding company, for the performance of the relevant functions.

Subject to subsection (5), the Financial Secretary may, by notice published in the Gazette, specify a function to be a control function for the purposes of paragraph (f) of the definition of control function in subsection (1).

The Financial Secretary must not specify a function under subsection (4) unless the Financial Secretary is satisfied that the function is likely to enable the individual responsible for the performance of the function to exercise a significant influence on the business of the supervised group of a designated insurance holding company.

subsection.leadIn: In this Part—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference to this Part includes any other provision of this Ordinance that is relevant for the purposes of this Part; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reference to the public, or the public interest, is not limited to the public, or the public interest, of Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: In relation to a designated insurance holding company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference in this Part to the carrying on of insurance business by a member of its supervised group includes the carrying on of such business by the member whether in or from Hong Kong or a place outside Hong Kong; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reference in this Part to any matter in relation to its supervised group, or any member of the group, is not limited to such a matter insofar as Hong Kong is concerned.

section.name: s95B
section.heading: Functions of Authority in relation to insurance groups

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this Part, the Authority has the following functions—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: to regulate and supervise insurance groups of which the Authority is appointed as the group supervisor.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (1)(b), for an insurance group to be regulated and supervised under that subsection, the Authority is to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: lead and plan, and co-ordinate with other involved supervisors, the supervisory activities and measures in respect of the group;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: gather, and disseminate among other involved supervisors, information related to the supervision of the group;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: supervise the recovery and resolution planning of the group;

paragraph.name: d
e
paragraph.content: assess the financial situation, and the soundness of the business practices, of the group; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: consider the appropriate measures to be taken by the Authority in relation to the group, including—

subparagraph.content: designating an insurance holding company within the group to be regulated under this Part; and
supervising the designated insurance holding company’s compliance with this Part.

section.name: s95C
section.heading: Designation by Authority

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may, by notice published in the Gazette, designate an insurance holding company within an insurance group as a designated insurance holding company if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Authority is, in accordance with IAIS principles, appointed as the group supervisor of the group; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Authority considers it appropriate for the company to be so designated.

subsection.leadIn: In determining whether it is appropriate for an insurance holding company within an insurance group to be designated, the Authority may, among other matters, take into account any of the following matters—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the number of jurisdictions outside Hong Kong in or from which the insurance business of the group is carried on;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the size of the insurance and other businesses of the group;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any criteria promulgated by an international standards setting body (including the International Association of Insurance Supervisors) that the Authority considers relevant.

subsection.leadIn: Before designating an insurance holding company, the Authority must serve on the company a preliminary written notice stating—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the Authority is considering designating the company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the reasons why the Authority is considering doing so; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: that the company may, within the period specified in the preliminary notice—

subparagraph.content: make written representations to the Authority; and
if the company so requests, make oral representations to a person appointed for that purpose by the Authority.

subsection.content: If representations are made under subsection (3), the Authority must take them into account before making the designation.
If the Authority decides to designate an insurance holding company, the Authority must inform the company of the decision by a written notice.

subsection.leadIn: A designation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: takes effect on the date specified in the notice under subsection (1); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has effect until it is withdrawn under section 95E(1) or (3).

subsection.content: A notice under subsection (1) is not subsidiary legislation.

section.name: s95D
section.heading: Supervised group of designated insurance holding company

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), the supervised group of a designated insurance holding company consists of the following entities (default members)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: all subsidiaries of the company; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any other entities that are, according to the accounting standards applicable to the preparation of the specified financial statements, treated as members of the insurance group to which the company belongs.

subsection.leadIn: The supervised group of a designated insurance holding company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: includes any entity included as a member of the group under subsection (3); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: excludes any entity excluded from being a member of the group under subsection (4).

subsection.content: The Authority may include an entity as a member of the supervised group of a designated insurance holding company if the Authority considers that the entity is closely linked to a default member of the group through any financial, contractual or operational relationship.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may exclude an entity from being a member of the supervised group of a designated insurance holding company if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for an entity that is a default member of the group—the Authority considers that the entity should not be treated as a member of the group; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for an entity that has been included as a member of the group under subsection (3)—the Authority considers that the entity is no longer closely linked to a default member as described in that subsection.

subsection.content: For the purposes of subsections (1), (2), (3) and (4), it does not matter whether the subsidiary or entity is incorporated, established or formed in or outside Hong Kong.

subsection.leadIn: Before deciding to include an entity under subsection (3), or to exclude an entity under subsection (4), in relation to the supervised group of a designated insurance holding company, the Authority must serve on the company a preliminary written notice stating—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the Authority is considering including the entity as a member, or excluding the entity from being a member, of the group;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the reasons why the Authority is considering doing so; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: that the company may, within the period specified in the preliminary notice—

subparagraph.content: make written representations to the Authority; and
if the company so requests, make oral representations to a person appointed for that purpose by the Authority.

subsection.content: If representations are made under subsection (6), the Authority must take them into account before making the inclusion or exclusion.

If the Authority decides to include an entity under subsection (3), or to exclude an entity under subsection (4), in relation to a designated insurance holding company, the Authority must inform the company of the decision and, for a decision to include, the reasons, by a written notice.
An inclusion under subsection (3), or an exclusion under subsection (4), takes effect on the date specified in the notice under subsection (8).

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: accounting standards (會計準則), in relation to the specified financial statements of a reference company, means—(a)if the company is a Hong Kong company—the accounting standards generally accepted in Hong Kong; or(b)in any other case—any accounting standards that the Authority considers to be comparable to the accounting standards mentioned in paragraph (a);

reference company (參照公司), in relation to a designated insurance holding company, means the company that satisfies the following conditions—(a)it is either—(i)the designated insurance holding company; or(ii)a holding company of the designated insurance holding company; and(b)it is, in the opinion of the Authority, the most appropriate company to make reference to for ascertaining information that gives a true and fair view of the structure and composition of the insurance group to which the designated insurance holding company belongs for the purposes of this Part;

specified financial statements (指明財務報表), in relation to a designated insurance holding company, means the following financial statements of its reference company—(a)if the reference company is a Hong Kong company—its annual consolidated financial statements as defined by section 357(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622); or(b)in any other case—the financial statements of the reference company that—(i)the reference company is required under the laws of its place of incorporation, establishment or formation to prepare; and(ii)contain information that the Authority considers to be comparable to the information contained in the annual consolidated financial statements mentioned in paragraph (a).

section.name: s95E
section.heading: Withdrawal of designation

subsection.content: The Authority may, by notice published in the Gazette, withdraw the designation of a designated insurance holding company if the Authority considers it is no longer appropriate for the company to be designated.

In determining whether it is no longer appropriate for a designated insurance holding company to be designated, the Authority may, among other matters, take into account any of the matters specified in section 95C(2).

The Authority must, by notice published in the Gazette, withdraw the designation of a designated insurance holding company if the appointment of the Authority as the group supervisor of the insurance group to which the company belongs (as mentioned in section 95C(1)(a)) is no longer in effect.
If the Authority decides to withdraw the designation of a designated insurance holding company under subsection (1) or (3), the Authority must inform the company of the decision by a written notice.
A withdrawal under subsection (1) or (3) takes effect on the date specified in the notice under that subsection.
A notice under subsection (1) or (3) is not subsidiary legislation.

division.name: D3
division.heading: General Duties of Designated Insurance Holding Company

section.name: s95F
section.heading: Payment of prescribed fees

subsection.leadIn: A designated insurance holding company must pay to the Authority each of the following prescribed fees no later than the payment due date prescribed for the fee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a designation fee payable on designation;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: fees payable at prescribed intervals.

subsection.content: A designated insurance holding company must, within the period specified in a written notice served by the Authority on the company, deposit with the Authority a written return in the specified form for enabling the Authority to ascertain the amount of a fee payable under subsection (1) by the company.

subsection.leadIn: A designated insurance holding company that contravenes subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to a fine at level 4; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a continuing offence—to a further fine of $1,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: prescribed (訂明) means prescribed by a regulation made under section 128.

section.name: s95G
section.heading: Waiver or reduction of prescribed fees

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may, by a written notice served on a designated insurance holding company, waive or reduce a fee that is or will be payable under section 95F(1)(b) by the company if it appears to the Authority that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the designation of the company is likely to be withdrawn under section 95E(1) or (3); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the withdrawal is likely to take effect after the fee becomes payable, and before the next fee becomes payable under section 95F(1)(b), by the company.

subsection.leadIn: If it no longer appears to the Authority that a withdrawal is likely to be made and take effect as mentioned in subsection (1), the Authority may, by a written notice served on the designated insurance holding company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: revoke a waiver or reduction under subsection (1) that applies to a fee payable by the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the Authority considers it appropriate—specify a date by which the fee must be paid by the company in place of the payment due date prescribed for the fee.

section.name: s95H
section.heading: Maintaining arrangements with holding company

subsection.content: A designated insurance holding company that has a holding company must maintain with its holding company any arrangements specified by the Authority under subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may specify the arrangements that a designated insurance holding company must maintain with any of its holding companies for ensuring that the designated insurance holding company is able to, through procuring the taking of any necessary steps by its holding company, comply with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: this Part;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a notice or requirement given or imposed under this Part; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a condition imposed under this Part.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: amend an arrangement specified under subsection (2); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: revoke a specification made under subsection (2).

subsection.content: The power under subsection (2) or (3) is only exercisable by a written notice served on the designated insurance holding company.

Before specifying or amending an arrangement under subsection (2) or (3)(a), the Authority must give the designated insurance holding company an opportunity to make written or oral representations as to why the arrangement should not be specified or amended.
If representations are made under subsection (5), the Authority must take them into account before specifying or amending the arrangement.
If an arrangement is specified or amended under subsection (2) or (3)(a), the notice under subsection (4) must include a statement of the reasons for specifying or amending the arrangement.

subsection.leadIn: A specification, amendment or revocation made under subsection (2) or (3) takes effect at the later of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the time when the notice under subsection (4) is served on the designated insurance holding company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the time specified in the notice.

division.name: D4
division.heading: Shareholder Controller of Designated Insurance Holding Company

section.name: s95I
section.heading: Prohibition against becoming shareholder controller without approval

subsection.leadIn: A person must not become a minority shareholder controller of a designated insurance holding company unless— (Amended 20 of 2023 s. 75)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Authority approves under section 95M the person to be such a minority shareholder controller; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person is a majority shareholder controller of the company immediately before becoming such a minority shareholder controller.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.content: A person must not become a majority shareholder controller of a designated insurance holding company unless the Authority approves under section 95M the person to be such a majority shareholder controller, regardless of whether the person is a minority shareholder controller of the company before becoming such a majority shareholder controller. (Added 20 of 2023 s. 75)

A person who intends to become a minority shareholder controller or a majority shareholder controller of a designated insurance holding company may apply in accordance with subsection (3) for an approval under section 95M for the person to be such a shareholder controller.

subsection.leadIn: An application under subsection (2) must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be made in writing;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: be served on the Authority; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: contain—

subparagraph.content: the particulars of the designated insurance holding company to which the application relates;
the particulars of the person who seeks to be approved to be a minority shareholder controller or a majority shareholder controller (as the case may be) of the company (applicant); and
any other information specified in the specified form.

subsection.leadIn: The applicant must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: pay a prescribed fee for the application; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provide to the Authority any information that the Authority reasonably requires to enable it to consider the application.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.content: It is a defence for a person charged with an offence under subsection (5) to prove that the person did not know that the acts or circumstances as a result of which the person became a minority shareholder controller or a majority shareholder controller (as the case may be) of the designated insurance holding company were such as to have that effect.

section.name: s95J
section.heading: Person becoming shareholder controller with approval

subsection.content: Subject to section 95OA, this section applies if a person becomes a minority shareholder controller or a majority shareholder controller of a designated insurance holding company with an approval under section 95M to be such a shareholder controller.

The person must, within 14 days after becoming a minority shareholder controller or a majority shareholder controller of the designated insurance holding company, notify the Authority of that fact in accordance with subsection (3).

subsection.leadIn: A notice under subsection (2) must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be given in writing;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: be served on the Authority; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: contain—

subparagraph.content: the particulars of the designated insurance holding company to which the notice relates;
the particulars of the person who is approved to be, and has become, a minority shareholder controller or a majority shareholder controller (as the case may be) of the company; and
any other information specified in the specified form.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months,

subsection.continued: and in the case of a continuing offence—to a further fine of $2,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s95K
section.heading: Person becoming unapproved shareholder controller without notice

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person becomes a minority shareholder controller or a majority shareholder controller of a designated insurance holding company in contravention of section 95I(1) or (1A);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person did not know that the acts or circumstances as a result of which the person became such a shareholder controller were such as to have that effect; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the person subsequently becomes aware of the fact that the person has become such a shareholder controller.

subsection.content: The person must, within 14 days after becoming aware of the fact that the person has become a minority shareholder controller or a majority shareholder controller (as the case may be) of the designated insurance holding company, apply in accordance with subsection (3) for an approval under section 95M for the person to be such a shareholder controller.

subsection.leadIn: An application under subsection (2) must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be made in writing;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: be served on the Authority; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: contain—

subparagraph.content: the particulars of the designated insurance holding company to which the application relates;
the particulars of the person who seeks to be approved to be a minority shareholder controller or a majority shareholder controller (as the case may be) of the company (applicant); and
any other information specified in the specified form.

subsection.leadIn: The applicant must—

paragraph.name: a
