paragraph.content: pay a prescribed fee for the application; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provide to the Authority any information that the Authority reasonably requires to enable it to consider the application.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months,

subsection.continued: and in the case of a continuing offence—to a further fine of $2,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s95L
section.heading: Pre-existing shareholder controller

subsection.content: This section applies if a person is a shareholder controller of a designated insurance holding company as at the beginning of the date of designation (pre-existing shareholder controller).

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (3), a pre-existing shareholder controller is taken to be approved under section 95M on the date of designation to be— (Amended 20 of 2023 s. 78)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if it is a minority shareholder controller of the designated insurance holding company as at the beginning of the date of designation—a minority shareholder controller of the company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if it is a majority shareholder controller of the designated insurance holding company as at the beginning of the date of designation—a majority shareholder controller of the company. (Amended 20 of 2023 s. 78)

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2) does not apply to a pre-existing shareholder controller if the Authority has, before the date of designation—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: given a notice under section 13B(2H) rejecting the application of the pre-existing shareholder controller for an approval to be a shareholder controller of an authorized insurer; (Replaced 20 of 2023 s. 78)

paragraph.name: ab
paragraph.content: served a notice of objection under section 13BA(3) objecting to the pre-existing shareholder controller being a minority shareholder controller of an authorized insurer; (Added 20 of 2023 s. 78)

paragraph.name: ac
paragraph.leadIn: served a notice of objection under section 13BA(4) objecting to the pre-existing shareholder controller—

subparagraph.content: being a majority shareholder controller of an authorized insurer; or
being any shareholder controller of the insurer; or (Added 20 of 2023 s. 78)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: served a notice under section 14(4) objecting to the appointment of the pre-existing shareholder controller as a controller (within the meaning of section 9(1)(a)(iii)(B)) of an authorized insurer.

subsection.content: For subsection (3), it does not matter whether the authorized insurer is the designated insurance holding company or not.

A pre-existing shareholder controller who falls within subsection (3) must, within 14 days after becoming aware of the designation in respect of the designated insurance holding company, apply in accordance with subsection (6) for an approval under section 95M for the person to be a minority shareholder controller or a majority shareholder controller (as the case may be) of the company. (Amended 20 of 2023 s. 78)

subsection.leadIn: An application under subsection (5) must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be made in writing;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: be served on the Authority; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: contain—

subparagraph.content: the particulars of the designated insurance holding company to which the application relates;

the particulars of the person who seeks to be approved to be a minority shareholder controller or a majority shareholder controller (as the case may be) of the company (applicant); and (Amended 20 of 2023 s. 78)
any other information specified in the specified form.

subsection.leadIn: The applicant must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: pay a prescribed fee for the application; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provide to the Authority any information that the Authority reasonably requires to enable it to consider the application.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (5) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months,

subsection.continued: and in the case of a continuing offence—to a further fine of $2,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s95M
section.heading: Approval of shareholder controller

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may, on an application made under section 95I(2), 95K(2) or 95L(5) by a person (applicant), approve the applicant to be a minority shareholder controller or a majority shareholder controller of the designated insurance holding company specified in the application if— (Amended 20 of 2023 s. 79)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 95I(3) and (4), 95K(3) and (4) or 95L(6) and (7) (as the case may be) is complied with; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Authority is satisfied that the applicant is a fit and proper person to be such a shareholder controller. (Amended 20 of 2023 s. 79)

subsection.leadIn: If the Authority intends to reject an application mentioned in subsection (1), the Authority must serve on the applicant a preliminary written notice stating—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the Authority is considering rejecting the application;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the reasons why the Authority is considering doing so; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: that the applicant may, within the period specified in the preliminary notice—

subparagraph.content: make written representations to the Authority; and
if the applicant so requests, make oral representations to a person appointed for that purpose by the Authority.

subsection.content: If representations are made under subsection (2), the Authority must take them into account before rejecting the application.
After deciding on the application, the Authority must give the applicant a written notice of the result of the application.
If the application is rejected, the notice must include a statement of the reasons for the rejection.

section.name: s95N
section.heading: Objection to being shareholder controller

subsection.content: This section applies in relation to a person approved under section 95M to be a shareholder controller of a designated insurance holding company.

subsection.leadIn: For subsection (1), it does not matter whether the approval is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: given on an application made under section 95I(2), 95K(2) or 95L(5); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: taken to be given by virtue of section 95L(2) or 95OA(3), or Part 3 of Schedule 12. (Amended 20 of 2023 s. 80)

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may, by a written notice served on a person who is a minority shareholder controller of a designated insurance holding company, object to the person being such a minority shareholder controller if it appears to the Authority that— (Amended 20 of 2023 s. 80)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person is not, or is no longer, a fit and proper person to be such a minority shareholder controller; or (Amended 20 of 2023 s. 80)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person has contravened a condition imposed under section 95Z on the approval.

subsection.name: 3A
subsection.leadIn: Subsection (3B) applies if it appears to the Authority that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person who is a majority shareholder controller of a designated insurance holding company is not, or is no longer, a fit and proper person to be such a majority shareholder controller; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person has contravened a condition imposed under section 95Z on the approval. (Added 20 of 2023 s. 80)

subsection.name: 3B
subsection.leadIn: The Authority, by a written notice served on the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may object to the person being a majority shareholder controller of the company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: (if it also appears to the Authority that the person is not, or is no longer, a fit and proper person to be a minority shareholder controller of the company) may object to the person being any shareholder controller of the company. (Added 20 of 2023 s. 80)

subsection.content: A notice under subsection (3) or (3B) (notice of objection) must include a statement of the grounds for the objection. (Amended 20 of 2023 s. 80)

subsection.leadIn: Before serving a notice of objection on a person, the Authority must serve on the person a preliminary written notice stating—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the Authority is considering serving the notice of objection;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the reasons why the Authority is considering doing so; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: that the person may, within the period specified in the preliminary notice—

subparagraph.content: make written representations to the Authority; and
if the person so requests, make oral representations to a person appointed for that purpose by the Authority.

subsection.content: If representations are made under subsection (5), the Authority must take them into account before serving a notice of objection.
The Authority may, by a written notice served on a person, revoke a notice of objection served on the person if it appears to the Authority that the grounds for the objection no longer exist.

section.name: s95O
section.heading: Person ceasing to be shareholder controller

subsection.leadIn: If a person ceases to be a minority shareholder controller or a majority shareholder controller of a designated insurance holding company— (Amended 20 of 2023 s. 81)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any approval under section 95M for the person to be such a shareholder controller ceases to have effect; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person must, within 14 days after ceasing to be such a shareholder controller, notify the Authority of that fact in accordance with subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: A notice under subsection (1)(b) must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be given in writing;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: be served on the Authority; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: contain—

subparagraph.content: the particulars of the designated insurance holding company to which the notice relates;
the particulars of the person who has ceased to be a minority shareholder controller or a majority shareholder controller (as the case may be) of the company; and (Amended 20 of 2023 s. 81)
any other information specified in the specified form.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (1)(b) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months,

subsection.continued: and in the case of a continuing offence—to a further fine of $2,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

subsection.content: It is a defence for a person charged with an offence under subsection (3) to prove that the person did not know that the acts or circumstances as a result of which the person ceased to be a minority shareholder controller or a majority shareholder controller (as the case may be) of the designated insurance holding company were such as to have that effect. (Amended 20 of 2023 s. 81)

This section does not apply to a person who, on ceasing to be a majority shareholder controller of a designated insurance holding company, becomes a minority shareholder controller of the company. (Added 20 of 2023 s. 81)

section.name: s95OA
section.heading: Majority shareholder controller becoming minority shareholder controller

subsection.content: If a person, on ceasing to be a majority shareholder controller of a designated insurance holding company, becomes a minority shareholder controller of the company, the person must, within 14 days after becoming such a minority shareholder controller, notify the Authority in the specified form.

subsection.leadIn: If the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: fails to comply with subsection (1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: did not know that the acts or circumstances as a result of which the person became a minority shareholder controller of the designated insurance holding company were such as to have that effect; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: subsequently becomes aware of the fact that the person has become a minority shareholder controller of the company,

subsection.continued: the person must serve on the Authority, within 14 days after becoming aware of that fact, a written notice stating that the person has become such a minority shareholder controller and containing the information specified by the Authority.

subsection.content: A person who complies with subsection (1) or (2) is taken to be approved to be a minority shareholder controller of the company under section 95M.

subsection.leadIn: A person who fails to comply with subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to a fine at level 4; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a continuing offence—to a further fine of $1,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

subsection.content: If a person is charged with an offence under subsection (4), it is a defence for the person to establish that the person took all reasonable precautions and exercised all due diligence to avoid the commission of the offence.

subsection.leadIn: A person who fails to comply with subsection (2) commits an offence and is liable on conviction—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to a fine at level 4; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a continuing offence—to a further fine of $1,000 for each day during which the offence continues.

subsection.leadIn: A person is taken to have established a matter that needs to be established for a defence under subsection (5) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is sufficient evidence to raise an issue with respect to that matter; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the contrary is not proved by the prosecution beyond reasonable doubt.

section.name: s95P
section.heading: Restrictions on shares if shareholder controller unapproved or objected to

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to the specified shares in relation to a person who is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an unapproved shareholder controller within the meaning of subsection (2) of a designated insurance holding company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a shareholder controller objected to within the meaning of subsection (3) of a designated insurance holding company.

subsection.leadIn: A person is an unapproved shareholder controller of a designated insurance holding company if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person is a minority shareholder controller or a majority shareholder controller of the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person is not approved, or taken to be approved, under section 95M to be such a shareholder controller. (Amended 20 of 2023 s. 83)

subsection.leadIn: A person is a shareholder controller objected to of a designated insurance holding company if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person is a shareholder controller of the company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Authority has served a notice under section 95N(3) or (3B) (notice of objection) on the person objecting to the person being a shareholder controller of the company; and (Amended 20 of 2023 s. 83)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the objection has taken effect under section 116.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may, by a written notice served on the person, direct that any specified shares in relation to the person are, until further notice, subject to one or more of the following restrictions—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: no voting rights are exercisable in respect of the shares;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: no further shares are to be issued in right of them or in pursuance of any offer made to their holder;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: except in a liquidation, no payment is to be made of any sums due from the designated insurance holding company on the shares, whether in respect of capital or otherwise.

subsection.content: If shares are subject to a restriction under subsection (4)(a), an agreement to transfer the shares or, in the case of unissued shares, the right to be issued with them, and any issue of such shares, is void.

If shares are subject to a restriction under subsection (4)(c) or (d), an agreement to transfer any right to be issued with other shares in right of those shares, or to receive any payment on them (otherwise than in a liquidation) is void.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority must, by a written notice served on a person, revoke a notice served under subsection (4) on the person if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a person who is an unapproved shareholder controller of a designated insurance holding company—the person is approved, or taken to be approved, under section 95M to be a minority shareholder controller or a majority shareholder controller (as the case may be) of the company; or (Amended 20 of 2023 s. 83)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a person who is a shareholder controller objected to of a designated insurance holding company—the notice of objection is revoked under section 95N(7).

subsection.leadIn: If a notice is served under subsection (4) or (7) on a person, the Authority must also serve a copy of the notice on—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the designated insurance holding company to which the notice relates; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the notice relates to shares held by an associate or nominee of the person—the associate or nominee.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: specified shares (指明股份), in relation to a person—(a)means the shares by virtue of which the person is, whether alone or with an associate or through a nominee, entitled to exercise, or control the exercise of, the voting power at any general meeting of the designated insurance holding company of which the person is an unapproved shareholder controller or shareholder controller objected to; but(b)does not include— (Amended 20 of 2023 s. 83)(i)if the person is an unapproved shareholder controller—any such shares held by the person, or any such associate or nominee, before the person became an unapproved shareholder controller of the company;(ii)if the person is a shareholder controller objected to and the notice of objection is served under section 95N(3)—any such shares held by the person, or any such associate or nominee, before the person became a minority shareholder controller of the company;(iii)if the person is a shareholder controller objected to and the notice of objection is served under section 95N(3B)(a)—any such shares held by the person, or any such associate or nominee, before the person became a majority shareholder controller of the company; or(iv)if the person is a shareholder controller objected to and the notice of objection is served under section 95N(3B)(b)—any such shares held by the person, or any such associate or nominee, before the person became any shareholder controller of the company. (Amended 20 of 2023 s. 83)

section.name: s95Q
section.heading: Sale of shares if shareholder controller unapproved

subsection.content: This section applies to the specified shares in relation to a person who is an unapproved shareholder controller within the meaning of section 95P(2) of a designated insurance holding company.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may apply to the Court of First Instance for an order under subsection (3) in respect of any specified shares in relation to the person if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Authority has rejected an application made under section 95I(2), 95K(2) or 95L(5) by the person for the person to be approved under section 95M to be a minority shareholder controller or a majority shareholder controller (as the case may be) of the company, and the rejection has taken effect under section 116; or (Amended 20 of 2023 s. 84)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Authority has served a notice under section 95P(4) in respect of the shares, and the notice has not been revoked under section 95P(7).

subsection.leadIn: The Court of First Instance may, on an application made under subsection (2) in respect of any specified shares—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: order the sale of the shares; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the shares are subject to any restrictions under section 95P(4), order that the shares cease to be subject to those restrictions.

subsection.content: If an order is made under subsection (3) in respect of any shares, the Court of First Instance may, on the application of the Authority, make any further order relating to the sale or transfer of the shares as it thinks fit.

subsection.leadIn: If any shares are sold pursuant to an order under this section—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: any such person may apply to the Court of First Instance for an order that the whole or part of the proceeds to be paid to the person.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: specified shares (指明股份) has the meaning given by section 95P(9).

section.name: s95R
section.heading: Punishment for attempted evasion of restrictions on shares

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person, knowing that any shares are subject to a restriction under section 95P(4)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: exercises, or purports to exercise, any right to dispose of those shares or of any right to be issued with those shares;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: votes in respect of those shares (whether as holder or proxy), or appoint a proxy to vote in respect of those shares;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: while being the holder of those shares, fails to notify of their being subject to that restriction any other person whom—

subparagraph.content: the person does not know to be aware of that fact; but

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: enters into an agreement in relation to those shares that is void under section 95P(5) or (6) as—

subparagraph.content: the holder of those shares; or

subparagraph.leadIn: a person being entitled to—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: any right to be issued with other shares in right of those shares; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: receive any payment on those shares (otherwise than in a liquidation).

subsection.content: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: A designated insurance holding company commits an offence if the company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: issues any shares in contravention of any restrictions under section 95P(4); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: makes any payment in contravention of such restrictions.

subsection.content: A designated insurance holding company that commits an offence under subsection (3) is liable on conviction to a fine at level 4.
If an individual commits an offence under subsection (4) by virtue of section 124, the individual is, on conviction, also liable to imprisonment for 6 months.

division.name: D5
division.heading: Chief Executive, Director and Key Person in Control Functions of Designated Insurance Holding Company

section.name: s95S
section.heading: Prohibition against appointment without approval

subsection.content: A designated insurance holding company must not appoint a person as a chief executive, director or key person in control functions of the company unless the appointment has been approved under section 95U.
A designated insurance holding company may apply in accordance with subsection (3) for an approval under section 95U of an appointment mentioned in subsection (1).

subsection.leadIn: An application under subsection (2) must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be made in writing;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be in the specified form;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: be served on the Authority; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: contain—

subparagraph.content: the particulars of the designated insurance holding company to which the application relates (applicant);
the particulars of the person proposed to be appointed as a chief executive, director or key person in control functions (as the case may be) of the company (proposed person); and
any other information specified in the specified form.

subsection.leadIn: The applicant must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: pay a prescribed fee for the application; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: provide to the Authority—

subparagraph.content: a statement signed by the proposed person that the application is made with the person’s knowledge and consent; and
any information that the Authority reasonably requires to enable it to consider the application.

subsection.leadIn: A designated insurance holding company that contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to a fine of $200,000; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a continuing offence—to a further fine of $2,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s95T
section.heading: Pre-existing chief executive, director or key person in control functions

subsection.content: This section applies if a person is a chief executive, director or key person in control functions of a designated insurance holding company as at the beginning of the date of designation.

subsection.leadIn: In relation to a person mentioned in subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person is taken to be appointed as a chief executive, director or key person in control functions (as the case may be) of the designated insurance holding company on the date of designation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: subject to subsections (3), (4) and (5), the appointment (pre-existing appointment) is taken to be approved under section 95U on the date of designation.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2) does not apply to a pre-existing appointment if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is an appointment of a person as a chief executive of a designated insurance holding company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the Authority has, before the date of designation, objected to an appointment of the person as a controller of an authorized insurer to which section 13A applies by—

subparagraph.content: rejecting an application for an approval under section 13A(2) of the appointment; or
serving a notice under section 13A(7) to revoke such an approval.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2) also does not apply to a pre-existing appointment if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is an appointment of a person as a director of a designated insurance holding company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the Authority has, before the date of designation—

subparagraph.leadIn: objected to an appointment of the person as a director of an authorized insurer to which section 13AC applies by—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: rejecting an application for an approval under section 13AC(2) of the appointment; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: serving a notice under section 13AC(7) to revoke such an approval; or
objected to an appointment of the person as a director of an authorized insurer to which section 14(4) applies by serving a notice under that section.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2) also does not apply to a pre-existing appointment if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is an appointment of a person as a key person in control functions of a designated insurance holding company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the Authority has, before the date of designation, objected to an appointment of the person as a key person in control functions of an authorized insurer to which section 13AE applies by—

subparagraph.content: rejecting an application for an approval under section 13AE(2) of the appointment; or
serving a notice under section 13AE(7) to revoke such an approval.

subsection.content: For subsections (3), (4) and (5), it does not matter whether the authorized insurer is the designated insurance holding company or not.

subsection.leadIn: If a pre-existing appointment of a person in relation to a designated insurance holding company falls within subsection (3), (4) or (5), the Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may serve on the company a written notice requiring the company to terminate the appointment by the date specified in the notice; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a notice is served under paragraph (a)—must serve on the person a copy of the notice.

subsection.content: A designated insurance holding company on which a notice is served under subsection (7)(a) must comply with the notice.

subsection.leadIn: A designated insurance holding company that contravenes subsection (8) commits an offence and is liable on conviction—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to a fine of $200,000; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a continuing offence—to a further fine of $2,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s95U
section.heading: Approval of appointment

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may, on an application made under section 95S(2) by a designated insurance holding company, approve the appointment of the person specified in the application (proposed person) as a chief executive, director or key person in control functions of the company if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 95S(3) and (4) is complied with; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Authority is satisfied that the proposed person is a fit and proper person to be a chief executive, director or key person in control functions (as the case may be) of the company.

subsection.content: After deciding on the application, the Authority must give the designated insurance holding company and the proposed person a written notice of the result of the application.
If the application is rejected, the notice must include a statement of the reasons for the rejection.

section.name: s95V
section.heading: Objection to appointment

subsection.content: This section applies in relation to an appointment approved under section 95U of a person as a chief executive, director or key person in control functions of a designated insurance holding company.

subsection.leadIn: For subsection (1), it does not matter whether the approval is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: given on an application made under section 95S(2); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: taken to be given by virtue of section 95T(2).

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may, by a written notice served on the person and the designated insurance holding company, object to the appointment if it appears to the Authority that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person is not, or is no longer, a fit and proper person to be a chief executive, director or key person in control functions (as the case may be) of the company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person or the company has contravened a condition imposed under section 95Z on the approval.

subsection.content: A notice under subsection (3) (notice of objection) must include a statement of the grounds for the objection.

subsection.leadIn: Before serving a notice of objection on a person and a designated insurance holding company, the Authority must serve on the person and the company a preliminary written notice stating—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the Authority is considering serving the notice of objection;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the reasons why the Authority is considering doing so; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: that the person and the company may, either jointly or separately, within the period specified in the preliminary notice—

subparagraph.content: make written representations to the Authority; and
if the person or company so requests, make oral representations to a person appointed for that purpose by the Authority.

subsection.content: If representations are made under subsection (5), the Authority must take them into account before serving a notice of objection.

The Authority may, by a written notice served on a person and a designated insurance holding company, revoke a notice of objection served on the person and the company if it appears to the Authority that the grounds for the objection no longer exist.
If a notice of objection is served in relation to an appointment, the designated insurance holding company must terminate the appointment by the date specified in the notice.

subsection.leadIn: A designated insurance holding company that contravenes subsection (8) commits an offence and is liable on conviction—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to a fine of $200,000; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a continuing offence—to a further fine of $2,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s95W
section.heading: Restrictions on acting if appointment unapproved or objected to

subsection.content: A person appointed as a specified officer of a designated insurance holding company in contravention of section 95S(1) must not act, or continue to act, as such a specified officer.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (3) applies if the appointment of a person as a specified officer of a designated insurance holding company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: falls within section 95T(3), (4) or (5); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is objected to under section 95V(3).

subsection.leadIn: A person mentioned in subsection (2) must not continue to act as the specified officer mentioned in that subsection after—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (2)(a)—the date specified in the notice a copy of which is served under section 95T(7)(b) on the person; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (2)(b)—the date specified in the notice served under section 95V(3) on the person.

subsection.leadIn: A person who contravenes subsection (1) or (3) commits an offence and is liable on conviction—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to a fine of $200,000 and to imprisonment for 2 years; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a continuing offence—to a further fine of $2,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: specified officer (指明人員) means a chief executive, director or key person in control functions.

division.name: D6
division.heading: Supplementary Provisions Regarding Shareholder Controller, Chief Executive, Director and Key Person in Control Functions

section.name: s95X
section.heading: Return of pre-existing shareholder controllers, chief executives, directors and key persons in control functions

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (2), a designated insurance holding company must, within 3 months after the date of designation, deposit with the Authority a written return in the specified form for informing the Authority of the particulars of every person who is a shareholder controller, chief executive, director or key person in control functions of the company as at the beginning of the date of designation.

The Authority may extend the 3-month period mentioned in subsection (1) by a period not exceeding 3 months if it appears to the Authority that the circumstances are such that a period longer than 3 months should be allowed.

subsection.leadIn: A designated insurance holding company that contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to a fine of $200,000; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a continuing offence—to a further fine of $1,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s95Y
section.heading: Determination of fit and proper

subsection.leadIn: In determining whether a person is a fit and proper person for the purposes of sections 95M, 95N, 95U and 95V, the Authority must have regard to the following matters—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the education or other qualifications or experience of the person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person’s ability to act competently, honestly and fairly;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the reputation, character, reliability and integrity of the person;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the person’s financial status or solvency;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: whether any disciplinary action has been taken against the person by—

subparagraph.content: the Monetary Authority;
the Securities and Futures Commission;
the Mandatory Provident Fund Schemes Authority; or

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: if the person is a body corporate in a group of companies, any information in the possession of the Authority, whether provided by the person or not, relating to— (Amended 20 of 2023 s. 85)

subparagraph.content: any other body corporate in the group of companies; or
any substantial shareholder or officer of the person or of a body corporate referred to in subparagraph (i); (Amended 20 of 2023 s. 85)

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: the state of affairs of any other business that the person carries on or proposes to carry on; and (Amended 20 of 2023 s. 85)

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: if the person is a body corporate—its internal controls and corporate governance. (Added 20 of 2023 s. 85)

subsection.content: The obligations imposed on the Authority under subsection (1) are in addition to those of the Authority to have regard to any other matter that the Authority considers relevant in making the determination.

section.name: s95Z
section.heading: Conditions on approval given under sections 95M and 95U

subsection.leadIn: This section applies in relation to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an approval under section 95M for a person to be a shareholder controller of a designated insurance holding company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an approval under section 95U of an appointment of a person as a chief executive, director or key person in control functions of a designated insurance holding company.

subsection.leadIn: For subsection (1)(a), it does not matter whether the approval is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: given on an application made under section 95I(2), 95K(2) or 95L(5); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: taken to be given by virtue of section 95L(2) or 95OA(3), or Part 3 of Schedule 12. (Amended 20 of 2023 s. 86)

subsection.leadIn: For subsection (1)(b), it does not matter whether the approval is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: given on an application made under section 95S(2); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: taken to be given by virtue of section 95T(2).

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may impose any condition that it considers appropriate on an approval mentioned in subsection (1) when—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the approval is given; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at any time after the approval is given or taken to be given. (Amended 20 of 2023 s. 86)

subsection.content: The Authority may amend or revoke any condition imposed under subsection (4).
The power under subsection (4) or (5) is only exercisable by a written notice served on the affected person.

Before imposing or amending a condition under subsection (4) or (5), the Authority must give the affected person an opportunity to make written or oral representations as to why the condition should not be imposed or amended.
If representations are made under subsection (7), the Authority must take them into account before imposing or amending the condition.
If a condition is imposed or amended under subsection (4) or (5), the notice under subsection (6) must include a statement of the reasons for imposing or amending the condition.

subsection.leadIn: The imposition, amendment or revocation of a condition under subsection (4) or (5) takes effect at the later of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the time when the notice under subsection (6) is served on the affected person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the time specified in the notice.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: affected person (當事人) means—(a)for a condition on an approval under section 95M—the person mentioned in subsection (1)(a); or(b)for a condition on an approval under section 95U—the person and the designated insurance holding company mentioned in subsection (1)(b).

section.name: s95ZA
section.heading: Offences in relation to application for approval

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person, in connection with an application for an approval under section 95M or 95U—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: makes a statement that is false or misleading in a material particular; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: knows that, or is reckless as to whether, the statement is false or misleading in the material particular.

subsection.leadIn: A person commits an offence if the person, in connection with an application for an approval under section 95M or 95U—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: omits a material particular from a statement with the result that the statement is rendered false or misleading; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: knows that, or is reckless as to whether, the material particular is omitted from the statement.

subsection.content: A person who commits an offence under subsection (1) or (2) is liable on conviction to a fine at level 5 and to imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s95ZB
section.heading: Effect of application under section 95I in relation to section 13B

subsection.leadIn: Subsections (1B), (2) and (3) apply if— (Amended 20 of 2023 s. 87)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: on the one hand—

subparagraph.content: a person will, as a result of certain acts or circumstances, become a minority shareholder controller of a designated insurance holding company; and
the person has made an application under section 95I(2) for an approval under section 95M for the person to be such a shareholder controller; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on the other hand—

subparagraph.content: the person will also, as a result of the same acts or circumstances, become a minority shareholder controller of an authorized insurer that is either the company itself or another member of its supervised group; and
the person is prohibited under section 13B(2) from becoming such a shareholder controller unless the person is approved under section 13B(2B) to be such a shareholder controller.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: Subsections (1B), (2) and (3) apply if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: on the one hand—

subparagraph.content: the person has made an application under section 95I(2) for an approval under section 95M for the person to be such a shareholder controller; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on the other hand—

subparagraph.content: the person will also, as a result of the same acts or circumstances, become a majority shareholder controller of an authorized insurer that is either the company itself or another member of its supervised group; and

the person is prohibited under section 13B(2A) from becoming such a shareholder controller unless the person is approved under section 13B(2B) to be such a shareholder controller. (Added 20 of 2023 s. 87)

subsection.name: 1B
subsection.leadIn: When the person makes the application mentioned in subsection (1)(a)(ii) or (1A)(a)(ii), the person is taken to have made an application under section 13B(2B)(a) for an approval for the person to be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (1)—a minority shareholder controller of the authorized insurer; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (1A)—a majority shareholder controller of the authorized insurer. (Added 20 of 2023 s. 87)

subsection.leadIn: If the application under section 95I(2) for an approval under section 95M for the person to be a minority shareholder controller (in the case of subsection (1)) or a majority shareholder controller (in the case of subsection (1A)) of the designated insurance holding company is approved, the person is taken to be approved under section 13B(2B) to be— (Amended 20 of 2023 s. 87)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (1)—a minority shareholder controller of the authorized insurer; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (1A)—a majority shareholder controller of the authorized insurer.

subsection.leadIn: If the application under section 95I(2) for an approval under section 95M for the person to be a minority shareholder controller (in the case of subsection (1)) or a majority shareholder controller (in the case of subsection (1A)) of the designated insurance holding company is rejected (rejection), the application under section 13B(2B)(a) for an approval for the person to be— (Amended 20 of 2023 s. 87)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (1)—a minority shareholder controller of the authorized insurer; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (1A)—a majority shareholder controller of the authorized insurer,

subsection.continued: is taken to be rejected under section 13B(2H) when the notice of the rejection is given to the person under section 95M(4).

section.name: s95ZC
section.heading: Effect of application under section 95K in relation to section 13B

subsection.leadIn: Subsections (2), (3) and (4) apply if— (Amended 20 of 2023 s. 88)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: on the one hand—

subparagraph.content: a person has, as a result of certain acts or circumstances, become a minority shareholder controller of a designated insurance holding company in contravention of section 95I(1); and
the person falls within section 95K(1) so that the person is required to comply with section 95K(2); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on the other hand—

subparagraph.content: the person has also, as a result of the same acts or circumstances, become a minority shareholder controller of an authorized insurer that is either the company itself or another member of its supervised group in contravention of section 13B(2); and
the person falls within section 13B(3) so that the person is required to comply with that section.

subsection.name: 1A
subsection.leadIn: Subsections (2), (3) and (4) apply if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: on the one hand—

subparagraph.content: a person has, as a result of certain acts or circumstances, become a majority shareholder controller of a designated insurance holding company in contravention of section 95I(1A); and
the person falls within section 95K(1) so that the person is required to comply with section 95K(2); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on the other hand—

subparagraph.content: the person has also, as a result of the same acts or circumstances, become a majority shareholder controller of an authorized insurer that is either the company itself or another member of its supervised group in contravention of section 13B(2A); and
the person falls within section 13B(3) so that the person is required to comply with that section. (Added 20 of 2023 s. 88)

subsection.content: The person is taken to have complied with section 13B(3) if the person complies with section 95K(2).

subsection.leadIn: If an application made under section 95K(2) for an approval under section 95M for the person to be a minority shareholder controller (in the case of subsection (1)) or a majority shareholder controller (in the case of subsection (1A)) of the designated insurance holding company is approved, the person is taken to be approved under section 13B(2B) to be— (Amended 20 of 2023 s. 88)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (1)—a minority shareholder controller of the authorized insurer; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (1A)—a majority shareholder controller of the authorized insurer.

subsection.leadIn: If an application made under section 95K(2) for an approval under section 95M for the person to be a minority shareholder controller (in the case of subsection (1)) or a majority shareholder controller (in the case of subsection (1A)) of the designated insurance holding company is rejected (rejection), the application under section 13B(2B)(a) for an approval for the person to be— (Amended 20 of 2023 s. 88)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (1)—a minority shareholder controller of the authorized insurer; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of subsection (1A)—a majority shareholder controller of the authorized insurer,

subsection.continued: is taken to be rejected under section 13B(2H) when the notice of the rejection is given to the person under section 95M(4).

section.name: s95ZD
section.heading: Effect of approval under section 95U in relation to sections 13A, 13AC and 13AE

subsection.content: This section applies if a designated insurance holding company is also an authorized insurer.

If the Authority gives an approval under section 95U of the appointment of a person as a chief executive, director or key person in control functions (specified officer) of the designated insurance holding company, the Authority is taken to have at the same time given an approval under section 13A, 13AC or 13AE (as the case may be) of the appointment of the person as an equivalent officer of the authorized insurer.

subsection.leadIn: For subsection (2), an equivalent officer is—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: if the specified officer is a director of the designated insurance holding company—a director of the authorized insurer; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the specified officer is a key person in control functions of the designated insurance holding company—a key person in control functions (as defined by section 13AE(12)) of the authorized insurer who is responsible for the same control functions for the company and the insurer.

section.name: s95ZE
section.heading: Interpretation of Part XIA, Division 7
section.leadIn: In this Division—
section.def: assessment framework (評估架構) means a process—(a)that is established within the supervised group of a designated insurance holding company for assessing whether a major acquisition is material to the group; and(b)that involves, for that purpose—(i)the quantification of the overall adverse impact that the acquisition may have on the group, taking into account any adverse impact on—(A)the capital resources of the group;(B)the risk profile of the group;(C)the ongoing ability of the group to maintain compliance with the group capital requirements for the group; and(D)any other matter that the Authority considers to be relevant; and(ii)the setting of an amount that the quantified adverse impact on the group must not exceed in order for the acquisition to be assessed as not material;

financial reporting member (財務匯報成員), in relation to the supervised group of a designated insurance holding company, means the member of the group that satisfies the following conditions—(a)it is either—(i)the designated insurance holding company; or(ii)a holding company of the designated insurance holding company; and(b)it is, in the opinion of the Authority, the most appropriate member to be assigned for reporting information that gives a true and fair view of the financial position and financial performance of the group for the purposes of this Part;

major acquisition (重大收購), in relation to a designated insurance holding company, means the acquisition by any member of its supervised group alone, or with an associate or another member of the group, or through a nominee, of—(a)the control of 50% or more of the voting power at a general meeting of a body corporate; or(b)50% or more of the issued share capital of a body corporate;

specified financial statements (指明財務報表), in relation to a financial reporting member, means—(a)if the member is a Hong Kong company—its annual consolidated financial statements as defined by section 357(1) of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622); or(b)in any other case—the financial statements of the member that—(i)the member is required under the laws of its place of incorporation, establishment or formation to prepare; and(ii)contain information that the Authority considers to be comparable to the information contained in the annual consolidated financial statements mentioned in paragraph (a).

section.name: s95ZF
section.heading: Auditor must be appointed

subsection.leadIn: A designated insurance holding company must ensure that a person who satisfies the requirements under subsection (2) or (3) is appointed as the auditor of the financial reporting member for its supervised group—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: within 1 month beginning on the date of designation; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: as soon as practicable after the office of the auditor becomes vacant.

subsection.leadIn: If the financial reporting member is a Hong Kong company, the auditor must be a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: who is not prohibited under section 20AAZZR of the Accounting and Financial Reporting Council Ordinance (Cap. 588) from holding any appointment as an auditor of a company; and (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: who is not disqualified under section 393 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) for appointment as an auditor of the member.

subsection.leadIn: If the financial reporting member is not a Hong Kong company, the auditor must be a person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: who may lawfully practise as an auditor in the place of incorporation, establishment or formation of the member; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: without prejudice to paragraph (a), who holds a qualification that the Authority accepts as being of a standard comparable to that of a person mentioned in subsection (2).

subsection.content: A designated insurance holding company must, within 1 month beginning on the date on which an auditor is appointed under subsection (1), serve on the Authority a written notice stating that fact and the name and qualifications of the person appointed.

subsection.leadIn: A designated insurance holding company that contravenes subsection (1) or (4) commits an offence and is liable on conviction—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to a fine at level 4; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a continuing offence—to a further fine of $1,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s95ZG
section.heading: Notification in respect of auditor

subsection.leadIn: A designated insurance holding company must immediately notify the Authority in writing if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the financial reporting member for its supervised group decides to remove or replace an auditor appointed under section 95ZF;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a person appointed under section 95ZF to be the auditor of the financial reporting member for its supervised group ceases to be such an auditor otherwise than in consequence of a decision referred to in paragraph (a); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: where the financial reporting member for its supervised group is a Hong Kong company—

subparagraph.content: a person appointed under section 95ZF to be the auditor of the member is also an auditor appointed under section 395, 396, 397 or 398 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622), or deemed to be reappointed under section 403 of that Ordinance, of the member (CO auditor); and

subparagraph.leadIn: the member either—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: proposes to give special notice to its shareholders of a resolution removing such a CO auditor before the end of the auditor’s term of office; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: gives notice to its shareholders of a resolution replacing such a CO auditor at the end of the auditor’s term of office.

subsection.leadIn: An auditor appointed under section 95ZF must immediately notify the Authority in writing if the auditor—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: resigns;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: where the auditor has been appointed for a fixed term—decides not to seek reappointment; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: decides to add a qualification or adverse statement to the auditor’s report on the financial statements required to be submitted under section 95ZH.

subsection.leadIn: A designated insurance holding company that contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to a fine at level 4; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a continuing offence—to a further fine of $1,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

subsection.content: It is a defence for a designated insurance holding company charged with an offence under subsection (3) to prove that the company took all reasonable precautions and exercised all due diligence to avoid the commission of the offence.

section.name: s95ZH
section.heading: Submission of financial statements and auditor’s reports

subsection.leadIn: A designated insurance holding company must submit to the Authority the following documents in accordance with this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the specified financial statements of the financial reporting member for its supervised group; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a report of the auditor of the member appointed under section 95ZF on those statements.

subsection.content: A document required to be submitted under subsection (1) must comply with any requirements specified by the Authority in a written notice served on the designated insurance holding company.

subsection.leadIn: A designated insurance holding company must submit a document under subsection (1) by depositing it with the Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: within 4 months after the end of the period to which the document relates; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the 4-month period is extended by the Authority under subsection (4)—within the extended period.

subsection.content: The Authority may extend the 4-month period mentioned in subsection (3)(a) by a period not exceeding 3 months if it appears to the Authority that the circumstances are such that a period longer than 4 months should be allowed.

subsection.leadIn: A designated insurance holding company that contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable on conviction—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to a fine of $200,000; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a continuing offence—to a further fine of $1,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

section.name: s95ZI
section.heading: Requirements in relation to group capital

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may, by rules made under section 129, prescribe—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: requirements in relation to the capital of the supervised group of a designated insurance holding company, including among others—

subparagraph.content: the minimum amount of capital that the group must maintain (including how such an amount is to be determined); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: requirements for a designated insurance holding company to report to the Authority (including how such a report is to be made)—

subparagraph.content: the capital position of its supervised group; and
any information relevant to the compliance with the group capital requirements for its supervised group; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: requirements for a designated insurance holding company to disclose to the public (including how such a disclosure is to be made)—

subparagraph.content: the group capital requirements for its supervised group;
the capital position of its supervised group; and
any information relevant to a matter mentioned in subparagraph (i) or (ii).

subsection.content: The Authority may, by a written notice served on a designated insurance holding company, vary a requirement prescribed by virtue of subsection (1)(a) that applies to the supervised group of the company if the Authority is satisfied, on reasonable grounds, that it is prudent to make the variation so that the group capital requirements for the group are commensurate with the risks associated with the group.
A designated insurance holding company must ensure that the group capital requirements for its supervised group are at all times complied with.

subsection.leadIn: If the Authority is of the opinion that a designated insurance holding company has failed to comply with subsection (3), the Authority may, by a written notice served on the company, require the company to do any of the following acts within the period specified in the notice—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: submit to the Authority the company’s plan for—

subparagraph.content: restoring the supervised group of the company to a sound financial position; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the Authority considers a plan submitted inadequate—propose modifications to the plan to the satisfaction of the Authority;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: give effect to the plan accepted by the Authority.

subsection.leadIn: A designated insurance holding company must comply with—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: any requirements imposed under subsection (4);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: its reporting requirements; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: its disclosure requirements.

subsection.leadIn: A designated insurance holding company that contravenes subsection (5)(a) commits an offence and is liable on conviction on indictment—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to a fine of $200,000; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a continuing offence—to a further fine of $10,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

subsection.leadIn: A designated insurance holding company that contravenes subsection (5)(b) or (c) commits an offence and is liable on conviction on indictment—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to a fine of $200,000; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a continuing offence—to a further fine of $5,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

subsection.content: It is a defence for a designated insurance holding company charged with an offence under subsection (6) or (7) to prove that, at the time of the alleged offence, the company had a reasonable excuse for failing to comply with the requirement concerned.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: group capital requirement (集團資本規定), in relation to the supervised group of a designated insurance holding company, means—(a)a requirement prescribed by virtue of subsection (1)(a) that applies to the group; or(b)if the requirement is varied under subsection (2)—the requirement so varied;
reporting requirement (報告規定), in relation to a designated insurance holding company, means a requirement prescribed by virtue of subsection (1)(b) that applies to the company.

section.name: s95ZJ
section.heading: Requirements in relation to major acquisition

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (6), a designated insurance holding company must not make a major acquisition, or allow the making of a major acquisition by another member of the supervised group of the company, unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the acquisition has been approved by the Authority under section 95ZK; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the acquisition has been assessed, through an assessment framework approved by the Authority under section 95ZM, as not material to the supervised group of the company.

subsection.content: A designated insurance holding company may apply in accordance with subsection (3) for an approval under section 95ZK of a major acquisition.

subsection.leadIn: An application under subsection (2) must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be made in writing;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be served on the Authority; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: contain—

subparagraph.content: the particulars of the major acquisition proposed to be made (proposed acquisition); and
the particulars of the entity proposing to make the acquisition.

subsection.leadIn: A designated insurance holding company that makes an application under subsection (2) must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: pay a prescribed fee for the application; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: provide to the Authority—

subparagraph.content: any information that the Authority reasonably requires to enable it to consider the application; and
if the proposed acquisition has been assessed through the assessment framework mentioned in subsection (1)(b) as material to the supervised group of the company—a record of the assessment.

subsection.leadIn: A designated insurance holding company that contravenes subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on conviction on indictment—to a fine at $200,000; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on summary conviction—to a fine at level 6,

subsection.continued: and in the case of a continuing offence—to a further fine of $2,000 for every day during which the offence continues.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply to a major acquisition made or allowed by a designated insurance holding company if the acquisition is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: made pursuant to a written agreement that is—

subparagraph.content: entered into before the date of designation of the company; and
binding on the entity within the supervised group of the company that makes the acquisition; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: made solely for investment purposes as part of the insurance business carried on by any member of the supervised group of the company.

section.name: s95ZK
section.heading: Approval of major acquisition

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may, on an application made under section 95ZJ(2) by a designated insurance holding company, approve the major acquisition specified in the application (proposed acquisition) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 95ZJ(3) and (4) is complied with; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Authority is satisfied that the proposed acquisition will not be prejudicial, or is unlikely to be prejudicial, to the interests of the policy holders of the supervised group of the company.

subsection.leadIn: If the Authority intends to reject an application mentioned in subsection (1), the Authority must serve on the designated insurance holding company a preliminary written notice stating—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the Authority is considering rejecting the application;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the reasons why the Authority is considering doing so; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: that the company may, within the period specified in the preliminary notice—

subparagraph.content: make written representations to the Authority; and
if the company so requests, make oral representations to a person appointed for that purpose by the Authority.

subsection.content: If representations are made under subsection (2), the Authority must take them into account before rejecting the application.
After deciding on the application, the Authority must give the designated insurance holding company a written notice of the result of the application.
If the application is rejected, the notice must include a statement of the reasons for the rejection.

section.name: s95ZL
section.heading: Assessment framework for major acquisition

subsection.content: A designated insurance holding company may apply in accordance with subsection (2) for an approval under section 95ZM of an assessment framework.

subsection.leadIn: An application under subsection (1) must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be made in writing;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: be served on the Authority; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: contain the particulars of the assessment framework.

subsection.leadIn: A designated insurance holding company that makes an application under subsection (1) must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: pay a prescribed fee for the application; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: provide to the Authority any information that the Authority reasonably requires to enable it to consider the application.

section.name: s95ZM
section.heading: Approval of assessment framework for major acquisition

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may, on an application made under section 95ZL(1) by a designated insurance holding company, approve the assessment framework specified in the application (proposed assessment framework) if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: section 95ZL(2) and (3) is complied with; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Authority is satisfied that the proposed assessment framework is appropriate for assessing whether a major acquisition is material to the supervised group of the company.

subsection.leadIn: If the Authority intends to reject an application mentioned in subsection (1), the Authority must serve on the designated insurance holding company a preliminary written notice stating—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the Authority is considering rejecting the application;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the reasons why the Authority is considering doing so; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: that the company may, within the period specified in the preliminary notice—

subparagraph.content: make written representations to the Authority; and
if the company so requests, make oral representations to a person appointed for that purpose by the Authority.

subsection.content: If representations are made under subsection (2), the Authority must take them into account before rejecting the application.
After deciding on the application, the Authority must give the designated insurance holding company a written notice of the result of the application.
If the application is rejected, the notice must include a statement of the reasons for the rejection.

section.name: s95ZN
section.heading: Conditions for exercising intervention powers

subsection.leadIn: A power under section 95ZO, 95ZP or 95ZQ is exercisable in relation to a designated insurance holding company only if the Authority is of the opinion that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the exercise of the power is desirable for the Authority’s carrying out any of its functions under this Part in relation to the company;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: the company has failed to comply with this Part; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the company has provided inaccurate information to the Authority for the purposes of this Part.

subsection.leadIn: A power under section 95ZR is exercisable in relation to a designated insurance holding company only if the Authority is of the opinion that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the exercise of the power is desirable for the Authority’s carrying out any of its functions under this Part in relation to the company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the exercise of the powers under sections 95ZO, 95ZP and 95ZQ, or the exercise of those powers alone, would not be appropriate for the Authority’s carrying out that function.

subsection.leadIn: A power under section 95ZT is exercisable in relation to a designated insurance holding company only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: any of the following happens—

subparagraph.content: the Authority is of the opinion, or is informed by the company, that the group capital requirements (as defined by section 95ZI(9)) for the supervised group of the company is not being, or is likely to be not, complied with;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the Authority is of the opinion that—

subparagraph.content: the measures taken by the company or its supervised group for the company or group to recover from such a situation have failed; or
any attempt to take the measures mentioned in subparagraph (ii) for the company or group to recover from such a situation is likely to fail or cannot be implemented within a reasonable time.

section.name: s95ZO
section.heading: Power to require information and documents

subsection.content: Subject to section 95ZN(1), the Authority may, by a written notice served on a designated insurance holding company, require the company to provide information or produce documents about any matter that relates to any member of its supervised group.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may, in a notice under subsection (1), specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the times or intervals at which the information or documents are to be provided or produced;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the form in which the information or documents are to be prepared (including any verification or certification as may be required); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the way by which the information or documents are to be provided or produced.

section.name: s95ZP
section.heading: Power to require report

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 95ZN(1), the Authority may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: by a written notice served on a designated insurance holding company, require the company to, within the time specified in the notice, provide to the Authority a report in respect of any matter that relates to any member of its supervised group; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: appoint a person to provide to the Authority a report in respect of any matter that relates to any member of the supervised group of a designated insurance holding company.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may, in a notice under subsection (1)(a), specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the form in which the report is to be prepared (including any verification or certification as may be required); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the way by which the report is to be provided.

subsection.content: The Authority may appoint under subsection (1)(b) any person who appears to the Authority to possess the skills necessary for providing a report in respect of the matter concerned.

subsection.leadIn: If a person is appointed under subsection (1)(b) to provide a report in respect of a matter that relates to a member of the supervised group of a designated insurance holding company, the Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must, by a written notice served on the company, notify the company of the appointment; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: may, in the notice, require the company to—

subparagraph.content: if the matter relates to the company—provide to the person any assistance as reasonably required by the person; or
if the matter relates to another member—procure the provision by the member to the person any assistance as reasonably required by the person.

subsection.leadIn: A designated insurance holding company must—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: pay to a person appointed under subsection (1)(b) any fees reasonably charged by the person for providing a report in respect of a matter that relates to a member of its supervised group; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: reimburse the Authority for—

subparagraph.content: any such fees paid by the Authority; and
any incidental expenses incurred by the Authority in procuring the provision of such a report by the person.

subsection.content: Any fees and expenses required to be paid or reimbursed under subsection (5) are recoverable as a civil debt.

section.name: s95ZQ
section.heading: Power to require compliance with restrictions on transfer of assets

subsection.leadIn: Subject to section 95ZN(1), the Authority may, by a written notice served on a designated insurance holding company, require the company to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: refrain from transferring any assets of the company to any related entity; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: comply with any other restrictions specified in the notice on the transfer of any assets of the company to a related entity.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may, by a written notice served on a designated insurance holding company, require the company to ensure that other members of its supervised group, or any one or more of them—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: refrain from transferring any assets of the members to any related entity; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: comply with any other restrictions specified in the notice on the transfer of any assets of the members to a related entity.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: related entity (有關連實體), in relation to a designated insurance holding company, means—(a)any member of its supervised group; or(b)a holding company of the company that is not a member of the group.

section.name: s95ZR
section.heading: Power to require action in relation to supervised group

subsection.content: Subject to section 95ZN(2), the Authority may, by a written notice served on a designated insurance holding company, require the company to, within the time specified in the notice, take any action in relation to the affairs, business or property of its supervised group as the Authority considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (1), the Authority may require under that subsection a designated insurance holding company to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: do or refrain from doing anything; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: ensure that other members of its supervised group, or any one or more of them, do or refrain from doing anything.

subsection.content: The Authority may provide a copy of a requirement imposed under subsection (1) to any involved supervisor of the supervised group of the designated insurance holding company.
To avoid doubt, the exercise of a power under this section does not prejudice the exercise of any other power under this Division.

section.name: s95ZS
section.heading: Variation and rescission of requirements
section.leadIn: The Authority may, by a written notice served on a designated insurance holding company—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: vary a requirement imposed under section 95ZO, 95ZP, 95ZQ or 95ZR on the company; and

paragraph.name: b
