paragraph.content: the letters “i”, “n”, “s”, “u”, “r”, “a”, “n”, “c” and “e” in that order;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the letters “a”, “s”, “s”, “u”, “r”, “a”, “n”, “c” and “e” in that order.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (1) does not apply to any of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an authorized insurer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an approved association of underwriters;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a licensed insurance intermediary;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a person to whom section 78(3) applies;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: an association that comprises mainly licensed insurance intermediaries or their employees, and that is formed for the protection or promotion of their mutual interests;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: an association of insurers or their employees that is formed for the protection or promotion of their mutual interests.

subsection.leadIn: A person who is not an authorized insurer must not, without the written consent of the Authority given generally or in a particular case or class of cases, make a representation in a bill head, letter paper, notice or advertisement, or in any other manner, that the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is an authorized insurer; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is carrying on insurance business in or from Hong Kong.

subsection.content: A person who contravenes subsection (1) or (3) commits an offence and is liable to a fine of $200,000 and, in the case of an individual, also to imprisonment for 2 years.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1)—
subsection.def: description (描述) includes a statement that may be construed to mean that a person (however described) is a subsidiary, the holding company, or a subsidiary of the holding company, of an authorized insurer, a licensed insurance agency or a licensed insurance broker company.

section.name: s121
section.heading: Person not to disclose information obtained in the course of inspection, investigation or disciplinary action

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: a person on whom a requirement under section 64ZZF, 64ZZG, 64ZZH or 64ZZI has been imposed by an inspector or investigator; (Amended 18 of 2020 s. 15)

paragraph.name: ba
paragraph.content: a person on whom a requirement under section 95ZZE, 95ZZF, 95ZZG or 95ZZH has been imposed by an inspector or investigator; or (Added 18 of 2020 s. 15)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a person who has been given a notice under section 41Q(2), 82(2) or 95ZZT(2). (Amended 18 of 2020 s. 15)

subsection.leadIn: The person specified in subsection (1)(a), (b) or (ba) must not disclose any information obtained in the course of the requirement being imposed, or in the course of a compliance or purported compliance with the requirement, to any other person unless— (Amended 18 of 2020 s. 15)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Authority consents to the disclosure; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any of the conditions specified in subsection (4) is satisfied.

subsection.leadIn: The person specified in subsection (1)(c) must not disclose any information obtained from the notice, or from any communication with the Authority in relation to the subject matter of the notice, unless—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Authority consents to the disclosure; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: any of the conditions specified in subsection (4) is satisfied.

subsection.leadIn: The conditions specified for subsections (2)(b) and (3)(b) are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the information has already been made available to the public because of being disclosed in any circumstances in which, or for any purpose for which, disclosure is not precluded by section 53A;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the disclosure is for seeking advice from, or giving advice by, a counsel or a solicitor, or any other professional advisor acting or proposing to act in a professional capacity, in connection with a matter arising under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the disclosure is in connection with any judicial or other proceedings to which the person is a party; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the disclosure is in compliance with an order of a court, or in compliance with a law or a requirement made under a law.

subsection.content: The Authority may impose any conditions that it considers appropriate on a consent given by it for the purposes of subsection (2)(a) or (3)(a).
A person who contravenes subsection (2) or (3) commits an offence and is liable to a fine at level 4.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—

def.name: Inspector
def.leadIn: inspector (查察員)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to subsection (1)(a), has the meaning given by section 41A;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to subsection (1)(b), has the meaning given by section 64F; and (Amended 18 of 2020 s. 15)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to subsection (1)(ba), has the meaning given by section 95A(1); (Added 18 of 2020 s. 15)

def.name: Investigator
def.leadIn: investigator (調查員)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to subsection (1)(a), has the meaning given by section 41A;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to subsection (1)(b), has the meaning given by section 64F; and (Amended 18 of 2020 s. 15)

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: in relation to subsection (1)(ba), has the meaning given by section 95A(1). (Added 18 of 2020 s. 15)

section.name: s122
section.heading: Notification of cessation of place of business in Hong Kong

subsection.content: If a non-HK insurer ceases to have a place of business in Hong Kong, the insurer must give not less than 3 months’ prior written notice, or a shorter prior notice that the Authority allows, to the Authority of the cessation. (Amended 20 of 2023 s. 92)

subsection.leadIn: An authorized insurer which fails to comply with subsection (1) commits an offence and is liable—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to a fine of $200,000 and, in the case of an individual, also to imprisonment for 2 years; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the case of a continuing offence, to a further fine of $2,000 for each day during which the failure to give the notice continues after the expiry of the period prescribed or the shorter period allowed (as the case may be) under that subsection.

section.name: s123
section.heading: Exceptions to sections 64G and 120

subsection.leadIn: Section 64G or 120 does not—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: prohibit a counsel from—

subparagraph.content: giving regulated advice wholly incidental to his or her practice as a counsel; or
holding himself or herself out as so giving regulated advice;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: prohibit a solicitor from—

subparagraph.content: giving regulated advice wholly incidental to his or her practice as a solicitor in a Hong Kong firm or foreign firm within the meaning of the Legal Practitioners Ordinance (Cap. 159); or
holding himself or herself out as so giving regulated advice;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: prohibit a certified public accountant from—

subparagraph.content: giving regulated advice wholly incidental to his or her practice as a certified public accountant in a practice unit as defined by section 2(1) of the Accounting and Financial Reporting Council Ordinance (Cap. 588); or (Amended L.N. 66 of 2022)
holding himself or herself out as so giving regulated advice;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: prohibit a trust company registered under Part VIII of the Trustee Ordinance (Cap. 29) from—

subparagraph.content: giving regulated advice wholly incidental to the discharge of its duty as such a trust company; or
holding itself out as so giving regulated advice;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: prohibit an actuary from—

subparagraph.content: giving regulated advice wholly incidental to his or her practice as an actuary; or
holding himself or herself out as so giving regulated advice;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.leadIn: prohibit a person from giving regulated advice through—

subparagraph.content: a television broadcast or radio broadcast for reception by the public, whether on subscription or otherwise; or
electronic communication to the public;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.leadIn: prohibit a person from—

subparagraph.leadIn: giving regulated advice in the course of—

subparagraph.name: A
subparagraph.content: carrying on the business of loss assessment on behalf of an authorized insurer, policy holder or insurance claimant; or

subparagraph.name: B
subparagraph.content: carrying on the business of settling claims on behalf of an authorized insurer; or
holding himself or herself out as so giving regulated advice; or

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.leadIn: prohibit a company from—

subparagraph.content: giving regulated advice to a specified company; or
holding itself out as so giving regulated advice.

subsection.content: Section 64G or 120 does not prohibit a person acting on behalf of an authorized insurer or a licensed insurance intermediary from carrying on a regulated activity if carrying on that activity only involves the discharge of clerical or administrative duties for the insurer or the intermediary.

subsection.leadIn: Section 64G or 120 does not prohibit an employee of any of the following authorized insurers from carrying on a regulated activity in the course of employment—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an authorized insurer which is authorized to carry on in or from Hong Kong reinsurance business only;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an authorized insurer which is a captive insurer.

subsection.leadIn: Without limiting subsection (3), section 64G or 120 does not prohibit an employee of an authorized insurer from carrying on a regulated activity if carrying on that activity only involves the discharge of any of the following duties for the insurer in the course of employment—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to make an assessment of the risks to be accepted by the insurer under a contract of insurance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to determine the terms and conditions of a contract of insurance to be issued by the insurer;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to process any claim lodged under a contract of insurance issued by the insurer.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (1)—
subsection.def: actuary (精算師) means a person who holds a qualification specified in the Schedule to the Insurance (Actuaries’ Qualifications) Regulation (Cap. 41 sub. leg. A) or specified in a guideline published under section 133; (Amended 17 of 2020 s. 30)

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of this section, a company is a wholly owned subsidiary of another company if it has only the following as members—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that other company;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a nominee of that other company;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a wholly owned subsidiary of that other company;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a nominee of such a wholly owned subsidiary.

subsection.content: The Financial Secretary may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend subsection (1).

section.name: s124
section.heading: Offences by bodies corporate and partners

subsection.leadIn: If an offence under this Ordinance is committed by a body corporate, and it is proved that the offence—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: was committed with the consent or connivance of a specified individual; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: was attributable to any neglect or omission on the part of a specified individual,

subsection.continued: the individual also commits the offence. (Amended 18 of 2020 s. 16)

subsection.leadIn: If a person who commits an offence under this Ordinance is a partner of a partnership, and it is proved that the offence—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: was committed with the consent or connivance of any other partner of the partnership; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: was attributable to any neglect or omission on the part of any other partner of the partnership,

subsection.continued: the other partner of the partnership also commits the offence.

subsection.content: An offence under this Ordinance committed by a body corporate is presumed to have been committed with the consent or connivance of, or to be attributable to neglect or omission on the part of, a specified individual if it is proved that, at the time the offence was committed, the individual was concerned in the management of the body corporate. (Amended 18 of 2020 s. 16)

An offence under this Ordinance committed by a partner of a partnership is presumed to have been committed with the consent or connivance of, or to be attributable to neglect or omission on the part of, any other partner in the partnership if it is proved that, at the time the offence was committed, the other partner was concerned in the management of the partnership.

subsection.leadIn: The presumption under subsection (4) or (5) is rebutted by a person charged with an offence under this Ordinance by virtue of that subsection if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is sufficient evidence to raise an issue that the offence was committed without the person’s consent or connivance and was not attributable to the person’s neglect or omission; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the contrary is not proved by the prosecution beyond reasonable doubt.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: specified individual (指明個人), in relation to a body corporate, means an individual who is—(a)a controller, director, key person in control functions or responsible officer of the body corporate;(b)a shareholder controller or chief executive of the body corporate (only if the body corporate is a designated insurance holding company); or(c)a member of the body corporate (only if the body corporate is managed by its members). (Added 18 of 2020 s. 16)

section.name: s125
section.heading: Time limit for proceedings for offences
section.leadIn: Criminal proceedings for an offence under this Ordinance must be commenced within whichever of the following period expires first—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the period of 3 years beginning on the date immediately after the date on which the offence is discovered by, or comes to the notice of, the Authority;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the period of 6 years beginning on the date immediately after the offence is committed.

section.name: s126
section.heading: Prosecution of offences by Authority

subsection.content: The Authority may prosecute an offence under this Ordinance, or an offence of conspiracy to commit such an offence, in its own name.
However, if the Authority so prosecutes, the offence must be tried before a magistrate as an offence that is triable summarily.
This section does not derogate from the powers of the Secretary for Justice in respect of the prosecution of criminal offences.

section.name: s127
section.heading: Service of notices, etc.
section.leadIn: A written notice or direction or other document (however described) permitted or required to be issued or served (however described) to or on a person, other than the Authority or the Monetary Authority, for this Ordinance is to be regarded as duly issued or served if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: for an individual, it is—

subparagraph.content: delivered to the individual by hand;
left at, or sent by post to, the last known business or residential address of the individual;
sent by fax transmission to the last known fax number of the individual; or
sent by electronic mail transmission to the last known electronic mail address of the individual;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: for a company, it is—

subparagraph.content: delivered to any officer of the company by hand;
left at, or sent by post to, the registered office of the company within the meaning of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622);
sent by fax transmission to the last known fax number of the company; or
sent by electronic mail transmission to the last known electronic mail address of the company;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.leadIn: for a non-Hong Kong company, it is—

subparagraph.content: delivered by hand to, or sent by post to, the person resident in Hong Kong who is authorized to accept service of process and notices on its behalf for the purposes of Part 16 of the Companies Ordinance (Cap. 622) at the person’s address delivered to the Registrar of Companies under that Ordinance;
sent by fax transmission to the last known fax number of the person; or
sent by electronic mail transmission to the last known electronic mail address of the person;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: for a partnership, it is—

subparagraph.content: delivered to any partner of the partnership by hand;
left at, or sent by post to, the last known principal place of business of the partnership;
sent by fax transmission to the last known fax number of the partnership; or
sent by electronic mail transmission to the last known electronic mail address of the partnership;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.leadIn: for Lloyd’s or a member of Lloyd’s, it is—

subparagraph.content: delivered to the authorized representative of Lloyd’s appointed under section 50B by hand;
left at, or sent by post to, the address in Hong Kong of the authorized representative;
sent by fax transmission to the last known fax number of the authorized representative; or
sent by electronic mail transmission to the last known electronic mail address of the authorized representative.

section.name: s128
section.heading: Chief Executive in Council may make regulations

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive in Council may, after consulting the Authority, by regulations—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: provide for the payment to the Authority of, and prescribe, fees—

subparagraph.content: for an application to the Authority under this Ordinance;
for anything done by the Authority or a committee established under section 4C or 4D in performing a function under this Ordinance; and
for any other matter with regard to which provision is made by or under this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: prescribe fees (however described) that are required or permitted to be prescribed by regulations made under this section;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: provide for the payment of charges or penalties for late payment of any fees; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: prescribe any matter that, by this Ordinance, is required or permitted to be prescribed by regulations made under this section.

subsection.content: Fees prescribed by regulations made under this section is not to be limited by reference to the amount of the administrative or other costs incurred, or likely to be incurred, by the Authority or a committee established under section 4C or 4D in providing the services or performing the functions to which the fees relate.

subsection.leadIn: Regulations made under this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may provide that the amount of any fee is to be fixed by reference to a scale set out in the regulations;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may provide for the payment of different fees by or in relation to persons or cases of different classes or descriptions;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: may provide that the payment of any fee is waived, either generally or in a particular case; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: may provide for the payment of fees annually or at other intervals.

subsection.content: The Authority may recover the amount of any fees payable under the regulations made under this section as a civil debt due to it.

subsection.leadIn: Subsections (6) and (7) apply if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: rules are made by the Authority under a provision in this Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the provision does not specify that the rules may provide that a contravention of any specified provision of the rules constitutes an offence.

subsection.content: The Chief Executive in Council may make regulations to prescribe offences for contravention of the rules, punishable by a fine, imprisonment or both.

subsection.leadIn: The maximum penalty that may be prescribed under subsection (6) is— (Amended 17 of 2020 s. 31)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for an offence of which a person is convicted on indictment—a fine of $500,000 and imprisonment for 2 years; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for an offence of which a person is summarily convicted—a fine at level 6 and imprisonment for 6 months.

section.name: s129
section.heading: Authority may make rules—general provisions

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may by rules—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: provide for the determination, in such different ways as may be necessary for different provisions, of the value of the assets and the amount of the liabilities of an authorized insurer or a designated insurance holding company for the purposes of this Ordinance; (Amended 18 of 2020 s. 17)

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.leadIn: provide for the holding in any fund or sub-fund maintained by an authorized insurer under this Ordinance; (Amended 20 of 2023 s. 93)

paragraph.name: ca
cb
paragraph.content: provide for the exemption of authorized insurers from the application of section 15AAA(1)(c) or (d); (Added 20 of 2023 s. 93)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: prescribe standards to be complied with by an actuary appointed under section 15AAA(1); (Amended 20 of 2023 s. 93)

paragraph.name: da
paragraph.content: provide for the exemption of authorized insurers or insurance business from the application of section 25A; (Added 20 of 2023 s. 93)

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: provide for applications for licence, the issue of licences and incidental matters;

paragraph.name: f
g
paragraph.content: prescribe the qualifications and experience of, and training for, licensed insurance intermediaries, and provide for the obligations to be imposed in relation to the requirements, the examinations required for those purposes, and the circumstances under which exemptions may be granted;

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: provide for the maintenance of registers and the correction of errors in the registers maintained by the Authority;

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: require documents and information required to be lodged, filed, submitted or retained for a provision of this Ordinance to be so lodged, filed, submitted or retained in the specified manner, whether by electronic or other means;

paragraph.name: k

paragraph.content: specify whether, when and the circumstances in which records compiled in a specified form or manner, or documents or information completed, signed, executed or authenticated in a specified form or manner, are acceptable or required for a provision of this Ordinance;

paragraph.name: m
paragraph.content: require authorized insurers, licensed insurance intermediaries and designated insurance holding companies to make returns at specified times to the Authority, and provide for the particulars, or the nature of particulars, to be contained in those returns, the person by whom, and the manner and circumstances in which they are to be made, and other matters related to those returns; (Amended 18 of 2020 s. 17)

paragraph.name: n
o
paragraph.content: prescribe any matter that, by this Ordinance, is required or permitted to be prescribed by rules made under this section.

subsection.content: In addition to the power to make rules under subsection (1), the Authority may, after consulting the Financial Secretary, make other rules that are necessary for the performance of any of its functions.

subsection.leadIn: Except as otherwise provided in this Ordinance, rules made by the Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may be of general or special application or may be made so as to apply only in specified circumstances;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may make different provisions for different circumstances and provide for different cases or classes of cases;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: may authorize a matter or thing to be determined, applied or regulated by a specified person;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: may provide for the exercise of a discretion in specified cases; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: may, for the better and more effectual carrying into effect of any provision of this Ordinance or the rules, include any savings, transitional, incidental, supplemental, evidential and consequential provisions (whether involving the provisions of a principal legislation or a subsidiary legislation).

section.name: s129A
section.heading: Authority may make rules for special purpose business

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may by rules—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: prohibit any sale of, or the making of any offer to sell, insurance-linked securities to any person other than an investor falling within a type prescribed in the rules; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: prohibit any sale of, or the making of any offer to sell, insurance-linked securities at an amount lower than that prescribed in the rules.

subsection.content: Rules made under this section may prescribe offences for contravention of the rules, punishable by a fine or imprisonment, or both.

subsection.leadIn: The maximum penalty that may be prescribed under subsection (2) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for an offence of which a person is convicted on indictment—a fine of $200,000 and imprisonment for 2 years; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for an offence of which a person is summarily convicted—a fine at level 6 and imprisonment for 6 months.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: insurance-linked securities (保險相連證券) means securities issued through insurance securitization.

section.name: s130
section.heading: Relaxation of certain rules

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may, relax wholly or partly any of the rules made under section 129(1)(a), (b), (c) or (ca), or any of the requirements prescribed by virtue of section 10(2), in their application to an authorized insurer for the period, and subject to the conditions, that the Authority considers appropriate, at the request in writing of that insurer, on being satisfied that— (Amended 20 of 2023 s. 94)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it would not be contrary to the interests of policy holders or potential policy holders to do so; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: it would not adversely affect the Authority’s ability to carry out its supervisory functions under this Ordinance.

subsection.content: During any period when the relaxation is in force, a reference in this Ordinance to rules made under this Ordinance is, as respects that insurer, to be construed as a reference to those rules as so relaxed.

subsection.leadIn: If under subsection (1) the Authority relaxes any of the rules or requirements for an authorized insurer, the Authority must, as soon as practicable, publish a notice in the Gazette stating— (Amended 20 of 2023 s. 94)

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the name of the insurer; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content:
the fact that they
have been relaxed under subsection (1) for that insurer.

section.name: s131
section.heading: Rules may limit effect of Ordinance

subsection.content: Except as otherwise provided in this Ordinance, rules made by the Authority may, subject to the terms and conditions specified in them, provide for the matters referred to in subsections (2) and (3).

subsection.leadIn: The rules may provide that the provisions of this Ordinance specified in the rules have no effect, or only have effect to a specified extent, in relation to a specified person or to members in a specified class of persons—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: who is or are, or may be, required to be licensed because of the person or the members doing anything that is incidental to another business; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: who is or are, or may be, required to be licensed because of the involvement of the person or the members in a specified class of insurance business.

subsection.content: If the provisions of this Ordinance specified in the rules require an application, statement, notice or other document (however described) to be lodged or filed with or submitted to the Authority, the rules may provide that those provisions are to be regarded as having been complied with if the application, statement, notice or other document is lodged or filed with or submitted to any other specified person.

section.name: s132
section.heading: Authority must publish draft rules

subsection.content: If the Authority proposes to make rules under a provision of this Ordinance, it must publish a draft of the proposed rules, in the manner it considers appropriate, for inviting representations on the proposed rules by the public.
If the Authority makes rules after a draft has been published under subsection (1) in relation to the rules, it must comply with subsections (3) and (4).

subsection.leadIn: The Authority must publish, in the manner that it considers appropriate, an account setting out in general terms—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the representations made on the draft; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the response of the Authority to the representations.

subsection.content: If the Authority considers the rules made are significantly different from the draft, the Authority must publish, in the manner it considers appropriate, details of the difference.

subsection.leadIn: Subsections (1) and (2) do not apply if the Authority considers, in the circumstances of the case, that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is inappropriate or unnecessary that those subsections should apply; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the delay involved in complying with those subsections would not be—

subparagraph.content: in the interests of policy holders or potential policy holders; or
in the public interest.

section.name: s133
section.heading: Codes or guidelines on functions of Authority, etc.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may publish, in the Gazette and in any other manner it considers appropriate, codes or guidelines that it considers appropriate for giving guidance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in relation to a matter relating to any of the functions of the Authority under this Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in relation to the operation of a provision of this Ordinance.

subsection.content: To avoid doubt, the power of the Authority to publish codes or guidelines under this section is in addition to and not in derogation of any other power of the Authority to publish codes or guidelines under any provision of this or any other Ordinance.
The Authority may from time to time amend the whole or any part of a code or guideline published.
A failure on the part of a person to comply with the provisions set out in a code or guideline does not by itself render the person liable to any judicial or other proceedings.

subsection.leadIn: However, in any proceedings under this Ordinance before a court—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the code or guideline is admissible in evidence; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a provision in the code or guideline appears to the court to be relevant to a question arising in the proceedings, the court must, in determining the question, take into account any compliance or non-compliance of the provision.

subsection.leadIn: A code or guideline published under this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may be of general or special application or may be made so as to apply only in specified circumstances; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may make different provisions for different circumstances and provide for different cases or classes of cases.

subsection.content: A code or guideline published under this section is not subsidiary legislation.

section.name: s134
section.heading: Orders and regulations for levies

subsection.leadIn: If a contract of insurance relates to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a prescribed class of insurance business; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a prescribed type of contract of insurance,

subsection.continued: a prescribed levy is payable to the Authority for the contract by its policy holder.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsection (1), the Chief Executive in Council, by order published in the Gazette—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may specify any rate or amount as a prescribed levy under subsection (1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may specify any class of insurance business as a prescribed class of insurance business under subsection (1)(a);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: may specify any type of contract of insurance as a prescribed type of contract of insurance under subsection (1)(b);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.leadIn: may specify the rate or amount of the prescribed levy payable for a contract of insurance—

subparagraph.content: as a percentage of the premium payable for the contract of insurance;
as a fixed amount;
as a nil rate, nil amount or nil percentage; or
as to be calculated in any other manner specified in the order; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: may specify different rates for different classes of insurance business or different types of contract of insurance.

subsection.content: The Authority may recover the amount of a levy payable under this section as a civil debt due to it.

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive in Council may make regulations for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the payment of levies;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the payment of charges or penalties for late payment of levies; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the keeping, examination and audit of the accounts of authorized insurers and licensed insurance intermediaries relating to the collection and payment of levies.

section.name: s135
section.heading: Reduction of levies

subsection.content: If during a financial year of the Authority the requirements set out in subsection (2) are met, the Authority must consult the Financial Secretary with a view to recommending to the Chief Executive in Council that the rate or amount of a levy be reduced.

subsection.leadIn: The requirements are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that the reserves of the Authority, after deducting depreciations and all provisions, are more than twice its estimated operating expenses for the financial year; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: that the Authority has no outstanding debt.

subsection.content: The Authority may, after consulting the Financial Secretary under subsection (1), recommend to the Chief Executive in Council that the rate or amount of a levy be reduced.

section.name: s136
section.heading: Procedural requirements for publishing notices under sections 13AE(14), 95A(4) and 123(7)

subsection.content: If the Financial Secretary proposes to publish a notice under section 13AE(14), 95A(4) or 123(7), the Financial Secretary must publish a draft of the proposed notice, in the manner the Financial Secretary considers appropriate, for inviting representations on the proposed notice by the public. (Amended 18 of 2020 s. 18)
If the Financial Secretary publishes a notice after a draft has been published under subsection (1), the Financial Secretary must comply with subsections (3) and (4).

subsection.leadIn: The Financial Secretary must publish, in the manner that it considers appropriate, an account setting out in general terms—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the representations made on the draft; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the response of the Financial Secretary to the representations.

subsection.content: If the Financial Secretary considers the notice published is significantly different from the draft, the Financial Secretary must publish, in the manner the Financial Secretary considers appropriate, details of the difference.

subsection.leadIn: Subsections (1) and (2) do not apply if the Financial Secretary considers, in the circumstances of the case, that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: it is inappropriate or unnecessary that those subsections should apply; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the delay involved in complying with those subsections would not be—

subparagraph.content: in the interests of policy holders or potential policy holders; or
in the public interest.

subsection.leadIn: The Financial Secretary may direct the Authority to publish on behalf of the Financial Secretary—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the draft of the proposed notice under subsection (1);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the account under subsection (3); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the details of the difference under subsection (4).

section.name: s137
section.heading: Authority may specify forms

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (2), the Authority may specify—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the form of any document required under this Ordinance to be in the specified form; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the form of such other documents required for the purposes of this Ordinance as the Authority thinks fit.

subsection.content: The Authority’s power under subsection (1) is subject to any express requirement under this Ordinance for a form, whether specified or otherwise, to comply with that requirement, but that requirement is not to restrict the exercise of that power in respect of that form to the extent that, in the opinion of the Authority, its exercise of that power in respect of that form does not contravene that requirement.

subsection.leadIn: To avoid doubt, it is declared that the Authority’s power under subsection (1) may be exercised in such a way as to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: include in the specified form of a document referred to in that subsection a statutory declaration—

subparagraph.content: to be made by the person completing the form; and
as to whether the particulars contained in the form are true and correct to the best of that person’s knowledge and belief;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: specify 2 or more forms of any document referred to in that subsection, whether as alternatives, or to provide for particular circumstances or particular cases, as the Authority thinks fit.

subsection.leadIn: A form specified under this section must be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: completed in accordance with the directions and instructions that are specified in the form;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: accompanied by the documents that are specified in the form; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the completed form is required to be provided to the Authority or any other person, so provided in the manner, if any, specified in the form.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: document (文件) includes any application, notice, return and accounts.

section.name: s138
section.heading: Amendment of Schedules

subsection.content: The Chief Executive in Council may, by notice published in the Gazette, amend Schedule 9.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may, with the approval of the Financial Secretary, by notice published in the Gazette, amend any of the following—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: Schedule 1;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: Schedule 7;

paragraph.name: ga
paragraph.content: Schedule 7A; (Added 18 of 2020 s. 19)

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: Schedule 8;

subsection.content: The Legislative Council may by resolution amend Schedule 1D.

section.name: s139
section.heading: Savings and transitional arrangements for Insurance Companies (Amendment) Ordinance 2015
section.content: Schedule 11 provides for the savings, transitional and supplemental arrangements that relate to the Insurance Companies (Amendment) Ordinance 2015 (12 of 2015).

section.name: s140
section.heading: Savings and transitional arrangements for Insurance (Amendment) Ordinance 2023
section.content: Schedule 12 provides for the savings and transitional arrangements that relate to the Insurance (Amendment) Ordinance 2023 (20 of 2023).

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: The following constitute the classes of insurance business that are relevant for the purposes of this Ordinance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: classes of long term business that are specified in Part 2 of this Schedule;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: classes of general business that are specified in Part 3 of this Schedule;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the class of special purpose business. (Replaced 17 of 2020 s. 21)

section.name: s2
section.content: An authorization under section 8, in describing the classes or parts of classes to which it relates, may do so by reference to the appropriate groups specified in Part 4 of this Schedule.

section.name: s3
section.content: If an insurer authorized to carry on long term business effects and carries out a contract of insurance which combines long term business and additional business of the nature specified in Part 3 of this Schedule in relation to class 1 or 2, the additional business shall as respects that contract be regarded as long term business and not as general business.

section.name: s3A
section.content: There shall not be combined in the one contract long term business of the nature specified in class G or H in Part 2 of this Schedule and business of any other nature specified in this Schedule unless that contract is a contract (or belongs to a class or description of contract) specified by the Authority by notice in the Gazette under paragraph 3B as being a contract to which this paragraph shall not apply. (Added 59 of 1993 s. 17. Amended 12 of 2015 s. 2)

subsection.name: a
subsection.content: Paragraph 3A shall not apply to any annuity contract on a human life under which a single premium is paid in return for an annuity which becomes payable periodically immediately upon the date of the execution of the contract.

subsection.name: b
subsection.content: Subparagraph (a) shall be deemed to have come into operation on the commencement of the Insurance Companies (Amendment) Ordinance 1993 (59 of 1993). (Added 75 of 1995 s. 11)

section.name: s3B
section.content: The Authority may specify, by notice in the Gazette, any contract (including any class or description of contract) to which paragraph 3A shall not apply. (Added 59 of 1993 s. 17. Amended 12 of 2015 s. 2)

section.name: s3C
section.content: Subject to paragraph 3D, where a contract effected and carried out on or after the date of commencement of the Insurance Companies (Amendment) Ordinance 1993 (59 of 1993) can be both a contract of the nature specified in class I in Part 2 of this Schedule and a contract of the nature specified in another class (or classes) of long term business, the contract shall, for the purposes of this Ordinance, be treated as being only a contract of the nature specified in class I, and the provisions of this Ordinance shall have effect accordingly. (Added 59 of 1993 s. 17)

section.name: s3D
section.content: Immediately upon the expiration of section 19 of the Insurance Companies (Amendment) Ordinance 1993 (59 of 1993), paragraph 3C shall operate in relation to a contract effected and carried out before the date referred to in that paragraph as it operates in relation to a contract effected and carried out on or after that date. (Added 59 of 1993 s. 17)

def.name: RetirementScheme
def.leadIn: In Parts 1 and 2 of this Schedule, retirement scheme (退休計劃) means any scheme, whether in writing or oral, express or implied, under which benefits, in the form of pensions, allowances, gratuities or other payments, are payable to or in respect of a member of the scheme on the cessation of his—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: service under a contract for services; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: membership of an association or partnership,

def.proviso: but does not include any scheme (including any class or description of scheme) specified by the Authority by notice in the Gazette under paragraph 3F or 3FB as not being a retirement scheme for the purposes of this Ordinance. (Added 59 of 1993 s. 17. Amended L.N. 398 of 1994; 12 of 2015 s. 2)

section.name: s3F
section.content: Subject to paragraph 3FB, the Authority may, except in relation to a scheme which is an occupational retirement scheme within the meaning of the Occupational Retirement Schemes Ordinance (Cap. 426), specify, by notice in the Gazette, any scheme (including any class or description of scheme) as not being a retirement scheme for the purposes of this Ordinance. (Added 59 of 1993 s. 17. Amended L.N. 398 of 1994; 12 of 2015 s. 2)

def.name: Party
def.leadIn: In long term business of the nature specified in class G or H in Part 2 of this Schedule, party (一方), in relation to a contract referred to in that class of long term business—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: means—

subparagraph.name: i
ii
subparagraph.content: Lloyd’s; or

subparagraph.name: iii
subparagraph.content: an association of underwriters approved under section 6; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: includes, on and after the day on which section 3 of the Occupational Retirement Schemes Ordinance (Cap. 426) comes into operation, any other person except a person who—

subparagraph.name: i
subparagraph.content: holds on trust the contributions (or premiums) which become his property under that contract; and

subparagraph.name: ii
subparagraph.content: is not a person referred to in subparagraph (a). (Added L.N. 398 of 1994)

section.name: s3FB
section.leadIn: Where—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: an occupational retirement scheme within the meaning of the Occupational Retirement Schemes Ordinance (Cap. 426) is neither—

paragraph.name: i
paragraph.content: governed by a trust; nor

paragraph.name: ii
paragraph.content: the subject of or regulated by an insurance arrangement within the meaning of that Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the administrator, within the meaning of that Ordinance, of such scheme is not a person referred to in paragraph 3FA(a),

section.continued: then the Authority may specify, by notice in the Gazette, such scheme (including any class or description of such scheme) as not being a retirement scheme for the purposes of this Ordinance. (Added L.N. 398 of 1994. Amended 12 of 2015 s. 2)

section.name: s3G
section.content: It is hereby declared that a notice under paragraph 3B, 3F or 3FB is subsidiary legislation. (Added 59 of 1993 s. 17. Amended L.N. 398 of 1994)

section.name: s4
section.content: Subject to paragraph 5, an insurer authorized to carry on a class of general business may, in effecting and carrying out a contract of insurance against a risk (the principal risk) within that class, include in the contract provision whereby the insurer incidentally assumes liability against a risk (the ancillary risk) that is not within that class.

section.name: s5
section.leadIn: Paragraph 4 shall apply only if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the assumption of liability against the ancillary risk is included in the same contract as that providing for the assumption of liability against the principal risk; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the ancillary risk is related to the principal risk and to the object, state, condition or person that is insured against the principal risk; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the ancillary risk is not of the kind to which class 14 or 15 relates and is otherwise such that insurance against it constitutes general business.

section.name: s6
section.def: In classes 6 and 12 vessels (船隻) includes hovercraft.

section.name: s7
section.content: The Insurance Companies Ordinance (Amendment of First Schedule) Regulation 1994 (L.N. 398 of 1994) shall be deemed to have come into operation on the commencement of the Insurance Companies (Amendment) Ordinance 1993 (59 of 1993). (Added 75 of 1995 s. 11)

schedule.name: sch1A
schedule.heading: Regulated Activity, Material Decision and Regulated Advice

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: Any of the following is an act specified for the purposes of section 3A(a)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the act of negotiating or arranging a contract of insurance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the act of inviting or inducing, or attempting to invite or induce, a person to enter into a contract of insurance;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the act of inviting or inducing, or attempting to invite or induce, a person to make a material decision;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the act of giving regulated advice.

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: Any of the following is a matter specified for the purposes of section 3A(b)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the making of an application or proposal for a contract of insurance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the issuance, continuance or renewal of a contract of insurance;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the cancellation, termination, surrender or assignment of a contract of insurance;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the exercise of a right under a contract of insurance;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the change in any term or condition of a contract of insurance;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: the making or settlement of an insurance claim.

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: Any of the following is a matter specified for the purposes of section 3A(c)—

paragraph.name: a

paragraph.name: b

paragraph.name: c

paragraph.name: d

schedule.name: sch1B
schedule.heading: Constitution and Proceedings of Authority, etc.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Deputy chairperson and vacancies in office of chairperson or deputy chairperson

subsection.content: The Chief Executive may appoint an executive director or non-executive director of the Authority (other than the chairperson or the Chief Executive Officer of the Authority) to be the deputy chairperson of the Authority.

If the office of chairperson of the Authority is vacant or the chairperson of the Authority is unable to act as chairperson due to illness, absence from Hong Kong or any other reason, the deputy chairperson appointed under subsection (1) must act as chairperson in his or her place.

subsection.leadIn: Whether or not a deputy chairperson has been appointed under subsection (1), the chairperson of the Authority may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: designate an executive director or non-executive director of the Authority to act as chairperson of the Authority for any period during which both the chairperson and the deputy chairperson are unable to act as chairperson due to illness, absence from Hong Kong or any other reason; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: at any time revoke the designation.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (5) applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: no deputy chairperson has been appointed under subsection (1) or the office of deputy chairperson of the Authority is vacant; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the deputy chairperson appointed under subsection (1) is unable to act as chairperson due to illness, absence from Hong Kong or any other reason, and there is no designation under subsection (3).

subsection.content: The Financial Secretary may designate an executive director or non-executive director of the Authority to act as chairperson of the Authority for any period during which the chairperson of the Authority is unable to act as chairperson due to illness, absence from Hong Kong or any other reason.

subsection.leadIn: A designation under subsection (5) ceases to have effect when the earliest of the following events occurs—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the designation is revoked by the Financial Secretary;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the designation is made in the circumstances mentioned in subsection (4)(a)—an appointment is made under subsection (1);

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the designation is made in the circumstances mentioned in subsection (4)(b)—the deputy chairperson appointed under subsection (1) is able to act as chairperson.

subsection.content: A deputy chairperson, executive director or non-executive director of the Authority acting as the chairperson of the Authority under this section, is to be regarded for all purposes to be the chairperson of the Authority.

subsection.leadIn: Despite subsection (7)—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: a non-executive director of the Authority does not cease to be regarded as such only because that director is acting as chairperson of the Authority.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Vacancy in office of chief executive officer

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: may designate an executive director of the Authority to act as chief executive officer of the Authority for a period during which the chief executive officer of the Authority is unable to act as chief executive officer due to illness, absence from Hong Kong or any other reason; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may at any time revoke the designation.

subsection.content: An executive director of the Authority who acts as chief executive officer of the Authority is to be regarded for all purposes to be the chief executive officer of the Authority.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Functions and office of members, etc.

subsection.content: The chairperson, deputy chairperson and chief executive officer of the Authority have the functions assigned to them by the Authority.
The Chief Executive is to determine the terms and conditions of the office of a member of the Authority.
A member of the Authority may at any time resign from office by notice in writing to the Chief Executive.

subsection.leadIn: Unless it is otherwise provided in the terms and conditions of the appointment under subsection (2), a notice of resignation takes effect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the date specified in the notice; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if no date is so specified, on the date of receipt by the Chief Executive of the notice.

subsection.content: The Authority must pay a member of the Authority the remuneration, allowances or expenses determined by the Chief Executive.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Removal of members of Authority

subsection.leadIn: If the Chief Executive is satisfied that a member of the Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has become a public officer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has become bankrupt;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: is incapacitated by physical or mental illness;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: is convicted in Hong Kong of an offence that is punishable by imprisonment for 12 months or more, or is convicted elsewhere than in Hong Kong of an offence that, if committed in Hong Kong, would be an offence so punishable; or

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: is otherwise unable or unfit to perform the functions of a member of the Authority,

subsection.continued: the Chief Executive may declare the member’s office to be vacant.

subsection.content: The Chief Executive must give notice of the declaration in the manner that the Chief Executive thinks fit.
Subsection (4) applies if the notice of the declaration is given otherwise than by notice published in the Gazette.
The Chief Executive must, as soon as practicable after giving notice under subsection (2), give another notice of the declaration by notice published in the Gazette.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Disclosure of interests by members of Authority

subsection.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a member of the Authority has, in a matter that is considered or is to be considered at a meeting of the Authority, an interest which is of a class or description determined by the Authority under subsection (2); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the interest appears to raise a conflict with the proper performance of the member’s duties in relation to the consideration of the matter,

subsection.continued: the member must, as soon as practicable after becoming aware of the relevant facts, disclose the interest at a meeting of the Authority.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: determine the class or description of the interest required to be disclosed;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: determine the details of the interest required to be disclosed and the manner in which the interest is to be disclosed; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: from time to time change any matter determined under paragraph (a) or (b).

subsection.content: Particulars of a disclosure made under this section must be recorded by the Authority in a book kept for the purpose and that book must be open at all reasonable hours to inspection by the public.

subsection.leadIn: After a member of the Authority has disclosed an interest in a matter, the member must not, unless the Authority otherwise determines—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: be present during a deliberation of the Authority with respect to the matter; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: take part in a decision of the Authority with respect to the matter.

subsection.leadIn: For making a determination by the Authority under subsection (4), a member of the Authority who has an interest in a matter to which the disclosure relates—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must not be present during the Authority’s deliberation for making the determination; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must not take part in the Authority’s making of the determination.

subsection.content: A contravention of this section does not invalidate a decision of the Authority.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Meetings

subsection.leadIn: Meetings of the Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be held as often as necessary for performing its functions; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: may be convened by the chairperson, deputy chairperson, chief executive officer, or any 2 other members, of the Authority.

subsection.leadIn: At a meeting of the Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the chairperson of the Authority is present—he or she is to be the chairperson of the meeting;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the chairperson of the Authority is not present but the deputy chairperson of the Authority is present—the deputy chairperson is to be the chairperson of the meeting; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if neither the chairperson nor the deputy chairperson of the Authority is present—the members of the Authority present must choose one of their number to be the chairperson of the meeting.

subsection.content: The quorum for a meeting of the Authority is the number that is not less than one-third of the number of the executive directors of the Authority and not less than one-third of the number of the non-executive directors of the Authority.

subsection.leadIn: Despite section 1(6) and (7) of this Schedule, for forming a quorum under subsection (3)—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: a non-executive director of the Authority who acts as chairperson of the Authority is only counted as a non-executive director of the Authority.

subsection.leadIn: A member of the Authority who participates in a meeting of the Authority by telephone, video conferencing or other electronic means is to be regarded as being present at the meeting if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: that member is able to hear the other members who are physically present at the meeting; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the members who are physically present at the meeting are able to hear that member.

subsection.content: Each member of the Authority present at a meeting of the Authority has 1 vote.
Every question for decision at a meeting of the Authority must be determined by a majority of the votes of its members present.
If voting is equally divided, the chairperson of the meeting has, subject to subsection (9), a casting vote.

The chairperson of a meeting of the Authority must not exercise a casting vote on a question for decision at the meeting until after the chairperson has consulted the Financial Secretary on the question.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Written resolution

subsection.content: A resolution that meets the requirements set out in subsection (2) is as valid and effectual as if it had been passed at a meeting of the Authority convened and conducted in accordance with this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: The requirements are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the resolution is in writing;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the resolution is signed by all the members of the Authority who are, when the resolution is made available for signature, present in Hong Kong and capable of signing the resolution; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the resolution is signed by not less than one-third of the executive directors of the Authority and not less than one-third of the non-executive directors of the Authority.

subsection.leadIn: For subsection (2), a resolution may be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: in the form of one document; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the form of more than one document, each of which is in the same form.

subsection.content: If the resolution is in the form of more than one document, the requirements under subsection (2)(b) and (c) are to be regarded as having been satisfied if the documents together bear the signatures of the numbers of members of the Authority as specified in that subsection.

subsection.leadIn: For this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a document is regarded as having been signed by a member of the Authority if a telex, cable, fax or electronic transmission of the document bears the signature of the member; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a resolution is regarded as made on the date on which the resolution is signed by the last person signing as a member of the Authority.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Seal and regulation of administration, etc.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority must have a seal, the affixing of which must be authenticated by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the signature of the chairperson or the deputy chairperson of the Authority; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the signature of another member of the Authority authorized by it to act in that behalf.

subsection.content: A document purporting to be a document duly executed under the seal of the Authority is to be received in evidence without further proof and is, unless the contrary is proved, to be regarded as a document so executed on being received in evidence.

The Authority must organize and regulate its administration, procedure and business in a manner that it considers will, subject to the requirements of this Ordinance, best ensure the performance of its functions.

schedule.name: sch1C
schedule.heading: Constitution and Proceedings of Industry Advisory Committees

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: An industry advisory committee consists of the following members—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the chairperson of the Authority;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the chief executive officer of the Authority;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: not more than 2 other executive directors of the Authority who must be appointed by the Authority; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: not less than 8 but not more than 12 other members who must be appointed by the Financial Secretary after consultation with the Authority.

section.name: s2
section.content: In appointing a person as a member under section 1(d) of this Schedule, the Financial Secretary must have been satisfied that in the opinion of the Authority, the person has knowledge of, or experience in, the insurance industry, and the conduct of regulated activities and consumer affairs.

section.name: s3
section.content: An industry advisory committee must meet at least once every 3 months to advise the Authority.

section.name: s4
section.leadIn: A meeting of an industry advisory committee may be convened by—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the chairperson of the Authority;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the chief executive officer of the Authority; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: any 3 other members of the industry advisory committee.

section.name: s5
section.leadIn: At a meeting of an industry advisory committee—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the chairperson of the Authority is present—he or she is to be the chairperson of the meeting; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the chairperson of the Authority is not present—the members of the industry advisory committee present must choose one of their number to be the chairperson of the meeting.

section.name: s6
section.content: The quorum for a meeting of an industry advisory committee is a majority of its members.

section.name: s7
section.content: If a member of an industry advisory committee appointed under section 1(c) of this Schedule ceases to be an executive director of the Authority, he or she ceases to be a member of the industry advisory committee.

section.name: s8
section.leadIn: A member of an industry advisory committee appointed under section 1(c) or (d) of this Schedule may at any time resign from office by notice in writing to the following persons—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the member has been appointed under section 1(c)—the Authority;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the member has been appointed under section 1(d)—the Financial Secretary.

section.name: s9
section.content: The Financial Secretary may by notice in writing remove from office a member of an industry advisory committee appointed under section 1(d) of this Schedule.

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: The following functions of the Authority are specified for the purposes of section 4F(2)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to make subsidiary legislation under this Ordinance or any other Ordinance;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to borrow money under section 4B(2)(c);

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: to establish a wholly-owned subsidiary under section 4B(2)(g);

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: to establish a committee under section 4D(1);

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: to refer a matter to a committee under section 4D(2);

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: to appoint a person to be a member or chairperson of a committee under section 4D(3);

paragraph.name: h
paragraph.content: to withdraw a reference from a committee, or to revoke an appointment of a member or chairperson of a committee under section 4D(5);
to delegate the powers under sections 64ZZF(6) and 64ZZH(1) to the Monetary Authority under section 4G(1), or to revoke the delegation under section 4G(3);

paragraph.name: j
paragraph.content: to submit to the Financial Secretary corporate plans under section 5B(3);

paragraph.name: k
paragraph.content: to prepare financial statements and reports under section 5D(2) and (3);

paragraph.name: l
paragraph.content: to appoint auditors under section 5E(1);

paragraph.name: m
paragraph.content: to authorize a company to carry on a class or classes of insurance business under section 8 or 8A; (Amended 17 of 2020 s. 22)

paragraph.name: n
paragraph.content: to appoint a person, other than an employee of the Authority, to investigate any matter referred to in sections 41D(1), 64ZZH(1) and 95ZZG(2); (Amended 18 of 2020 s. 20)

paragraph.name: o
paragraph.content: to publish codes or guidelines under section 41R, 83, 95, 95ZZU or 133; (Amended 18 of 2020 s. 20)

paragraph.name: oa
paragraph.content: to designate an insurance holding company as a designated insurance holding company under section 95C(1); (Added 18 of 2020 s. 20)

paragraph.name: p
paragraph.content: to specify the time at which a specified decision as defined by section 96 is to take effect;

paragraph.name: q
paragraph.content: to consult the Financial Secretary with a view to recommending to the Chief Executive in Council that a levy be reduced, and to recommend to the Chief Executive in Council that the levy be reduced, under section 135; (Amended 23 of 2016 ss. 208A & 241)

paragraph.name: r
paragraph.content: to defer, under section 78(2) of the Financial Institutions (Resolution) Ordinance (Cap. 628), the application of any provision of this Ordinance to an application made under this Ordinance by a bridge institution; (Added 23 of 2016 ss. 208A & 241. Amended E.R. 2 of 2017)

paragraph.name: s
paragraph.content: to make an application under section 145(1) of the Financial Institutions (Resolution) Ordinance (Cap. 628); (Added 23 of 2016 ss. 208A & 241. Amended E.R. 2 of 2017)

paragraph.name: t
paragraph.content: to issue a code of practice under section 196 of the Financial Institutions (Resolution) Ordinance (Cap. 628). (Added 23 of 2016 ss. 208A & 241. Amended E.R. 2 of 2017)

schedule.name: sch7
schedule.heading: Powers of Manager of Authorized Insurer

section.name: s1
section.content: Power to take possession of, collect and get in the property of the authorized insurer and, for that purpose, to take such proceedings as may seem to him expedient.

section.name: s2
section.content: Power to sell or otherwise dispose of the property of the authorized insurer by public auction or private contract.

section.name: s3
section.content: Power to raise or borrow money and grant security therefor over the property of the authorized insurer.

section.name: s4
section.content: Power to appoint a solicitor or accountant or other professionally qualified person to assist him in the performance of his functions.

section.name: s5
section.content: Power to bring or defend any action or other legal proceedings in the name and on behalf of the authorized insurer.

section.name: s6
section.content: Power to refer to arbitration any question affecting the authorized insurer.

section.name: s7
section.content: Power to effect and maintain insurances in respect of the business and property of the authorized insurer.

section.name: s8
section.content: Power to use the authorized insurer’s seal.

section.name: s9
section.content: Power to do all acts and to execute in the name and on behalf of the authorized insurer any deed, receipt or other document.

section.name: s10
section.content: Power to draw, accept, make and endorse any bill of exchange or promissory note in the name and on behalf of the authorized insurer.

section.name: s11
section.content: Power to appoint any agent to do any business which he is unable to do himself or which can more conveniently be done by an agent and power to employ and dismiss employees.

section.name: s12
section.content: Power to do all such things (including the carrying out of works) as may be necessary for the realisation of the property of the authorized insurer.

section.name: s13
section.content: Power to make any payment which is necessary or incidental to the performance of his functions.

section.name: s14
section.content: Power to carry on the business of the authorized insurer.

section.name: s15
section.content: Power to grant or accept a surrender of a lease or tenancy of any of the property of the authorized insurer, and to take a lease or tenancy of any property required or convenient for the business of the authorized insurer.

section.name: s16
section.content: Power to make any arrangement or compromise on behalf of the authorized insurer.

section.name: s17
section.content: Power to call up any uncalled capital of the authorized insurer.

section.name: s18
section.content: Power to rank and claim in the bankruptcy, insolvency, sequestration or liquidation of any person indebted to the authorized insurer and to receive dividends, and to accede to trust deeds for the creditors of any such person.

section.name: s19
section.content: Power to present or defend a petition for the winding up of the authorized insurer.

section.name: s20
section.content: Power to make or oppose an application referred to in section 45(1).

section.name: s21
section.content: Power to change the situation of the authorized insurer’s registered office.

section.name: s22
section.content: Power to do all other things incidental to the exercise of the powers specified in this Schedule.

schedule.name: sch7A
schedule.heading: Powers of Supervisory Manager of Designated Insurance Holding Company

paragraph.content: Power to exercise control or influence in relation to any member of the supervised group of the designated insurance holding company.

paragraph.leadIn: Power to enforce any arrangements that—

subparagraph.name: a
subparagraph.content: the designated insurance holding company maintains with its holding company; and

subparagraph.name: b
subparagraph.content: enables the designated insurance holding company to, through procuring the taking of any necessary steps by the holding company, comply with Part XIA, a notice or requirement given or imposed under Part XIA or a condition imposed under Part XIA.

paragraph.content: Power to take possession of, collect and get in the property of the designated insurance holding company and, for that purpose, to take such proceedings as may seem to the supervisory manager expedient.
Power to sell or otherwise dispose of the property of the designated insurance holding company by public auction or private contract.
Power to raise or borrow money and grant security for it over the property of the designated insurance holding company.
Power to appoint a solicitor or accountant or other professionally qualified person to assist the supervisory manager in performing the manager’s functions.
Power to bring or defend any action or other legal proceedings in the name and on behalf of the designated insurance holding company.
Power to refer to arbitration any question affecting the designated insurance holding company.
Power to effect and maintain insurances in respect of the business and property of the designated insurance holding company.
Power to use the designated insurance holding company’s seal.
Power to do all acts and to execute in the name and on behalf of the designated insurance holding company any deed, receipt or other document.
Power to draw, accept, make and endorse any bill of exchange or promissory note in the name and on behalf of the designated insurance holding company.
Power to appoint any agent to do any business that the supervisory manager is unable to do or that can more conveniently be done by an agent and power to employ and dismiss employees.
Power to do all things (including the carrying out of works) that are necessary for realizing the property of the designated insurance holding company.
Power to make any payment that is necessary or incidental to performing the supervisory manager’s functions.
Power to carry on the business of the designated insurance holding company.

Power to grant or accept a surrender of a lease or tenancy of any of the property of the designated insurance holding company, and to take a lease or tenancy of any property required or convenient for the business of the designated insurance holding company.
Power to make any arrangement or compromise on behalf of the designated insurance holding company.
Power to call up any uncalled capital of the designated insurance holding company.

Power to rank and claim in the bankruptcy, insolvency, sequestration or liquidation of any person indebted to the designated insurance holding company and to receive dividends, and to accede to trust deeds for the creditors of any such person.
Power to present or defend a petition for the winding up of the designated insurance holding company.
Power to make or oppose an application referred to in section 95ZZC.
Power to change the situation of the designated insurance holding company’s registered office.
Power to do all other things incidental to the exercise of the powers specified in this Schedule.

schedule.name: sch8
schedule.heading: Assets which Qualify as Assets in Hong Kong

section.name: s1
section.leadIn: The following qualify as assets in Hong Kong—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: real property, including a leasehold interest therein, located in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: computer equipment, office machinery, furniture, motor vehicles and other equipment located in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: money, in any currency or monetary unit, deposited and kept in Hong Kong at an authorized institution; (Amended 51 of 1999 s. 8; 12 of 2015 s. 97)

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: bonds or other securities issued in Hong Kong provided that they are transferable and registrable at a register in Hong Kong and, in the case of bonds or other securities which are evidenced by certificates, the certificates for them are for the time being kept in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: e
f

def.name: Company
def.leadIn: shares in respect of a company, wherever incorporated and whether or not it comes within the definition of company (公司) in section 2(1) of this Ordinance, which shares are—

subparagraph.content: transferable and registrable only at a register in Hong Kong; or
in the ordinary course of business, transferred and registered at a register in Hong Kong and the certificates for which (if any) are for the time being kept in Hong Kong;

paragraph.name: h

paragraph.content: an interest in a unit trust which is realizable in Hong Kong and in respect of which the governing law of the trust is expressly stated to be that of Hong Kong to the exclusion of all others. (Amended 5 of 2002 s. 407)

section.name: s2
section.def: For the purpose of paragraph 1(i), unit trust (單位信託) means any arrangement made for the purpose, or having the effect, of providing facilities for the participation by persons, as beneficiaries under a trust, in profits or income arising from the acquisition, holding, management or disposal of securities or any other property whatsoever. (Added 5 of 2002 s. 407)
