schedule.name: sch10
schedule.heading: Appointment of Members and Proceedings of Tribunal, etc.

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation

subsection.leadIn: In this Schedule—
subsection.def: application for review (覆核申請) means an application made under section 100;
chairperson (主席) means the chairperson of the Tribunal;
ordinary member (普通成員) means a member of the Tribunal other than the chairperson;
panel member (上訴委員) means a member of the panel appointed under section 2 of this Schedule;
Secretary (局長) means the Secretary for Financial Services and the Treasury.

subsection.leadIn: In this Schedule—
subsection.def: parties (各方), review (覆核), and specified decision (指明決定) have the same meaning as in Part XII.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Appointment of panel

subsection.content: Subject to section 98, the Chief Executive must appoint persons to a panel comprising the number of members that the Chief Executive considers appropriate.

subsection.leadIn: A panel member—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must not be a public officer (except a public officer by virtue only of being the chairperson of a board or tribunal established under an Ordinance); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must not be a member of the Authority.

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (4) and (5), a panel member is appointed for a period that the Chief Executive considers appropriate, and may, subject to the other provisions of this Ordinance, from time to time be reappointed.
A panel member may at any time resign from office by notice in writing to the Chief Executive.
The Chief Executive may by notice in writing remove a panel member from office on the grounds of incapacity, bankruptcy, neglect of duty, conflict of interest or misconduct.
To avoid doubt, section 97(3) does not require the appointment of persons to more than one panel under this section.

section.name: s3
section.heading: Appointment of chairperson

subsection.content: The chairperson must be appointed by the Chief Executive.

subsection.leadIn: The chairperson—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must be a former Justice of Appeal of the Court of Appeal;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must be a former judge or a former deputy judge of the Court of First Instance; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: must be eligible for appointment as a judge of the High Court under section 9 of the High Court Ordinance (Cap. 4).

subsection.leadIn: The chairperson—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: must not be a public officer (except a public officer by virtue only of being the chairperson of a board or tribunal established under an Ordinance); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: must not be a member of the Authority.

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (5) and (7), the chairperson is appointed for a term of 3 years or appointed to act in relation to any specified review, and may, subject to the other provisions of this Ordinance, from time to time be reappointed.
The chairperson may at any time resign from office by notice in writing to the Chief Executive.

subsection.leadIn: A notice of resignation takes effect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the date the Chief Executive receives the notice; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a later date is specified in the notice, on that later date.

subsection.leadIn: The Chief Executive may by notice in writing remove the chairperson from office—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the chairperson is no longer qualified for appointment as chairperson under subsection (2); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on the grounds of incapacity, bankruptcy, neglect of duty, conflict of interest or misconduct.

subsection.content: If a review has been commenced by the Tribunal but not completed before the expiry of the chairperson’s term of office, the Chief Executive may authorize the chairperson to continue to act as the chairperson for the purpose of completing the review.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Appointment of ordinary members

subsection.content: For determining a review, the Secretary on the recommendation of the chairperson must appoint 2 panel members as ordinary members in relation to the review.

Subject to subsections (3) and (5), an ordinary member is appointed to act in relation to any specified review, and may, subject to the other provisions of this Ordinance, from time to time be reappointed.
An ordinary member may at any time resign from office by notice in writing to the Secretary.

subsection.leadIn: A notice of resignation takes effect—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on the date the Secretary receives the notice; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if a later date is specified in the notice, on that later date.

subsection.content: If an ordinary member ceases to be a panel member, he or she ceases to be an ordinary member.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Further provisions relating to chairperson and ordinary members

subsection.leadIn: If, during the sittings of a review, there is a change in any of the persons specified in subsection (2), then—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the parties to the review so consent, the sittings may continue despite the change; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: in the absence of the consent of the parties to the review, the sittings must not continue but may begin anew.

subsection.leadIn: The following persons are specified—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the chairperson or a person acting as the chairperson in relation to the review;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a panel member acting as an ordinary member in relation to the review.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Sittings

subsection.content: The chairperson must convene the sittings of the Tribunal that are necessary to determine a review.

subsection.leadIn: Before convening a sitting in respect of a review, the Tribunal may give directions to the parties to the review concerning—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: procedural matters to be complied with by the parties; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the time within which the parties are required to comply with those matters.

subsection.leadIn: Subject to subsection (4), at any sitting of the Tribunal—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the chairperson and 2 ordinary members must be present;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the chairperson must preside; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: every question before the Tribunal must be determined by the majority of votes cast by the chairperson and the ordinary members, except that a question of law is to be determined by the chairperson alone.

subsection.leadIn: At any sitting of the Tribunal held in respect of any matter which is determined by the chairperson alone as the sole member of the Tribunal under section 9(1) of this Schedule—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the chairperson only must be present; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: every question before the Tribunal must be determined by the chairperson.

subsection.content: Every sitting of the Tribunal must be held in public.

However, subsection (5) does not apply if the Tribunal, on its own initiative or on the application of any of the parties to the review, determines that in the interests of justice a sitting, or a part of the sitting, must be held in private.
If an application is made under subsection (6) for a determination that a sitting or any part of the sitting must be held in private, a hearing of the application must be held in private.

subsection.leadIn: The parties to a review must, at any sitting of the Tribunal relating to the review, be entitled to be heard—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: in person, or—

subparagraph.content: for the Authority or a company—through an officer or employee of the Authority or the company (as the case may be);
for a partnership—through a partner; or
for a sole proprietorship—through the sole proprietor; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: through a counsel or solicitor or, with the leave of the Tribunal, through any other person.

subsection.content: The chairperson must prepare or cause to be prepared a record of the proceedings at any sitting of the Tribunal, which must contain the particulars relating to the proceedings that the chairperson considers appropriate.
The order of proceedings at any sitting of the Tribunal must be determined by the Tribunal in the manner most appropriate to the circumstances of the case.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Preliminary conferences

subsection.content: If the conditions set out in subsection (2) are satisfied, the chairperson may, on his or her own initiative or on the application of any of the parties to the review, direct that a conference be held for any one or more of the purposes set out in subsection (3).

subsection.leadIn: The conditions are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the chairperson, after considering any material that has been submitted to the Tribunal in relation to the application for review by the parties to the review, considers it appropriate to hold the conference; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the parties agree or, for an application made by a party under subsection (1), the other party agrees.

subsection.leadIn: The purposes are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: to enable the parties to prepare for the conduct of the review;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: to assist the Tribunal to determine issues for the purposes of the review;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: to generally secure the just, expeditious and economical conduct of the review.

subsection.content: A conference is to be attended by the parties or their representatives and presided over by the chairperson.

subsection.leadIn: At a conference held in accordance with a direction of the chairperson under subsection (1), the chairperson may—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: endeavour to secure that the parties to the review make all agreements as they ought reasonably to have made in relation to the review.

subsection.content: After a conference has been held in accordance with a direction of the chairperson under subsection (1), the chairperson must report to the Tribunal on the matters relating to the conference that the chairperson considers appropriate.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Consent orders

subsection.content: At any time after an application for review has been made, the Tribunal or chairperson may make any order which it or the chairperson is entitled to make under any provision of this Ordinance, whether or not the requirements otherwise applicable to the making of the order have been complied with, if the conditions set out in subsection (2) are met.

subsection.leadIn: The conditions are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the parties to the review request, and agree to, the making of the order by the Tribunal or the chairperson (as the case may be); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the parties consent to all of the terms of the order.

subsection.content: Despite Part XII or any other provisions of this Schedule, an order made under subsection (1) by the Tribunal or chairperson must, for all purposes, be regarded as an order made under the provision in question in compliance with the requirements otherwise applicable to the making of the order.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: order (命令) includes any finding, determination and any other decision.

section.name: s9
section.heading: Chairperson as sole member of Tribunal

subsection.leadIn: The chairperson may determine a review or an application as the sole member of the Tribunal if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: at any time after an application for the review has been made but before any sitting of the Tribunal is held to determine the review, the parties to the review have, by notice in writing given to the Tribunal, informed the Tribunal that they have agreed that the review may be determined by the chairperson as the sole member;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the application is an application to the Tribunal under section 100 for an extension of the time within which an application for review may be made; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the application is an application to the Tribunal under section 110 for a stay of execution of a specified decision.

subsection.content: If subsection (1) applies, the Tribunal constituted by the chairperson as the sole member of the Tribunal is to be regarded for all purposes as the Tribunal constituted also by 2 ordinary members.

After making a determination under subsection (1)(c), the chairperson must report to the Tribunal the determination and the reasons for the determination, and other matters relating to the determination that the chairperson considers appropriate.

In the circumstances specified in subsection (5), a person who is eligible to be appointed as a chairperson under section 3 of this Schedule must, on appointment by the Chief Executive for the purpose, determine the application in question as if he or she were the chairperson duly appointed under this Ordinance, and the provisions of this Ordinance are to apply to him or her accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: The circumstances are—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is an application described in subsection (1)(c); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: the chairperson—

subparagraph.content: cannot perform his or her functions because of illness, absence from Hong Kong or any other reason; or
considers it improper or undesirable that he or she should perform his or her functions in relation to the application.

section.name: s10
section.heading: Privileges and immunities
section.content: Except as otherwise provided in this Ordinance, the Tribunal, the chairperson and ordinary members, and any party, witness, counsel, solicitor, or any other person involved, in a review, have the same privileges and immunities in respect of the review as they would have if the review were civil proceedings before the Court of First Instance.

schedule.name: sch11
schedule.heading: Savings and Transitional Arrangements for Insurance Companies (Amendment) Ordinance 2015

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation of Schedule 11
section.leadIn: In this Schedule—
section.def: approved broker body (認可經紀團體) means a body of insurance brokers approved under section 70 of the pre-amended Ordinance;

commencement date (實施日期)—(a)except in relation to Parts 5, 6, 7 and 8 of this Schedule, means the date* on which section 10 of the Amendment Ordinance comes into operation;(b)in relation to Parts 5, 6, 7 and 8 of this Schedule, means the date# on which section 74 of the Amendment Ordinance comes into operation; (Amended E.R. 3 of 2015)
HKFI (保聯) means the Hong Kong Federation of Insurers;
IARB (委員會) means the Insurance Agents Registration Board set up by HKFI;
information (資訊) includes data, text, images, sound codes, computer programmes, software and databases;
personal data (個人資料) has the meaning given by section 2(1) of the Personal Data (Privacy) Ordinance (Cap. 486);
record (紀錄) means information that is inscribed on, stored in or otherwise fixed on a tangible medium or that is stored in an electronic or other medium and is retrievable in a perceivable form.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Savings relating to former authority

subsection.content: If, immediately before the commencement date, an act was in the process of being done by or in relation to the former authority, the act may be continued by or in relation to the Authority.

subsection.leadIn: If, immediately before the commencement date, any legal proceedings to which the former authority was a party, or that are instituted on behalf of the former authority, were pending—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Authority is substituted as a party to the proceedings in lieu of the former authority; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the proceedings are to continue as if the Authority had always been that party.

subsection.content: A right of appeal subsisting immediately before the commencement date against the former authority may be exercised against the Authority in accordance with this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: If a form, document, instrument or act—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has been issued, made or done by or on behalf of the former authority; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: was in force immediately before the commencement date, or is to take effect on or after that date,

subsection.continued: it has effect as if it was issued, made or done by or on behalf of the Authority in so far as that is required for continuing its effect after the commencement date.

subsection.content: If an act of performing a function by or on behalf of the former authority under the pre-amended Ordinance was in force immediately before the commencement date, or is to take effect on or after that date, the act has effect as if the function was performed by the Authority under this Ordinance in so far as that is required for continuing the effect of the act after that date.

subsection.leadIn: If, immediately before the commencement date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application for anything referred to in subsection (4);

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a request for the performance of a function referred to in subsection (5); or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: an application or request of a similar nature made to the former authority,

subsection.continued: has not been disposed of, it is to be regarded as an application or request to the Authority, and is to be disposed of accordingly.

subsection.leadIn: An—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: authorization, consent, approval or other permission of any description that has been given, or is deemed to have been given, in relation to an authorized insurer under the pre-amended Ordinance; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: exemption or condition to, or limitation for, an exemption that has been given or imposed in relation to an authorized insurer under the pre-amended Ordinance,

subsection.continued: and was in force immediately before the commencement date is to continue in force for the remainder of its validity period as if the Amendment Ordinance had not been enacted.

subsection.leadIn: If a form, document or instrument (including a form, document or instrument referred to in subsection (4) issued or made by or on behalf of the former authority for the performance of its function under the pre-amended Ordinance)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: was specified, prescribed, printed or duplicated for use in connection with the pre-amended Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: was in force immediately before the commencement date,

subsection.continued: it may be so used despite the fact that it contains a reference to the former authority, and that reference is to be construed as a reference to the Authority.

part.name: P3
part.heading: Transfer of Records from Former Authority to Authority

section.name: s3
section.heading: Former authority to transfer records to Authority

subsection.content: All records in the former authority’s custody and are, in the opinion of the Authority, required for it to perform its functions under this Ordinance must be transferred from the former authority to the Authority on or before the commencement date.

In relation to a record transferred under this section, all the rights and obligations of the former authority subsisting immediately before the transfer are to be transferred to the Authority on the transfer of the record.
The Authority must ensure that there are in place proper procedures and systems to safeguard against unauthorized access to, or unauthorized use of, the records transferred under this section.

In relation to personal data transferred under this section, the Personal Data (Privacy) Ordinance (Cap. 486) applies as if the data had been received by the Authority rather than the former authority.

subsection.leadIn: In relation to personal data transferred under this section—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Authority must ensure that the data is used, disclosed and retained for the purpose for which the data was to be used at the time of the collection; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Privacy Commissioner for Personal Data may, on and after the date on which the data is transferred, exercise in relation to the Authority any power under the Personal Data (Privacy) Ordinance (Cap. 486) that the Commissioner could have, immediately before that date, exercised in relation to the former authority for a breach or alleged breach by the former authority of a requirement under that Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: The transfer of a record by the former authority to the Authority under this section does not amount to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a breach of duty of confidentiality to which the former authority is subject immediately before the transfer; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a contravention by the Authority or the former authority of the Personal Data (Privacy) Ordinance (Cap. 486).

part.name: P4
part.heading: Appeals to Financial Secretary that have been Made or could have been Made before Commencement Date

section.name: s4
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 4 of this Schedule
section.leadIn: In this Part—
section.def: specified decision (指明決定) means—(a)a decision made by the former authority to refuse to authorize a company under section 8 of the pre-amended Ordinance on the ground (or on grounds including the ground) that a person as mentioned in section 8(2) of the pre-amended Ordinance is not a fit and proper person to hold the position held by the person;(b)a decision of the former authority to refuse to authorize a company under section 8(1)(b)(ii) of the pre-amended Ordinance;(c)a decision of the former authority to serve a notice of objection under section 13A(5) of the pre-amended Ordinance;(d)a decision of the former authority to serve a notice of objection under section 13B(4) of the pre-amended Ordinance;(e)a decision of the former authority to serve a notice of objection under section 14(4) of the pre-amended Ordinance;(f)a direction given by the former authority under section 35(2) of the pre-amended Ordinance;(g)a determination made by the former authority under section 38E(5) of the pre-amended Ordinance;(h)a decision of the former authority to serve a notice of objection under section 50B(3) of the pre-amended Ordinance;(i)a decision of the former authority to serve a notice of removal under section 50B(4) of the pre-amended Ordinance;(j)a decision of de-registration of a person as an appointed insurance agent as defined by section 2(1) of the pre-amended Ordinance under section 66(7) of the pre-amended Ordinance; or(k)a decision of the former authority under section 75(1) of the pre-amended Ordinance to withdraw—(i)the authorization of an insurance broker as defined by section 2(1) of the pre-amended Ordinance; or(ii)the approval of a body of insurance brokers approved under section 70 of the pre-amended Ordinance.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Appeals not yet determined by Financial Secretary

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if an appeal against a specified decision—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has been made to the Financial Secretary; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has not been finally disposed of before the commencement date.

subsection.leadIn: On or after the commencement date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Tribunal is to handle the appeal as if it was an appeal made to the Tribunal under section 6 of this Schedule; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Financial Secretary is to cease to have power to handle the appeal.

section.name: s6
section.heading: Appeals not made to Financial Secretary before commencement date

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a specified decision was made before the commencement date;

paragraph.name: b
c
paragraph.content: the period within which an appeal against the decision could be made has not expired, or there is no time limit prescribed for such an appeal, under the pre-amended Ordinance; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: no appeal has been made to the Financial Secretary before the commencement date against the decision.

subsection.content: On or after the commencement date, an appeal against the decision may only be made to the Tribunal.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Determination of appeals under sections 5 and 6 of this Schedule

subsection.content: An appeal mentioned in section 5 or 6 of this Schedule must be determined by the Tribunal by reference to the provisions of the pre-amended Ordinance that would have applied to the specified decision had the Financial Secretary continued to have the power to handle the appeal, or had the appeal been made to the Financial Secretary.

subsection.leadIn: Part XII applies to an appeal mentioned in section 5 or 6 of this Schedule as if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference to a review in that Part was a reference to such an appeal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reference to a party to a review included the Authority.

subsection.content: However, the Tribunal must not determine the appeal by remitting the matter in question to the Financial Secretary.

part.name: P5
part.heading: Savings and Transitional Arrangements Relating to Licensing and Approval

section.name: s8
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 5 of this Schedule
section.leadIn: In this Part—
section.def: specified date (指明日期), in relation to an application made under section 64U(1), 64W(1), 64Y(1), 64ZA(1), 64ZC(1), 64ZE(1) or 64ZF(1)—(a)if the application is granted, means the date on which the application is granted by the Authority to the applicant; or(b)if the application is rejected, means—(i)the expiry of 21 days after the notice informing the applicant of the results of the application has been sent; or(ii)(if an appeal is made against the results of the application within the period ending 21 days after the notice has been sent) the date on which the appeal is disposed of or withdrawn;
transitional period (過渡期) means the period of 3 years beginning on the commencement date.

division.name: D2
division.heading: Savings and Transitional Arrangements for Insurance Agencies

section.name: s9
section.heading: Insurance agencies registered with IARB
section.leadIn: If a person was, immediately before the commencement date, registered with IARB as an insurance agency, the person is to be regarded as—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: having been granted a licence under section 64U; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: being so licensed from the commencement date until the expiry of the transitional period.

subdivision.name: SD2
subdivision.heading: Decision of Revocation not yet Taken Effect on Commencement Date

section.name: s10
section.heading: Application of section 11 of this Schedule
section.leadIn: Section 11 of this Schedule applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person was registered with IARB as an insurance agency before the commencement date;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: IARB has, before the commencement date, made a decision that the registration of the person be revoked;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the decision has not taken effect on the commencement date; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the person does not appeal against the decision.

section.name: s11
section.heading: No appeal against decision been made
section.leadIn: Despite section 9 of this Schedule, the person is to be regarded as—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: having been granted a licence under section 64U; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: being so licensed from the commencement date until the time the decision takes effect.

section.name: s12
section.heading: Application of sections 13, 14 and 15 of this Schedule
section.leadIn: Sections 13, 14 and 15 of this Schedule apply if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person was registered with IARB as an insurance agency before the commencement date;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: IARB has, before the commencement date, made a decision that the registration of the person be revoked;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the decision has not taken effect on the commencement date; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the person has appealed against the decision but the appeal is not finally disposed of before the commencement date or the person appeals against the decision on or after the commencement date.

section.name: s13
section.heading: No application for stay of execution or application for stay of execution rejected
section.leadIn: If the person does not apply for a stay of execution of the decision or if the person makes such an application but the application is rejected, then despite section 9 of this Schedule, the person is to be regarded as having been granted a licence under section 64U and as being so licensed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: from the commencement date until the time the decision takes effect; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on appeal—

subparagraph.content: if the decision is reversed by the Tribunal, subject to section 23(1) of this Schedule—from the time the determination of the Tribunal takes effect until the expiry of the transitional period; or

if the decision is confirmed by the Tribunal, but the person appeals to the Court of Appeal against the determination of the Tribunal, and the Court of Appeal reverses the determination—from the time the decision of the Court of Appeal takes effect until the expiry of the transitional period.

section.name: s14
section.heading: Stay of execution granted after decision takes effect
section.leadIn: If the person applies for a stay of execution of the decision after the decision takes effect and the application is granted, then despite section 9 of this Schedule, the person is to be regarded as having been granted a licence under section 64U and as being so licensed—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: from the commencement date until the time the decision takes effect; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on appeal—

subparagraph.content: if the decision is reversed by the Tribunal, subject to section 23(1) of this Schedule—from the time the application for the stay of execution of the decision is granted until the expiry of the transitional period;
if the decision is confirmed by the Tribunal—from the time the application for the stay of execution of the decision is granted until the time the determination of the Tribunal takes effect; or
if the appeal is withdrawn—from the time the application for the stay of execution of the decision is granted until the time the appeal is withdrawn.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Stay of execution granted before decision takes effect
section.leadIn: If the person applies for a stay of execution of the decision before the decision takes effect and the application is granted, then despite section 9 of this Schedule, the person is to be regarded as having been granted a licence under section 64U and as being so licensed—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: if the decision is confirmed by the Tribunal on appeal—from the commencement date until the time the determination of the Tribunal takes effect; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the appeal is withdrawn—from the commencement date until the time the appeal is withdrawn.

subdivision.name: SD3
subdivision.heading: Stay of Execution Granted before Commencement Date

section.name: s16
section.heading: Application of section 17 of this Schedule
section.leadIn: Section 17 of this Schedule applies if—

paragraph.name: a

division.heading: Savings and Transitional Arrangements for Authorized Insurance Brokers

section.name: s66
section.heading: Authorized insurance brokers registered with approved broker bodies
section.leadIn: If a company was, immediately before the commencement date, registered with an approved broker body as a member, the company is to be regarded as—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: having been granted a licence under section 64ZA; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: being so licensed from the commencement date until the expiry of the transitional period.

subdivision.name: SD2
subdivision.heading: Decision of Expulsion not yet Taken Effect on Commencement Date

section.name: s67
section.heading: Company being expelled from membership of approved broker body

subsection.leadIn: Despite section 66 of this Schedule, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a company was registered with an approved broker body as a member before the commencement date;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the approved broker body with which the company was registered has, before the commencement date, made a decision that the company be expelled from the membership of the body; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the decision has not taken effect on the commencement date,

subsection.continued: subject to section 69(1) of this Schedule, the company is to be regarded as having been granted a licence under section 64ZA and as being so licensed from the commencement date until the time specified in subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: The time specified for subsection (1) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the company does not appeal against the decision, the time the decision takes effect; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the company appeals against the decision and—

subparagraph.content: if the appeal is withdrawn, the time the appeal is withdrawn.

section.name: s68
section.heading: Appeals not disposed of on expiry of transitional period
section.content: In relation to section 67(1) and (2)(b) of this Schedule, if the appeal is not finally disposed of on the date on which the transitional period expires, the company is to be regarded as having been granted a licence under section 64ZA until the expiry of that date.

section.name: s69
section.heading: Appeals to Court of Appeal

subsection.leadIn: In relation to section 67(1) and (2)(b)(i) of this Schedule, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Authority appeals to the Court of Appeal against the determination of the Tribunal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Court of Appeal reverses the determination,

subsection.continued: the licence regarded as having been granted under section 64ZA is to remain in force until the time the decision of the Court of Appeal takes effect.

subsection.leadIn: In relation to section 67(1) and (2)(b)(ii) of this Schedule, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the company appeals to the Court of Appeal against the determination of the Tribunal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Court of Appeal reverses the determination,

subsection.continued: the company is also to be regarded as having been granted a licence under section 64ZA from the time the decision of the Court of Appeal takes effect until the expiry of the transitional period.

section.name: s70
section.heading: Effect of application for insurance broker company licence
section.content: If a company which is regarded as having been granted a licence under section 64ZA makes an application for an insurance broker company licence under that section in the manner, and within the time, specified by the Authority, the licence regarded as having been granted under that section is to remain in force until the specified date.

section.name: s71
section.heading: Conditions imposed by approved broker body
section.content: A condition imposed by an approved broker body in relation to the registration of a company as a member that was in force immediately before the commencement date (except a condition relating to the payment of fees or charges to the approved broker body) is, on the commencement date, taken to be a condition imposed by the Authority in relation to the licence that is regarded as having been granted under section 64ZA to the company.

section.name: s72
section.heading: Requirements to comply with conditions
section.content: A company which is regarded as having been granted a licence under section 64ZA must, during the period when the licence is in force, comply with any condition under sections 71 and 111 of this Schedule.

section.name: s73
section.heading: Application of provisions relating to licensed insurance broker companies
section.content: Subject to section 74 of this Schedule, a provision in this Ordinance relating to a licensed insurance broker company applies to a company which is regarded under this Division as having been granted a licence under section 64ZA.

section.name: s74
section.heading: Application of section 64T to companies applying for de-registration

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to a company which—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is regarded under this Division as having been granted a licence under section 64ZA; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has, before the commencement date, applied to an approved broker body for de-registration as a member of the body on the ground of cessation of business.

subsection.content: Except as otherwise provided in this section, section 64T applies to the company.
The company is to be regarded as having complied with section 64T(1).

Despite section 64T(2) and (3), the company is only required to submit to the Authority, if so required by the Authority, any document specified in section 64T(2) not later than 6 months after the commencement date.

division.name: D6
division.heading: Savings and Transitional Arrangements for Technical Representatives and Chief Executives Registered with Approved Broker Bodies

section.name: s75
section.heading: Technical representatives and chief executives registered with approved broker bodies
section.leadIn: If an individual was, immediately before the commencement date, registered with an approved broker body as a technical representative or a chief executive, the individual is to be regarded as—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: having been granted a licence under section 64ZC; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: being so licensed from the commencement date until the expiry of the transitional period.

subdivision.name: SD2
subdivision.heading: Decision of Removal from Register not yet Taken Effect on Commencement Date

section.name: s76
section.heading: Individual whose name being removed from register of approved broker body

subsection.leadIn: Despite section 75 of this Schedule, if—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the approved broker body with which the individual was registered has, before the commencement date, made a decision that the individual’s name be removed from the relevant register maintained by the body; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the decision has not taken effect on the commencement date,

subsection.continued: subject to section 78(1) of this Schedule, the individual is to be regarded as having been granted a licence under section 64ZC and as being so licensed from the commencement date until the time specified in subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: The time specified for subsection (1) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the individual does not appeal against the decision, the time the decision takes effect; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the individual appeals against the decision and—

subparagraph.content: if the appeal is withdrawn, the time the appeal is withdrawn.

section.name: s77
section.heading: Appeals not disposed of on expiry of transitional period
section.content: In relation to section 76(1) and (2)(b) of this Schedule, if the appeal is not finally disposed of on the date on which the transitional period expires, the individual is to be regarded as having been granted a licence under section 64ZC until the expiry of that date.

section.name: s78
section.heading: Appeals to Court of Appeal

subsection.leadIn: In relation to section 76(1) and (2)(b)(i) of this Schedule, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Authority appeals to the Court of Appeal against the determination of the Tribunal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Court of Appeal reverses the determination,

subsection.continued: the licence regarded as having been granted under section 64ZC is to remain in force until the time the decision of the Court of Appeal takes effect.

subsection.leadIn: In relation to section 76(1) and (2)(b)(ii) of this Schedule, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the individual appeals to the Court of Appeal against the determination of the Tribunal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Court of Appeal reverses the determination,

subsection.continued: the individual is also to be regarded as having been granted a licence under section 64ZC from the time the decision of the Court of Appeal takes effect until the expiry of the transitional period.

section.name: s79
section.heading: Effect of application for technical representative (broker) licence
section.content: If an individual who is regarded as having been granted a licence under section 64ZC makes an application for a technical representative (broker) licence under that section in the manner, and within the time, specified by the Authority, the licence regarded as having been granted under that section is to remain in force until the specified date.

section.name: s80
section.heading: Conditions imposed by approval broker body
section.content: A condition imposed by an approved broker body in relation to the registration of an individual as a technical representative or a chief executive that was in force immediately before the commencement date (except a condition relating to the payment of fees or charges to the approved broker body) is, on the commencement date, taken to be a condition imposed by the Authority in relation to the licence that is regarded as having been granted under section 64ZC to the individual.

section.name: s81
section.heading: Requirements to comply with conditions
section.content: An individual who is regarded as having been granted a licence under section 64ZC must, during the period when the licence is in force, comply with any condition under sections 80 and 111 of this Schedule.

section.name: s82
section.heading: Application of provisions relating to licensed technical representative (broker)
section.content: A provision in this Ordinance relating to a licensed technical representative (broker) applies to an individual who is regarded under this Division as having been granted a licence under section 64ZC.

division.name: D7
division.heading: Savings and Transitional Arrangements for Responsible Officers of Insurance Agencies

section.name: s83
section.heading: Responsible officers of insurance agencies registered with IARB
section.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an individual was, immediately before the commencement date, registered with IARB as a responsible officer of an insurance agency registered with IARB; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the insurance agency is regarded under section 9 of this Schedule as having been granted a licence under section 64U,

section.continued: the individual is to be regarded as having been granted an approval under section 64ZE as a responsible officer of the insurance agency and as being so approved from the commencement date until the expiry of the transitional period.

subdivision.name: SD2
subdivision.heading: Decision of Revocation not yet Taken Effect on Commencement Date

section.name: s84
section.heading: Application of section 85 of this Schedule
section.leadIn: Section 85 of this Schedule applies if—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: IARB has, before the commencement date, made a decision that the registration of the individual be revoked;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the decision has not taken effect on the commencement date; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the individual does not appeal against the decision.

section.name: s85
section.heading: No appeal against decision been made
section.leadIn: Despite section 83 of this Schedule, the individual is to be regarded as—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: having been granted an approval under section 64ZE as a responsible officer of the insurance agency; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: being so approved from the commencement date until the time the decision takes effect.

section.name: s86
section.heading: Application of sections 87, 88 and 89 of this Schedule
section.leadIn: Sections 87, 88 and 89 of this Schedule apply if—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: IARB has, before the commencement date, made a decision that the registration of the individual be revoked;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the decision has not taken effect on the commencement date; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the individual has appealed against the decision but the appeal is not finally disposed of before the commencement date or the individual appeals against the decision on or after the commencement date.

section.name: s87
section.heading: No application for stay of execution or application for stay of execution rejected
section.leadIn: If the individual does not apply for a stay of execution of the decision or if the individual makes such an application but the application is rejected, then despite section 83 of this Schedule, the individual is to be regarded as having been granted an approval under section 64ZE as a responsible officer of the insurance agency and as being so approved—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: from the commencement date until the time the decision takes effect; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on appeal—

subparagraph.content: if the decision is reversed by the Tribunal, subject to section 97(1) of this Schedule—from the time the determination of the Tribunal takes effect until the expiry of the transitional period; or

if the decision is confirmed by the Tribunal, but the individual appeals to the Court of Appeal against the determination of the Tribunal, and the Court of Appeal reverses the determination—from the time the decision of the Court of Appeal takes effect until the expiry of the transitional period.

section.name: s88
section.heading: Stay of execution granted after decision takes effect
section.leadIn: If the individual applies for a stay of execution of the decision after the decision takes effect and the application is granted, then despite section 83 of this Schedule, the individual is to be regarded as having been granted an approval under section 64ZE as a responsible officer of the insurance agency and as being so approved—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: from the commencement date until the time the decision takes effect; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: on appeal—

subparagraph.content: if the decision is reversed by the Tribunal, subject to section 97(1) of this Schedule—from the time the application for the stay of execution of the decision is granted until the expiry of the transitional period;
if the decision is confirmed by the Tribunal—from the time the application for the stay of execution of the decision is granted until the time the determination of the Tribunal takes effect; or
if the appeal is withdrawn—from the time the application for the stay of execution of the decision is granted until the time the appeal is withdrawn.

section.name: s89
section.heading: Stay of execution granted before decision takes effect
section.leadIn: If the individual applies for a stay of execution of the decision before the decision takes effect and the application is granted, then despite section 83 of this Schedule, the individual is to be regarded as having been granted an approval under section 64ZE as a responsible officer of the insurance agency and as being so approved—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: if the decision is confirmed by the Tribunal on appeal—from the commencement date until the time the determination of the Tribunal takes effect; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the appeal is withdrawn—from the commencement date until the time the appeal is withdrawn.

subdivision.name: SD3
subdivision.heading: Stay of Execution Granted before Commencement Date

section.name: s90
section.heading: Application of section 91 of this Schedule
section.leadIn: Section 91 of this Schedule applies if—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: IARB has, before the commencement date, made a decision that the registration of the individual be revoked;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the individual has appealed against the decision and applied for stay of execution of the decision and the application was granted before the commencement date; and

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the appeal is not finally disposed of before the commencement date.

section.name: s91
section.heading: Stay of execution granted and appeal not disposed of before commencement date
section.leadIn: Despite section 83 of this Schedule, the individual is to be regarded as having been granted an approval under section 64ZE as a responsible officer of the insurance agency and as being so approved—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: if the decision is confirmed by the Tribunal on appeal—from the commencement date until the time the determination of the Tribunal takes effect; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the appeal is withdrawn—from the commencement date until the time the appeal is withdrawn.

subdivision.name: SD4
subdivision.heading: Decision of Revocation Taken Effect on or before Commencement Date

section.name: s92
section.heading: Application of sections 93 and 94 of this Schedule
section.leadIn: Sections 93 and 94 of this Schedule apply if—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: IARB has, before the commencement date, made a decision that the registration of the individual be revoked;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the decision has taken effect on or before the commencement date;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: the individual appeals against the decision before, on or after the commencement date; and

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: (if the individual has appealed against the decision before the commencement date) the appeal is not finally disposed of before the commencement date.

section.name: s93
section.heading: No application for stay of execution or application for stay of execution rejected
section.leadIn: If the individual does not apply for a stay of execution of the decision or the individual makes such an application but the application is rejected, then despite section 83 of this Schedule, the individual is to be regarded as having been granted an approval under section 64ZE as a responsible officer of the insurance agency and as being so approved—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the decision is reversed by the Tribunal on appeal, subject to section 97(1) of this Schedule—from the time the determination of the Tribunal takes effect until the expiry of the transitional period; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the decision is confirmed by the Tribunal on appeal, but the individual appeals to the Court of Appeal against the determination of the Tribunal, and the Court of Appeal reverses the determination—from the time the decision of the Court of Appeal takes effect until the expiry of the transitional period.

section.name: s94
section.heading: Stay of execution granted after commencement date
section.leadIn: If the individual applies for a stay of execution of the decision and the application is granted after the commencement date, then despite section 83 of this Schedule, the individual is to be regarded as having been granted an approval under section 64ZE as a responsible officer of the insurance agency and as being so approved—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the decision is reversed by the Tribunal on appeal, subject to section 97(1) of this Schedule—from the time the application for the stay of execution of the decision is granted until the expiry of the transitional period;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the decision is confirmed by the Tribunal on appeal—from the time the application for the stay of execution of the decision is granted until the time the determination of the Tribunal takes effect; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: if the appeal is withdrawn—from the time the application for the stay of execution of the decision is granted until the time the appeal is withdrawn.

subdivision.name: SD5
subdivision.heading: Application for Registration Rejected before Commencement Date

section.name: s95
section.heading: Applications for registration rejected

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2) applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an individual applied to IARB for registration as a responsible officer of an insurance agency registered with IARB but IARB has, before the commencement date, made a decision that the application be rejected;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the individual appeals against the decision; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the insurance agency is regarded under section 9 of this Schedule as having been granted a licence under section 64U.

subsection.leadIn: The individual is to be regarded as having been granted an approval under section 64ZE as a responsible officer of the insurance agency and as being so approved—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the decision is reversed by the Tribunal on appeal, subject to section 97(1) of this Schedule—from the time the determination of the Tribunal takes effect until the expiry of the transitional period; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the decision is confirmed by the Tribunal on appeal, but the individual appeals to the Court of Appeal against the determination of the Tribunal, and the Court of Appeal reverses the determination—from the time the decision of the Court of Appeal takes effect until the expiry of the transitional period.

section.name: s96
section.heading: Appeals not disposed of on expiry of transitional period
section.content: In relation to sections 88, 89, 91 and 94 of this Schedule, if the appeal is not finally disposed of on the date on which the transitional period expires, the individual is to be regarded as having been granted an approval under section 64ZE as a responsible officer of the insurance agency until the expiry of that date.

section.name: s97
section.heading: Appeals to Court of Appeal

subsection.leadIn: In relation to sections 87(b)(i), 88(b)(i), 89(a), 91(a), 93(a), 94(a) and 95(2)(a) of this Schedule, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Authority appeals to the Court of Appeal against the determination of the Tribunal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Court of Appeal reverses the determination,

subsection.continued: the approval regarded as having been granted under section 64ZE is to remain in force until the time the decision of the Court of Appeal takes effect.

subsection.leadIn: In relation to sections 88(b)(ii), 89(b), 91(b) and 94(b) of this Schedule, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the individual appeals to the Court of Appeal against the determination of the Tribunal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Court of Appeal reverses the determination,

subsection.continued: the individual is also to be regarded as having been granted an approval under section 64ZE as a responsible officer of the insurance agency from the time the decision of the Court of Appeal takes effect until the expiry of the transitional period.

section.name: s98
section.heading: Effect of application for approval under section 64ZE

subsection.content: This section applies to an individual who is regarded as having been granted an approval under section 64ZE as a responsible officer of an insurance agency that is regarded as having been granted a licence under section 64U.

If the agency makes an application for the approval of the individual as a responsible officer of the agency under section 64ZE in the manner, and within the time, specified by the Authority, the approval regarded as having been granted under that section is to remain in force until the specified date.

section.name: s99
section.heading: Conditions imposed by IARB
section.content: A condition imposed by IARB in relation to the registration of an individual as a responsible officer of an insurance agency that was in force immediately before the commencement date (except a condition relating to the payment of fees or charges to IARB) is, on the commencement date, taken to be a condition imposed by the Authority in relation to the approval that is regarded as having been granted under section 64ZE to the individual.

section.name: s100
section.heading: Requirements to comply with conditions
section.content: An individual who is regarded as having been granted an approval under section 64ZE as a responsible officer of the insurance agency must, during the period when the approval is in force, comply with any condition under sections 99 and 111 of this Schedule.

section.name: s101
section.heading: Application of provisions relating to responsible officers of licensed insurance agencies
section.content: A provision in this Ordinance relating to a responsible officer of a licensed insurance agency applies to an individual who is regarded under this Division as having been granted an approval under section 64ZE.

division.name: D8
division.heading: Savings and Transitional Arrangements for Chief Executives Registered with Approved Broker Bodies

section.name: s102
section.heading: Chief executives registered with approved broker bodies
section.leadIn: If—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an individual was, immediately before the commencement date, registered with an approved broker body as a chief executive of a company that is a member of the body; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the company is regarded under section 66 of this Schedule as having been granted a licence under section 64ZA,

section.continued: the individual is to be regarded as having been granted an approval under section 64ZF as a responsible officer of the company and as being so approved from the commencement date until the expiry of the transitional period.

subdivision.name: SD2
subdivision.heading: Decision of Revocation not yet Taken Effect on Commencement Date

section.name: s103
section.heading: Individual whose registration as chief executive being revoked

subsection.leadIn: Despite section 102 of this Schedule, if—

paragraph.name: a
b
c
paragraph.content: the approved broker body with which the individual was registered has, before the commencement date, made a decision that the individual’s registration with the body as a chief executive be revoked; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: the decision has not taken effect on the commencement date,

subsection.continued: subject to section 105(1) of this Schedule, the individual is to be regarded as having been granted an approval under section 64ZF as a responsible officer of the company and as being so approved from the commencement date until the time specified in subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: The time specified for subsection (1) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the individual does not appeal against the decision, the time the decision takes effect; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.leadIn: if the individual appeals against the decision and—

subparagraph.content: if the appeal is withdrawn, the time the appeal is withdrawn.

section.name: s104
section.heading: Appeals not disposed of on expiry of transitional period
section.content: In relation to section 103(1) and (2)(b) of this Schedule, if the appeal is not finally disposed of on the date on which the transitional period expires, the individual is to be regarded as having been granted an approval under section 64ZF as a responsible officer of the company until the expiry of that date.

section.name: s105
section.heading: Appeals to Court of Appeal

subsection.leadIn: In relation to section 103(1) and (2)(b)(i) of this Schedule, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Authority appeals to the Court of Appeal against the determination of the Tribunal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Court of Appeal reverses the determination,

subsection.continued: the approval regarded as having been granted under section 64ZF is to remain in force until the time the decision of the Court of Appeal takes effect.

subsection.leadIn: In relation to section 103(1) and (2)(b)(ii) of this Schedule, if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the individual appeals to the Court of Appeal against the determination of the Tribunal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the Court of Appeal reverses the determination,

subsection.continued: the individual is also to be regarded as having been granted an approval under section 64ZF as a responsible officer of the company from the time the decision of the Court of Appeal takes effect until the expiry of the transitional period.

section.name: s106
section.heading: Effect of application for approval under section 64ZF

subsection.content: This section applies to an individual who is regarded as having been granted an approval under section 64ZF as a responsible officer of a company that is regarded as having been granted a licence under section 64ZA.

If the company makes an application for the approval of the individual as a responsible officer of the company under section 64ZF in the manner, and within the time, specified by the Authority, the approval regarded as having been granted under that section is to remain in force until the specified date.

section.name: s107
section.heading: Conditions imposed by approved broker body
section.content: A condition imposed by an approved broker body in relation to the registration of an individual as a chief executive that was in force immediately before the commencement date (except a condition relating to the payment of fees or charges to the approved broker body) is, on the commencement date, taken to be a condition imposed by the Authority in relation to the approval that is regarded as having been granted under section 64ZF to the individual.

section.name: s108
section.heading: Requirements to comply with conditions
section.content: An individual who is regarded as having been granted an approval under section 64ZF as a responsible officer of the company must, during the period when the approval is in force, comply with any condition under sections 107 and 111 of this Schedule.

section.name: s109
section.heading: Application of provisions relating to responsible officers of licensed insurance broker companies
section.content: A provision in this Ordinance relating to a responsible officer of a licensed insurance broker company applies to an individual who is regarded under this Division as having been granted an approval under section 64ZF.

section.name: s110
section.heading: Authority may revoke or suspend licences and approval regarded as granted

subsection.content: If the Authority has reasonable ground to believe that any application information was, at the time when it was provided by the person, wrong, incomplete, false or misleading in a material respect, the Authority may, at any time during the transitional period, by notice in writing, revoke or suspend a licence or an approval that is regarded as having been granted to a person under Division 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7 or 8 of this Part.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may, at any time during the transitional period, by notice in writing, revoke or suspend a licence or an approval that is regarded as having been granted to a person under Division 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7 or 8 of this Part if the Authority has reasonable ground to believe that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: for a person who is regarded under Division 2 of this Part as having been granted a licence under section 64U—the person fails to comply with section 26 of this Schedule;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: for a person who is regarded under Division 3 of this Part as having been granted a licence under section 64W—the person fails to comply with section 45 of this Schedule;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: for a person who is regarded under Division 4 of this Part as having been granted a licence under section 64Y—the person fails to comply with section 64 of this Schedule;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: for a person who is regarded under Division 5 of this Part as having been granted a licence under section 64ZA—the person fails to comply with section 72 of this Schedule;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: for a person who is regarded under Division 6 of this Part as having been granted a licence under section 64ZC—the person fails to comply with section 81 of this Schedule;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: for a person who is regarded under Division 7 of this Part as having been granted an approval under section 64ZE—the person fails to comply with section 100 of this Schedule;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: for a person who is regarded under Division 8 of this Part as having been granted an approval under section 64ZF—the person fails to comply with section 108 of this Schedule.

subsection.leadIn: The power under subsection (1) or (2) is not exercisable unless, before exercising the power, the Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has given the person a notice in writing of its intention to do so and the reasons for doing so; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has given the person an opportunity to make written representations or oral representations on those reasons.

subsection.leadIn: A notice under subsection (3)(a) must also include a statement describing—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the right of the person to make representations; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: how and when the person may make representations.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: application information (申請資料) means information provided by a person to an entity specified in column 2 of the Table in relation to an application for the registration or approval of the person as the type of person specified in column 3 of the Table opposite the entity.
