section.name: s111
section.heading: Licences and approval regarded as granted are subject to conditions imposed by Authority

subsection.content: A licence or an approval that is regarded as having been granted to a person under Division 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7 or 8 of this Part is subject to any condition that the Authority imposes.
The Authority may, at any time during the transitional period, by notice in writing, amend or revoke any condition imposed, or impose new conditions.

If the Authority by notice in writing amends or revokes a condition or imposes a new condition under subsection (2), the amendment, revocation or imposition takes effect at the time the notice is served on the person or at the time specified in the notice, whichever is the later.

The Authority must not impose a condition under subsection (1), or amend such a condition under subsection (2), without giving the person an opportunity to make representations as to why the condition should not be imposed or amended.
In this section, a reference to an opportunity to make representations is a reference to an opportunity to make written representations or oral representations.

part.name: P6
part.heading: Contraventions of Applicable Rules before Commencement Date

section.name: s112
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 6 of this Schedule
section.leadIn: In this Part—
section.def: self-regulatory body (自我規管團體)—(a)in relation to an alleged contravention of a requirement under a rule within the meaning of section 123 of this Schedule—means IARB; or(b)in relation to an alleged contravention of a requirement under a rule within the meaning of section 124 of this Schedule—means an approved broker body;

specified person (指明人士) means—(a)an insurance agency registered with IARB;(b)an individual agent registered with IARB;(c)a technical representative registered with IARB;(d)a responsible officer registered with IARB;(e)an insurance broker registered with an approved broker body;(f)a technical representative registered with an approved broker body; or(g)a chief executive registered with an approved broker body.

section.name: s113
section.heading: Alleged contraventions before commencement date

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: there is a case of alleged contravention by a specified person of any requirement under an applicable rule that occurred before the commencement date; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the case has not been disposed of before the commencement date.

subsection.content: On or after the commencement date, the case may only be handled by the Authority.

The case must be handled by the Authority by reference to the applicable rule that would have applied to the specified person and the matter in question had the case been handled by the self-regulatory body concerned.

subsection.leadIn: The Authority may take one or more of the following actions—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: direct that an investigation under section 64ZZH be conducted;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: dismiss the case;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: commence disciplinary proceedings;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: if appropriate, impose a disciplinary sanction on the specified person that could have been imposed by the self-regulatory body concerned had the case been handled by the body.

part.name: P7
part.heading: Appeals that have been Made or could have been Made before Commencement Date

section.name: s114
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 7 of this Schedule
section.leadIn: In this Part—
section.def: self-regulatory body (自我規管團體)—(a)in relation to an appeal that has been made, or could have been made, to the Appeals Tribunal established by HKFI before the commencement date—means the Appeals Tribunal; or(b)in relation to an appeal that has been made, or could have been made, to an approved broker body before the commencement date—means the body;

specified person (指明人士) means—(a)an insurance agency registered with IARB;(b)an individual agent registered with IARB;(c)a technical representative registered with IARB;(d)a responsible officer registered with IARB;(e)an insurance broker registered with an approved broker body;(f)a technical representative registered with an approved broker body; or(g)a chief executive registered with an approved broker body.

section.name: s115
section.heading: Appeals not yet determined by self-regulatory bodies

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if an appeal in relation to a specified person (including application for leave to appeal)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: has been made to a self-regulatory body; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has not been finally disposed of before the commencement date.

subsection.leadIn: On or after the commencement date—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the self-regulatory body is to cease to have power to handle the appeal.

section.name: s116
section.heading: Appeals not made to self-regulatory bodies before commencement date

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a decision was made by a self-regulatory body before the commencement date in relation to a specified person;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an appeal against the decision could have been made to a self-regulatory body under the applicable rule that would have applied to the specified person and the matter in question but for this section;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the period within which an appeal against the decision could be made has not expired under the applicable rule; and

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: no appeal has been made to a self-regulatory body before the commencement date in relation to the matter in question.

subsection.content: On or after the commencement date, an appeal against the decision may only be made to the Tribunal.

section.name: s117
section.heading: Determination of appeals under sections 115 and 116 of this Schedule

subsection.content: An appeal mentioned in section 115 or 116 of this Schedule must be determined by the Tribunal by reference to the applicable rule that would have applied to the specified person and the matter in question had the application for the appeal been made to the self-regulatory body concerned.

subsection.leadIn: Part XII applies to an appeal mentioned in section 115 or 116 of this Schedule as if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a reference to a review in that Part was a reference to such an appeal; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a reference to a party to a review included the Authority.

subsection.content: However, the Tribunal must not determine the appeal by remitting the matter in question to the self-regulatory body.

part.name: P8
part.heading: Effect of Disciplinary Sanctions Imposed before Commencement Date

section.name: s118
section.heading: Interpretation of Part 8 of this Schedule
section.leadIn: In this Part—
section.def: self-regulatory body (自我規管團體)—(a)in relation to a sanction imposed on a person before the commencement date by IARB—means IARB; or(b)in relation to a sanction imposed on a person before the commencement date by an approved broker body—means the body.

section.name: s119
section.heading: Effect of disciplinary sanctions imposed by self-regulatory bodies

subsection.leadIn: If a self-regulatory body imposed a disciplinary sanction on a person before the commencement date—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: subject to sections 115 and 116 of this Schedule, the sanction continues to take effect until the expiry of the period, or the occurrence of the event, specified by the self-regulatory body.

subsection.content: If a self-regulatory body imposed a fine on a person before the commencement date and the fine or part of the fine was not paid, that fine or that part of it may be recovered by the self-regulatory body as a civil debt on or after the commencement date.

part.name: P9
part.heading: Records and Assistance Required from Certain Bodies

section.name: s120
section.heading: IARB and approved broker bodies to provide records and assistance to Authority in relation to licence and approval

subsection.leadIn: IARB and every approved broker body must provide the Authority with records and assistance that the Authority requires for—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: considering whether a person may be regarded as having been granted a licence or approval under Division 2, 3, 4, 5, 6, 7 or 8 of Part 5 of this Schedule;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: considering whether a person may be granted a licence or approval under section 64U, 64W, 64Y, 64ZA, 64ZC, 64ZE or 64ZF; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: compiling a complete and accurate register of every such persons.

subsection.leadIn: The records referred to in subsection (1) do not include a notification of change of particulars, or of the appointment, of any of the following persons that has not been processed or validly registered with IARB or the approved broker body by a date specified by the Authority—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an insurance agency registered with IARB;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an individual agent registered with IARB;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a technical representative registered with IARB;

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a responsible officer registered with IARB;

paragraph.name: e
paragraph.content: an insurance broker registered with an approved broker body;

paragraph.name: f
paragraph.content: a technical representative registered with an approved broker body;

paragraph.name: g
paragraph.content: a chief executive registered with an approved broker body.

subsection.content: The records and assistance must be provided to the Authority in the manner, and within the time, specified by the Authority.

section.name: s121
section.heading: Self-regulatory bodies to provide records and assistance to Authority in relation to cases of alleged contravention, appeals and disciplinary sanctions

subsection.leadIn: A self-regulatory body must provide the Authority with records and assistance that the Authority requires for compiling a complete and accurate record of—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the cases of alleged contravention of the requirements under the applicable rules that have been handled by the body;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the appeals (including applications for leave to appeal) that have been made to the body; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the disciplinary sanctions that have been imposed by the body.

subsection.content: The records and assistance must be provided to the Authority in the manner, and within the time, specified by the Authority.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: self-regulatory body (自我規管團體)—(a)in relation to a case handled by IARB or a sanction imposed by IARB—means IARB;(b)in relation to an appeal made to the Appeals Tribunal established by HKFI—means the Appeals Tribunal; or(c)in relation to a case handled by an approved broker body, an appeal made to an approved broker body or a sanction imposed by an approved broker body—means the body.

section.name: s122
section.heading: Records to be provided under sections 120 and 121 of this Schedule

subsection.content: In relation to a record provided by a person to the Authority under section 120 or 121 of this Schedule, all the rights and obligations of the person subsisting immediately before the provision are taken to be transferred to the Authority on the provision of the record.

The Authority must ensure that there are in place proper procedures and systems to safeguard against unauthorized access to, or unauthorized use of, the records provided under sections 120 and 121 of this Schedule.

In relation to personal data provided under sections 120 and 121 of this Schedule, the Personal Data (Privacy) Ordinance (Cap. 486) applies as if the data had been received by the Authority rather than the person concerned.

In relation to personal data provided under sections 120 and 121 of this Schedule, the Authority must ensure that the personal data is used, disclosed and retained for the purposes set out in those sections and the performance of its functions under this Ordinance.

subsection.leadIn: The provision of a record by a person to the Authority under section 120 or 121 of this Schedule does not amount to—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a breach of duty of confidentiality to which the person is subject immediately before the provision; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a contravention by the person or the Authority of the Personal Data (Privacy) Ordinance (Cap. 486).

section.name: s123
section.heading: HKFI to provide rules to Authority

subsection.content: HKFI must provide the Authority with a complete set of rules that have been from time to time issued or approved by HKFI, or issued by IARB under the authority of HKFI, in relation to a person specified in subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: The person specified for subsection (1) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an insurance agency registered with IARB;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: an individual agent registered with IARB;

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a technical representative registered with IARB; or

paragraph.name: d
paragraph.content: a responsible officer registered with IARB.

subsection.content: The rules must be provided to the Authority in the manner, and within the time, specified by the Authority.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: rule (規則) includes—(a)the code of practice for the administration of insurance agents issued by HKFI under section 67 of the pre-amended Ordinance;(b)the guidance notes issued by IARB for the code of practice; and(c)the guidance notes issued by HKFI in relation to the conduct requirements for a person specified in subsection (2).

subsection.content: In this section, a reference to a rule is a reference to the rule and any other rule replacing, amending or supplementing the rule from time to time.

section.name: s124
section.heading: Approved broker bodies to provide rules to Authority

subsection.content: An approved broker body must provide the Authority with a complete set of rules that have been from time to time issued by the body in relation to a person specified in subsection (2).

subsection.leadIn: The person specified for subsection (1) is—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an insurance broker registered with the body;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: a technical representative registered with the body; or

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: a chief executive registered with the body.

subsection.content: The rules must be provided to the Authority in the manner, and within the time, specified by the Authority.

subsection.leadIn: In this section—
subsection.def: rule (規則), in relation to an approved broker body, includes—(a)its Memorandum and Articles of Association;(b)a rule, regulation, guideline, by-law or code of conduct made by the body in accordance with its Memorandum and Articles of Association; and(c)a circular issued by the body in relation to the conduct requirements for a person registered with the body.

subsection.content: In this section, a reference to a rule is a reference to the rule and any other rule replacing, amending or supplementing the rule from time to time.

section.name: s125
section.heading: Authority to publish rules under sections 123 and 124 of this Schedule

subsection.leadIn: The Authority must, as soon as practicable after receiving a rule under section 123 or 124 of this Schedule—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: publish the rule in the Gazette; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: make the content of the rule available to any person for inspection free of charge on the Internet.

subsection.content: A rule published under subsection (1) is not subsidiary legislation.

section.name: s126
section.heading: Failure to comply with requirement under section 120, 121, 123 or 124 of this Schedule

subsection.content: If a person fails to comply with a requirement under section 120, 121, 123 or 124 of this Schedule, the Authority may apply by originating summons to the Court of First Instance for an inquiry into the failure.

subsection.leadIn: On an application under subsection (1), the Court of First Instance—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: on being satisfied that there is no reasonable excuse for the person not to comply with the requirement, may order the person to comply with the requirement within the time specified by the Court; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: on being satisfied that the failure was without reasonable excuse, may punish the person, and any other person knowingly involved in the failure, in the same manner as if the person and that other person had been guilty of contempt of court.

subsection.content: An originating summons under subsection (1) is to be in Form No. 10 in Appendix A to the Rules of the High Court (Cap. 4 sub. leg. A).

schedule.name: sch12
schedule.heading: Savings and Transitional Arrangements for Insurance (Amendment) Ordinance 2023

section.name: s1
section.heading: Interpretation (Part 1 of Schedule 12)
section.leadIn: In this Part—
section.def: Amendment Ordinance (《修訂條例》) means the Insurance (Amendment) Ordinance 2023 (20 of 2023);
*commencement date (實施日期) means the date on which section 18 of the Amendment Ordinance comes into operation;
pre-amended Ordinance (《原有條例》) means this Ordinance as in force immediately before the commencement date.

section.name: s2
section.heading: Pre-existing shareholder controller of HK insurer

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2) applies to a person if, immediately before the commencement date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person has, alone or with an associate (as defined by section 9(4)) or through a nominee, been entitled to exercise, or control the exercise of, 15% or more but less than 50%, of the voting power at a general meeting of an HK insurer (other than a special purpose insurer); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the conditions specified in subsection (5) have been satisfied in relation to the person.

subsection.content: On the commencement date, the person is taken to be approved under section 13B(2B) to be a minority shareholder controller of the insurer.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (4) applies to a person if, immediately before the commencement date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person has, alone or with an associate (as defined by section 9(4)) or through a nominee, been entitled to exercise, or control the exercise of, 50% or more of the voting power at a general meeting of an HK insurer (other than a special purpose insurer); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the conditions specified in subsection (5) have been satisfied in relation to the person.

subsection.content: On the commencement date, the person is taken to be approved under section 13B(2B) to be a majority shareholder controller of the insurer.

subsection.leadIn: For the purposes of subsections (1) and (3), the conditions are that—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a written notice under the former section 14(2) has been delivered to the Authority in relation to the person becoming a controller (as defined by the former section 13B(1)) of the HK insurer;

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: there is no objection under the former section 13B(4) to the person being such a controller in effect under section 116; and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the shares by virtue of which the person has become such a controller are not subject to any restrictions under section 13C(2).

section.name: s3
section.heading: Potential shareholder controller of HK insurer

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to a person if, immediately before the commencement date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the person is not a controller (as defined by the former section 13B(1)) of an HK insurer (other than a special purpose insurer); but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the conditions under the former section 13B(2)(a), (ab) and (b) have been satisfied in relation to the person.

subsection.leadIn: On the first occasion, on or after the commencement date, on which the person becomes any shareholder controller of the HK insurer, the person is taken to be approved under section 13B(2B) to be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the person becomes a minority shareholder controller of the insurer on that occasion—a minority shareholder controller of the insurer; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the person becomes a majority shareholder controller of the insurer on that occasion—a majority shareholder controller of the insurer.

section.name: s4
section.heading: Pre-existing notice under former section 13B(2)(a)

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if, immediately before the commencement date—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: a prescribed fee has been paid under the former section 13B(2)(ab); and

paragraph.name: c
paragraph.content: the condition under the former section 13B(2)(b) has not been satisfied in relation to the person.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (3), if the Authority has served a preliminary notice of objection under the former section 13B(4) on the person immediately before the commencement date, the Authority is to continue to deal with the objection in accordance with the pre-amended Ordinance as if the Amendment Ordinance had not been enacted.

subsection.leadIn: If, on or after the commencement date, the objection mentioned in subsection (2) takes effect under section 116, the objection is taken to be a refusal under section 13B(2H) to approve the person to be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the person intends to become a controller (as defined by the former section 13B(1)) that is equivalent to a minority shareholder controller of the HK insurer—a minority shareholder controller of the insurer; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the person intends to become a controller (as defined by the former section 13B(1)) that is equivalent to a majority shareholder controller of the HK insurer—a majority shareholder controller of the insurer.

subsection.content: Subject to subsections (5), (6) and (7), if the Authority has not served a notice of objection under the former section 13B(4) on the person (relevant person) immediately before the commencement date, the Authority is to continue to deal with the notice mentioned in subsection (1)(a) in accordance with the pre-amended Ordinance as if the Amendment Ordinance had not been enacted.
Subsection (6) applies if the condition under the former section 13B(2)(b) becomes satisfied in relation to the relevant person at any time on or after the commencement date.

subsection.leadIn: On the first occasion, after the time mentioned in subsection (5), on which the relevant person becomes any shareholder controller of the HK insurer, the person is taken to be approved under section 13B(2B) to be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the person becomes a minority shareholder controller of the insurer on that occasion—a minority shareholder controller of the insurer; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the person becomes a majority shareholder controller of the insurer on that occasion—a majority shareholder controller of the insurer.

subsection.leadIn: If the condition under the former section 13B(2)(b) cannot be satisfied in relation to the relevant person because of a notice of objection served on the relevant person under the former section 13B(4) on or after the commencement date by virtue of subsection (4), the notice of objection is taken to be a notice under section 13B(2H) to refuse to approve the person to be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the person intends to become a controller that is equivalent to a minority shareholder controller of the HK insurer—a minority shareholder controller of the insurer; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the person intends to become a controller that is equivalent to a majority shareholder controller of the HK insurer—a majority shareholder controller of the insurer.

section.name: s5
section.heading: Pre-existing objection to shareholder controller of HK insurer

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: immediately before the commencement date—

subparagraph.content: the Authority has served on a person a preliminary notice of objection under the former section 13B(4) to object to the person being a controller (as defined by the former section 13B(1)) of an HK insurer; and
the objection under the former section 13B(4) has not taken effect under section 116; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the preliminary notice of objection is not a notice in relation to which section 4(2) of this Schedule applies.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (3), on and after the commencement date, the Authority is to continue to deal with the objection in accordance with the pre-amended Ordinance as if the Amendment Ordinance had not been enacted.

subsection.leadIn: If the objection takes effect under section 116 on or after the commencement date, the objection is taken to be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the person is a minority shareholder controller of an HK insurer—a refusal to approve the person to be a minority shareholder controller of the insurer under section 13B(2H); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the person is a majority shareholder controller of an HK insurer—a refusal to approve the person to be a majority shareholder controller of the insurer under section 13B(2H).

section.name: s6
section.heading: Pre-existing restrictions and outstanding applications under former section 13C

subsection.content: If, immediately before the commencement date, the Authority has served a notice under section 13C(2) on a person to direct any shares to be subject to any restrictions mentioned in that section, the former section 13C continues to apply in relation to the restrictions as if the Amendment Ordinance had not been enacted.

If, immediately before the commencement date, the Authority has applied for an order under section 13C(5) or (8) in relation to any shares, the former section 13C continues to apply in relation to the application and any order made under section 13C(5) or (8) as if the Amendment Ordinance had not been enacted.

section.name: s7
section.heading: Interpretation (Part 2 of Schedule 12)
section.leadIn: In this Part—
section.def: Amendment Ordinance (《修訂條例》) means the Insurance (Amendment) Ordinance 2023 (20 of 2023);
*commencement date (實施日期) means the date on which section 24 of the Amendment Ordinance comes into operation;
pre-amended Ordinance (《原有條例》) means this Ordinance as in force immediately before the commencement date.

section.name: s8
section.heading: Pre-existing actuary of authorized insurer carrying on long term business

subsection.content: This section applies if, immediately before the commencement date, a person is an actuary appointed by an authorized insurer under the former section 15(1)(b) in compliance with the former section 15(3A).

subsection.leadIn: On and after the commencement date, the person mentioned in subsection (1)—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.leadIn: continues to be the authorized insurer’s actuary without the need for—

subparagraph.content: a fresh appointment under section 15AAA(1); or
a fresh approval under section 15AAAB(2); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: is taken to be appointed by the insurer under the relevant provision.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (2)—
subsection.def: relevant provision (有關條文), in relation to an authorized insurer, means—(a)if the insurer is one described in section 21B(1)—section 15AAA(1)(a); or(b)if the insurer is one described in section 21B(4) or (7)—section 15AAA(1)(b).

section.name: s9
section.heading: Approval of appointment of person as actuary of authorized insurer

subsection.leadIn: This section applies in relation to a person if, immediately before the commencement date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an approval of the person’s appointment as an actuary of an authorized insurer under the former section 15(3B) is in effect; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the person is not appointed as an actuary by the insurer under the former section 15(1)(b).

subsection.content: On the commencement date, the approval under the former section 15(3B) is taken to be an approval under section 15AAAB(2).

section.name: s10
section.heading: Outstanding application for approval of appointment of actuary of authorized insurer

subsection.leadIn: If, immediately before the commencement date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an authorized insurer has made an application under the former section 15(3B)(a) for an approval of a person’s appointment as an actuary of the authorized insurer; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the application has not been determined,

subsection.continued: subject to subsections (2) and (3), on and after that date, the Authority is to determine the application in accordance with the pre-amended Ordinance as if the Amendment Ordinance had not been enacted.

subsection.content: If the Authority approves the application in accordance with the pre-amended Ordinance under subsection (1), the appointment is taken to be approved under section 15AAAB(2).

If the Authority rejects the application in accordance with the pre-amended Ordinance under subsection (1), the rejection is taken to be a refusal to approve the person’s appointment as an actuary of the authorized insurer under section 15AAAB(4).

section.name: s11
section.heading: Pre-existing refusal of approval of actuary of authorized insurer

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if, immediately before the commencement date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Authority has given a notice of refusal to approve a person’s appointment as an actuary of an authorized insurer under the former section 15(3D); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the refusal under that section has not taken effect under section 116.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (3), on and after the commencement date, the Authority is to continue to deal with the refusal in accordance with the pre-amended Ordinance as if the Amendment Ordinance had not been enacted.

If the refusal takes effect under section 116 on or after the commencement date, the refusal is taken to be a refusal to approve the person’s appointment as an actuary of the authorized insurer under section 15AAAB(4).

section.name: s12
section.heading: Pre-existing revocation of approval of appointment of actuary of authorized insurer

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if, immediately before the commencement date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Authority has served a notice of revocation of the approval of a person’s appointment as an actuary of an authorized insurer on the insurer and the person under the former section 15(3F); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the revocation under that section has not taken effect under section 116.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (3), on and after the commencement date, the Authority is to continue to deal with the revocation in accordance with the pre-amended Ordinance as if the Amendment Ordinance had not been enacted.

If the revocation takes effect under section 116 on or after the commencement date, the revocation is taken to be a revocation of the approval of the person’s appointment as an actuary of the authorized insurer under section 15AABA(1).

section.name: s13
section.heading: Pre-existing objection to appointment of actuary of authorized insurer

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if, immediately before the commencement date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Authority has served a notice of objection to a person’s appointment as an actuary of an authorized insurer on the insurer and the person under the former section 15B(2A); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the objection under that section has not taken effect under section 116.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (3), on and after the commencement date, the Authority is to continue to deal with the objection in accordance with the pre-amended Ordinance as if the Amendment Ordinance had not been enacted.

If the objection takes effect under section 116 on or after the commencement date, the objection is taken to be a revocation of the approval of the person’s appointment as an actuary of the authorized insurer under section 15AABA(1).

part.name: P3
part.heading: Shareholder Controllers of Designated Insurance Holding Company

section.name: s14
section.heading: Interpretation (Part 3 of Schedule 12)
section.leadIn: In this Part—
section.def: Amendment Ordinance (《修訂條例》) means the Insurance (Amendment) Ordinance 2023 (20 of 2023);
*commencement date (實施日期) means the date on which section 79 of the Amendment Ordinance comes into operation;
pre-amended Ordinance (《原有條例》) means this Ordinance as in force immediately before the commencement date.

section.name: s15
section.heading: Approval for shareholder controller of designated insurance holding company

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (2) applies to a person who, immediately before the commencement date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: alone or with an associate (as defined by the former section 95A(1)) or through a nominee, has been entitled to exercise, or control the exercise of, 15% or more but less than 50%, of the voting power at a general meeting of a designated insurance holding company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has been approved, or taken to be approved, under the former section 95M to be a shareholder controller (as defined by the former section 95A(1)) of the company.

subsection.content: On the commencement date, the person is taken to be approved under section 95M to be a minority shareholder controller of the company.

subsection.leadIn: Subsection (4) applies to a person who, immediately before the commencement date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: alone or with an associate (as defined by the former section 95A(1)) or through a nominee, has been entitled to exercise, or control the exercise of, 50% or more of the voting power at a general meeting of a designated insurance holding company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has been approved, or taken to be approved, under the former section 95M to be a shareholder controller (as defined by the former section 95A(1)) of the company.

subsection.content: On the commencement date, the person is taken to be approved under section 95M to be a majority shareholder controller of the company.

subsection.leadIn: However, subsection (2) or (4) does not apply to a person if, immediately before the commencement date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Authority has served a notice under the former section 95N(3) on the person objecting to the person being a shareholder controller (as defined by the former section 95A(1)) of the designated insurance holding company concerned; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the objection has taken effect under section 116.

section.name: s16
section.heading: Potential shareholder controller of designated insurance holding company

subsection.leadIn: This section applies to a person if, immediately before the commencement date, the person—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: is not a shareholder controller (as defined by the former section 95A(1)) of a designated insurance holding company; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: has been approved, or taken to be approved, under the former section 95M to be a shareholder controller (as defined by the former section 95A(1)) of the company.

subsection.leadIn: On the first occasion, on or after the commencement date, on which the person becomes any shareholder controller of the designated insurance holding company, the person is taken to be approved under section 95M to be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the person becomes a minority shareholder controller of the company on that occasion—a minority shareholder controller of the company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the person becomes a majority shareholder controller of the company on that occasion—a majority shareholder controller of the company.

section.name: s17
section.heading: Outstanding application for approval of shareholder controller of designated insurance holding company

subsection.leadIn: If, immediately before the commencement date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: a person has made an application under the former section 95I(2), 95K(2) or 95L(5) for an approval under the former section 95M to be a shareholder controller (as defined by the former section 95A(1)) of a designated insurance holding company; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the application has not been determined,

subsection.continued: subject to subsections (2) and (3), on and after that date, the Authority is to determine the application in accordance with the pre-amended Ordinance as if the Amendment Ordinance had not been enacted.

subsection.leadIn: If the Authority approves the application in accordance with the pre-amended Ordinance under subsection (1), the approval is taken to be an approval under section 95M(1) for the person to be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the person is or intends to become a shareholder controller (as defined by the former section 95A(1)) that is equivalent to a minority shareholder controller of the designated insurance holding company—a minority shareholder controller of the company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the person is or intends to become a shareholder controller (as defined by the former section 95A(1)) that is equivalent to a majority shareholder controller of the designated insurance holding company—a majority shareholder controller of the company.

subsection.leadIn: If the Authority rejects the application in accordance with the pre-amended Ordinance under subsection (1), the rejection is taken to be a refusal under section 95M(4) to approve the person to be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the person is or intends to become a shareholder controller (as defined by the former section 95A(1)) that is equivalent to a minority shareholder controller of the designated insurance holding company—a minority shareholder controller of the company; or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the person is or intends to become a shareholder controller (as defined by the former section 95A(1)) that is equivalent to a majority shareholder controller of the designated insurance holding company—a majority shareholder controller of the company.

section.name: s18
section.heading: Pre-existing objection to shareholder controller of designated insurance holding company

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if, immediately before the commencement date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the Authority has served a notice of objection to a person being a shareholder controller (as defined by the former section 95A(1)) of a designated insurance holding company on the person under the former section 95N(3); and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the objection under that section has not taken effect under section 116.

subsection.content: Subject to subsection (3), on and after the commencement date, the Authority is to continue to deal with the objection in accordance with the pre-amended Ordinance as if the Amendment Ordinance had not been enacted.

subsection.leadIn: If the objection takes effect under section 116 on or after the commencement date, the objection is taken to be—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: if the person is a minority shareholder controller of the company—an objection to the person being a minority shareholder controller of the company under section 95N(3); or

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: if the person is a majority shareholder controller of the company—an objection to the person being any shareholder controller of the company under section 95N(3B)(b).

section.name: s19
section.heading: Interpretation (Part 4 of Schedule 12)
section.leadIn: In this Part—
section.def: Amendment Ordinance (《修訂條例》) means the Insurance (Amendment) Ordinance 2023 (20 of 2023);

*commencement date (實施日期)—(a)in relation to a matter falling within paragraph (a) of the definition of pre-existing decision—means the date on which section 18 of the Amendment Ordinance comes into operation;(b)in relation to a matter falling within paragraph (b), (c) or (d) of the definition of pre-existing decision—means the date on which section 24 of the Amendment Ordinance comes into operation; or(c)in relation to a matter falling within paragraph (e) or (f) of the definition of pre-existing decision—means the date on which section 79 of the Amendment Ordinance comes into operation;
pre-amended Ordinance (《原有條例》) means this Ordinance as in force immediately before the commencement date;

pre-existing decision (原有決定) means any of the following specified decisions taking place before the commencement date—(a)an objection to a person becoming or being a controller (as defined by the former section 13B(1)) of an authorized insurer under the former section 13B(4);(b)a refusal to approve the appointment of a person as an actuary of an authorized insurer under the former section 15(3D);(c)a revocation of the approval of the appointment of a person as an actuary of an authorized insurer under the former section 15(3F);(d)an objection to the appointment of a person as an actuary of an authorized insurer under the former section 15B(2A);(e)a refusal to approve a person to be a shareholder controller of a designated insurance holding company under the former section 95M(4);(f)an objection to a person being a shareholder controller of a designated insurance holding company under the former section 95N(3).

section.name: s20
section.heading: Application for review not made before commencement date

subsection.leadIn: If, immediately before the commencement date—

paragraph.name: a
b
paragraph.content: the period for exercising the right has not ended,

subsection.continued: on and after the commencement date, the person may continue to exercise the right as if the Amendment Ordinance had not been enacted.

subsection.content: If the person exercises the right to apply to the Tribunal for a review under subsection (1), the Tribunal is to deal with the review as if the Amendment Ordinance had not been enacted.

section.name: s21
section.heading: Review not yet determined before commencement date

subsection.leadIn: This section applies if, immediately before the commencement date—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: an application for review of a pre-existing decision has been made to the Tribunal under section 100; but

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the review has not yet been determined under section 101.

subsection.content: On and after the commencement date, the Tribunal is to continue to deal with the review as if the Amendment Ordinance had not been enacted.

section.name: s22
section.heading: Determination of review on or after commencement date

subsection.content: This section applies in relation to a review of a pre-existing decision determined by the Tribunal on or after the commencement date under section 101 by virtue of section 20 or 21 of this Schedule.

subsection.leadIn: If the Tribunal varies, or substitutes another decision for, the pre-existing decision, section 101(3)(a), (b) and (c) applies to the decision as varied or substituted as if—

paragraph.name: a
paragraph.content: the review in question mentioned in section 101(3)(a) had been a review of the equivalent decision of the pre-existing decision; and

paragraph.name: b
paragraph.content: the decision mentioned in section 101(3)(b) and (c) had been the equivalent decision of the pre-existing decision.

subsection.leadIn: In subsection (2)—
subsection.def: equivalent decision (相等決定)—(a)in relation to a matter falling within paragraph (a) of the definition of pre-existing decision in section 19 of this Schedule—(i)if the person is or intends to become a controller (as defined by the former section 13B(1)) that is equivalent to a minority shareholder controller of the authorized insurer—means a refusal to approve the person to be a minority shareholder controller of the insurer under section 13B(2H); or(ii)if the person is or intends to become a controller (as defined by the former section 13B(1)) that is equivalent to a majority shareholder controller of the authorized insurer—means a refusal to approve the person to be a majority shareholder controller of the insurer under section 13B(2H);(b)in relation to a matter falling within paragraph (b) of the definition of pre-existing decision in section 19 of this Schedule—means a refusal to approve the person’s appointment as an actuary of the authorized insurer under section 15AAAB(4);(c)in relation to a matter falling within paragraph (c) of the definition of pre-existing decision in section 19 of this Schedule—means a revocation of the approval of the person’s appointment as an actuary of the authorized insurer under section 15AABA(1);(d)in relation to a matter falling within paragraph (d) of the definition of pre-existing decision in section 19 of this Schedule—means a revocation of the approval of the person’s appointment as an actuary of the authorized insurer under section 15AABA(1);(e)in relation to a matter falling within paragraph (e) of the definition of pre-existing decision in section 19 of this Schedule—(i)if the person is or intends to become a shareholder controller (as defined by the former section 95A(1)) that is equivalent to a minority shareholder controller of the designated insurance holding company—means a refusal to approve the person to be a minority shareholder controller of the company under section 95M(4); or(ii)if the person is or intends to become a shareholder controller (as defined by the former section 95A(1)) that is equivalent to a majority shareholder controller of the designated insurance holding company—means a refusal to approve the person to be a majority shareholder controller of the company under section 95M(4); or(f)in relation to a matter falling within paragraph (f) of the definition of pre-existing decision in section 19 of this Schedule—(i)if the person is a minority shareholder controller of the designated insurance holding company—means an objection to the person being a minority shareholder controller of the company under section 95N(3); or(ii)if the person is a majority shareholder controller of the designated insurance holding company—means an objection to the person being any shareholder controller of the company under section 95N(3B)(b).
